She is probably one of the best servers in any restaurant, anywhere!     My friend and I like to try many different menu items, and we shared everything.  Each dish was split for us in the kitchen. That is such a nice touch. We did order too much food, and I had to take some home. It was still great the next day. People sometimes ask us why we eat at Gibson's since we don't eat meat. I answer that the whitefish is fabulous. The tomato and goat cheese and the pecan pie were also wonderful.    I had just come back from New York and ate at some of the trendiest New York restaurants. None of them is as good as Gibson's. I will come back for each birthday and many other celebrations also. Why not go and celebrate life!

Planning a wedding presents many decisions and if you're someone like me, the food is on the top of the list, so I wanted to make sure my guests were served excellent food, in a good neighborhood that would showcase Chicago's fun side as well as a great, historic atmosphere that would give anyone a great Chicago experience.  I requested private dining menus from at least 20 places in the city, prices ranged dramatically, some were out of control!  I found Gibson's to be extremely reasonable, the private rooms were perfect and the woman helping me, Lynette, was very helpful which made our decision very easy, we would have our reception at the famous Gibson's! Day of: Upon arrival, Lynette was waiting at the door leading guests into the private dining room, entering into the room, the bar was stocked, hors d'oeuvres passed, staff everywhere assisting everyone.  Cesar, head wait staff guy (I think) introduced himself to me and my groom and told us to flag him if we needed anything.  And oh my, was he ever RIGHT THERE to help.  Everything from turning down the music while speeches were being made to refreshing cocktails to merely smiling and being pleasant.  I could go on and on about the treatment we received, you get the point.  The neighborhood, the food, the atmosphere, the staff, the experience...superb.

3.5 stars overall.   Came here with my hubby for date night when visiting Chicago. Sat outside which was fun to people watch. Service was great as well. We both started with salads with blue cheese dressing. My husband thought it was the best blue cheese dressing ever.  Now on to the main event, the steak. I ordered the 10oz filet medium well. It came out more like a medium rare. My husband ordered the WR Chicago Cut (ribeye) medium rare. His came out rare (cool in the middle). We both sent them back for some more "heat". They both came out extra charred and dry. Unfortunately it ruined the steak. Our server was really nice and comped us with a gigantic piece of cake.  Overall 3.5 Service 5 Ambiance 5 Steak 3

Oh my gosh, everything here was so amazingly delicious. If you're a vegetarian or otherwise do not enjoy red meat, do not go. Duh. But if you like a good steak, albeit expensive steak, please do go to Gibsons'.  First of all, the decor looks like something from the Sopranos. I've never seen the Sopranos, it just looks like a restaurant that I imagine the Sopranos would enjoy. Next, there is a "meat lesson" during which your waiter shows you a plate of uncooked various meat cuts and tells you a bit about each. And third, the food. Oh the food. It is SO good! The least you could expect from a steakhouse would be appropriately cooked and appreciated steak, and it delivers. But additionally, the sides? Yum. I went with two other steak lovers and we each had a salad (comes with the meal, waste of valuable meat space, I know), we split a twice baked potato (holy smokes) and an order of spinach and broccoli (good, and makes you feel slightly less "guilty" about all of the meat and carbohydrates surrounding your person), and it was so delicious and more than enough food (too much, even).   It is a pricey venue, but next time I am in Chicago I fully intend to bring my boyfriend here (himself a lover of good steak, although allergic to potatoes so we will have to try the second best baked "sweet potato" as a plan B side). It's a special night out kind of expensive place, but the memory will last and so it's worth it.
Crab cake here is the best ever.  Birthday experience here, very nice customer service. Give me good memories

Steak! Having a free night to myself in Chicago I Yelped around the map and this place popped up with 700+ reviews- so I figured I should take a look. There is not a whole lot more i can add that hasn't been said already:  Great steaks, great atmosphere, great servers and a kicking bar area.  The only down side is that parking totally sucks ass but there are valets there to help ease the pain of parking. Prices were average for this type of place and you will not be disappointed with the meat.  Sides were all very good and the waiter kept us from going crazy and ordering too much. It is a big and loud place - so be prepared for that!  Bathrooms are a hike upstairs. Absolutely would go back if in town again. Give it a shot!

One of Chicago finest Steakhouse in Great area of the city " Rush Street" Of course since I moved to Chicago I hear about Gibson, I tired first time in February 1997 for the first time. I usually take my Out of town guests to Gibson's if they are graving Steak. Food and wine list is amazing, Please try it and let me know.
Top 5 Steaks in my Life. Everything was top notch and delicious. The service was fantastic and was worth every penny.

I had a buddy in town that has never been to Chicago, so we went to Gibson's.  I have not been there in years, but I was very disappointed.  I ordered the 14 oz filet and I didnt think it was tasty as all.  I ordered it Medium Rare and it came Medium.  I am not the kind of person to send a steak back so I didnt.  The only good thing was I show Mark Cuban eating there, that was cool.  Wont be going back anytime soon.

I don't know about the steak but I hope to find out some day. I do know this though: The combination of a nice red, 74 degrees and sitting outside, excellent service, Chicago and pleasant company is 5 stars every time. Truly a cafe / brasserie atmosphere.

Always one of my favoritre. A great steak house for dinner but it's also a great lunch brunch spot with a solid cocktail menu and lunch options. I enjoyed a half wedge salad and then a ribeye open faced sandwich which really hit the spot.

With so many steak houses to choose from in this part of Chicago, competition is fierce.  Gibson's is on the "needs improvement" side.   Prices are consistent, outrageous, and the food is 3*.  Service is 3*  Wine list has outrageous markups, but we did find a few moderate priced (50$) winners. They did do a nice thing.  We ordered 9 dishes for our 12-top and they cut each dish so we could go family style.  It worked out perfectly for our needs.   We were there 8 on Thursday and it was shoulder to shoulder busy.  They have a huge happy hour business. Next time we'll try another to see how they stack up.

You won't find many steaks that stack up to those served at Gibsons.  I hosted a customer dinner here and it was a great time.....minus the server. I could tell he was a bit  annoyed with my guests (one had to take an important call, then  others were talking during his introduction spiel), but trying to stiff us out of the complimentary salads? I don't think so brother!  I heard you even if my guests did not, and I want my salad.  When we are about to spend $550+ on dinner, please be patient. Overall, our meals were great.  One guest had swordfish prepared from off the menu, she was very happy.  The desserts are just insane, in a good way. One was enough for 5 guests, but we ordered two. Oops.  I'll be back Gibsons, get your attitude right.

One of the best restaurants, and especially one of the top three steak houses in Chicago, if not the top.  We have never had a bad meal or bad service here.  We also had our wedding rehearsal dinner here.  The staff was great to work with and the location amazing.  The room we had was large, yet it still felt intimate.  The service was exceptional and the price was high, yet they could have charged signifcantly more.  Anyone who goes there and does not try the Macadamia Pie is crazy.

Ok.  So not better than cut in LA. We have to start off with that.  Steak was solid - better than your high end chains like Flemings and Morton's. For the food - a high 3. The service - a 5+. Mo - our server was awesome. He went above and beyond. Took really good care of us - especially the kids.  Probably one of the friendliest, most helpful servers I've ever had. High end restaurants  always have a good staff - but it's phony. They are nice because they have to be. Not Mo - he was just that awesome and genuinely nice.  I'd go back again just to be seated in his section. On another note - the side dishes are good size For sharing. The deserts are gigantic - 1 piece of anything can be shared by 4 or 5.

Better this time than last, different server who was a tad slow and forgot a few things but hey, he made up for it in personality and acknowledging it.  Last year had a terrible server, this time was better and the food was much better too.  Up 1 star from last review.

I must have said "MMM" "MMM" "MMM" about four times during my meal. This place is not only professionally staffed, but the food is cooked to perfection. I am very impressed and extremely satisfied and will definitely be back! Worth every penny:)

The first thing I thought as I was exploring the myriad of pictures was "Man, a lot of people that have been in Playboy have eaten here".  Unfortunately, none were there the night I showed up... or was there?  hmm...   Anyway, this was hands down the best place I've eaten in Chicago and probably one of the best 2 or 3 steaks I've ever eaten.  The steak is cooked perfectly, just the way you ask.  The flavors are indescribable, so however long they age it, is the perfect amount of time.  The wait staff, hostess and bartenders were also some of the best we had met during our trip.  Super friendly and knowledgeable, which is sadly uncommon nowadays.   Man, I wish there was a Gibson's in California.  I would probably go at least once a week.  Not the best for the heart, but it'd be worth it.

Excellent...any time of the day!  Not a quiet dining experience.  Lets face it, you go there to eat...you can talk later.  Steaks are the best in the business.  Appetizers are awesome.  C'mon, we're talking about Gibsons.

I generally stay away from the "viagra triangle" because that's just not my scene at all. I would not have gone into this restaurant as it just seems like it would be so over the top in price, but this was a dinner gift so I went. I've been in the restaurant business for a very long time and I've seen and worked with a lot of talented servers and wait staff. Our server Greg could have sold me a rust bucket of a car without an engine, and I would have bought it! He's good, as good as they get! I had the Chicago Cut bone in, the side of mushrooms and many...many Matildas. I think 5 full sized guys in a booth is a little much but Greg was so good at "removing the evidence..." (removing empty drinks and replacing with new ones...) I didn't care about our tight quarters. Everything we ate and drank was magical. The steaks are EVERY BIT what they are promised to be. That place is top notch, from service to food. Did I mention how good Greg is? Ask for him, listen to him, tip him appropriately.
Definitely worth it! The best steak I had in the United States! Juicy, yummy! My girlfriedn and I had Filet, T-Bone, Spinach, Shrimp Cocktail, and Strawberry Shortcake tonight.

Some colleagues from out of town asked me to recommend a "classic Chicago steakhouse" with a private dining room for a celebratory dinner a few weeks ago.  I gave them a few suggestions, and they opted for Gibson's.  And I must say, Gibson's hit this one out of the park. When we showed up for the dinner, we were escorted to the private room that is directly above the intersection of State & Bellevue, with a clear view of the Viagra Triangle.  The staff was extremely attentive.  I ordered the tomato & goat cheese appetizer, which was delicious.  I had the small filet for my main, and it was perfectly cooked.  I also love that the servers at Gibson's present the tray of the various cuts of meat when taking orders - I think it's a nice touch.  We ordered a number of desserts to share at the table - they were obscenely large.  Our waiters tried to warn us, but we didn't believe them...  Everyone seemed really happy (and full) after the meal, and I felt good about making a great recommendation.

Was not impressed, menu rather pricey, waiter lost interest in us when we did not select a steak dinner for our meal also did not make an effort to inquire how our selected meal was. Large meal proportions, not recomennended for small eaters.

Well, I was kind of surprised that I didn't like this place all that much. The salmon I got was far too tough and lacked flavor (I really had to use up the sauce you get on the side), the mashed potatoes were equally bland, and to top it off so was the brocolli. The saving grace for this place is that they make the best Long Island Iced Teas that I've ever had and I've had many a Long Island Iced Tea.

While on a trip to Chicago with the boyfriend, we had a reservation at Gibsons and when we got there, the place was packed and we had to wait but never fear because we'll start the celebration and have a drink at the bar, listen to the guy playing piano, and watch a game on one of their several televisitons.  Place is notorious (referenced in the show "the League" and well established and it reflects in it's clientele (well to do locals and tourists, celebs, politcians, etc.). Finally, we were called to our table, our server came by and greeted us with menus.  They brought out salad appetizers but lets be serious, I'm neither a fan of iceberg lettuce, nor did I come here for salad.  Boyfriend ordered the rib eye and I, ladies and gentlemen, ordered the Porterhouse.  To which the stunned waiter took one look and little old me, gasped while saying, "it's big, you sure you can finish?"  I looked at him sternly and said, "Challenge accepted! aka Watch me!" Oh and a side of asparagus because we like that. Steaks come out.  Boyfriend LOVES his steak and I LOVE mine because well, porterhouse makes me a happy, VERY HAPPY gal!  Steaks perfectly seared and cooked to our liking and for me thats mooooo! Fastastic pick for a steakhouse in Chicago, the boyfriend did a great job in his choice!  I'd definitely go again!

I've been to Gibson's about...5 times now and have grown a loyalty to this place as my go-to steakhouse in Chicago.  That is even despite my most recent visit there this past weekend, where my steak was overcooked, then undercooked, then cooked just right and the side, a double baked potato was a little on the cool side.  Even despite that, I was pleased with what I got which was impeccable service and eventually, great food.  I was actually not expecting much in retribution for their cooking issues, but instead was pleasantly surprised when they took the entire steak I had just scarfed down, off the bill!  They truly didn't have to do that and even with the Snafus, i still think the steak would've been worth every penny, but they did and I'm not going to complain!

What fun! We were sitting in the viagra triangle and had a taste for something sweet. It was a nice spring day and they had a duce open on the patio. They were having a shift change and we got overlooked for about 15 minutes. Until someone had the brains to ask if were had been served. He must have noticed the cob webs in my hair! After that it was all good. Six drinks later and a hat box they call carrot cake, we were on our way to happyville. My favorite steak place. And shrimp place. And crab cake place.

Went last week for lunch and sat in the bar area.  I ordered the nicoise salad with seared tuna and  friend ordered the ruben.  Both were great items with lots of flavor . The noise level was low for an afternoon and had a relaxing time.  Service was great and will be back soon!

We arrived for our reservation at 7 pm on a Wednesday and the place was packed!  When we checked in they had the reservation listed for us as a group of 4 not 5.  When we corrected it we were told we would not be able to be seated until after 9 pm.  Gasp.. on a work night?!  Another member of our group got a bit cranky and went to talk to the hostess and suddenly a table miraculously appeared.  I hate when places act all high and mighty like that. Our server was pretty good.  We ordered drinks, I had a Pear Martini which was good.  I ordered a Petite Filet which was good, but they way undercooked it.  Once I had cut into my steak I couldn't find the waiter so I just ate around the edges that were cooked more and wasted the completely raw middle... yuck.  I tried a couple sides like the blue cheese scalloped potatoes and asparagus which were both good. I am never a fan of over crowded restaurants.  No matter how good the food is.  If I am going to spend money on a good steak I would prefer to go to David Burkes.  It is an overall better experience.

Waaaaay overrated, for the price of our meal the servers should be trained a lot better, this is what I experienced  No white wine bucket Server opened the bottle with his leg Brought wrong bottle after our entrees were dropped Brought back correct bottle which was way too young. '10 Plumpjack that I asked him if it was too young. Said it wasn't it was. Settled for 09 Pride Mtn cab Entrees were dropped 15 minutes after we finally settled on a wine. Ordered white and red at the same time. Birthdays all around us and they were all acknowledged except for the one at our table which was confirmed upon arrival. Potatoes were cold The wine was a big deal because my buddies birthday we were celebrating is a Sommelier.

While in Chicago last summer for a ladies weekend we were told to go out to Gibson's for a good steak dinner by more than a few people. We were all glad we did.  They made us feel like we were regulars at Gibson's. They greeted us like we were there the night before and couldn't be happier we were back, although it was all our first time.  We were seated at a perfectly set round table with red and white checkered table cloths. Our server was quickly there to take our drink orders and explain the menu to us and show us the ever so popular cart of fresh cut meat and seafood.  The decor was what to expect of an older steakhouse in a historic city. The walls were covered in framed photos of all the celebrities and famous faces that have walked through their doors. The whole place was charming and instantly made you feel like you were supposed to be eating there.  Our food was cooked exactly how we ordered it. We were all overly stuffed and extremely satisfied with everything from the moment our cab pulled up to the front door to the time we left.  They even cover up the sewer grates in the summer so the stinky gasses don't come up and ruin your sidewalk experience outside the restaurant.

We stopped by Gibson's for a drink...what a great idea! I had the best martini of my life and my boyfriend enjoyed a delicious margarita. If you get a chance, talk to Joe behind the bar- great guy with lots of stories.

Love the sliders and my favorite ribeye in Chicago! The only down side to this place is that is a bit too loud for me. I went with my three kids and even they thought it was loud at 5:30 pm where they weren't even that busy.

January 25th 2013 was the first date of a wonderful relationship. Joe picked me up and originally we were going to go else where. As we were driving to this other restaurant Joe turns to me and asks me if I mind going downtown because he knows this place that we can get in and he think I would love it. We end up here. I never even heard of this place. Valet took his car we walked inside it was packed and i mean packed but it is a Friday night in Chicago. Joe goes up to the hostess talks to her for a min. some lady asks me if she could check my coat. I like that. We go onto the bar with the piano area and by the time Joe gets our drinks the hostess comes over to tell us we can be seated and the young lady that was seating us was to take me by two different tables and i could have my pick. ( I don't know anything about that so i let the young lady pick) so she sat us by the window which was very nice a little crowded but the whole place looked overly crowded. The waitress was wonderful she explained the different meats and sea food. I tried my first and last oyster there which i had Joe and the waitress laughing. i am happy to say i did not spit it out. Wine was awesome, i had the steak which was like heaven in my mouth. I am in love with this place even the restrooms are very well up kept there is an attendant there so remember to bring tip money. Other than being a tad over crowded it was a perfect night. Perfect hostess, perfect waitress, perfect food, perfect coat check lady,.perfect valet, and a perfect date.

Char grilled goodness. 1800 degree char that bleeds right out. Not a bad way to eat your beef. Bone in ribeye wr Chicago cut mouthwatering deliciousness. The 48 oz porterhouse for one was filling but had that same great char. Elvis and Paco are my guys. Love this steakhouse

I went here this weekend on a whim (I just walked in and got a table by the windows in the bar area) and my quick meal turned out perfectly. The bar is a fun scene to watch, complete with live music and interesting characters. Also, when you sit by the window its easy to see the happenings on Rush. Our waitress was busy but also really sweet and attentive when she had time.  I know this is a steak house but I was in the mood for something a bit lighter so I ordered the lobster bisque and a salad. They were both solid. Tried the steak and it was also top notch. They also served really delicious (complementary) bread, including a really interesting berry / nut bread that I can't stop thinking about. I'm going back here ASAP!

Gibsons was a great experience! Their service was superb. It's the kind of steakhouse where the waiters bring over a silver platter of raw cuts of steak and explain what kind of cuts they're offering.  My boyfriend ordered the porter house and I ordered the rib eye. My steak was better. My boyfriend also ordered the double baked potatoes and broccoli which was way too much food. We also ordered wine with dinner, and a turtle pie for desert.  It was way too much food. LOL! The steaks alone were good enough! Next time, I will definitely just stick to steak and wine. I didn't think the sides were special, but the steak was perfection. I like mine medium rare, and it was perfect. They had a really great red wine list as well. The piece of turtle pie was ridonkulous! It looked like something from claim jumpers.  I enjoyed the friendly staff at Gibsons. We were greeted by every staff member we passed as we entered and left the restaurant, and my wine and water glass was never empty. Our server was helpful and respectful of our space and time, but always made sure we had everything we wanted.  GREAT EXPERIENCE!
I went her back in January and ordered the peppercorn steak salad for $21. The salad was good and I was surprised I got full!

It is an excellent steak, and that is worth 3/5 stars for the event of eating out, but to be honest, it isnt worth it unless someone else is paying due to the rest of the experience. I have been here a number of times over the past 10 yrs with friends and with family and with one loudmouthed rich date who kind of put Gibson's in perspective. Tables are too crowded and you can actually be seated on the side in a high traffic area which isnt nice, if you don't have a big group. Kids are so unwelcome here, even if I end up loaded or win Powerball I wont be coming here, I will go to Gene and Georgetti. The two times I have been here with the kid I found the staff unhelpful. I wasnt asking for anything but 1) a spoon that was smaller than a Tablespoon...any spoon. 2) a second cup for ice.  Hardly Lindsay Lohan over-the-top diva demands. The last time was the Last time. Maybe I should have said loudly "don;t you know who I am?!" since there are a number of Those kinds of patrons here, and Yes I was with one one night. But he did get what he wanted from the waitstaff. 3 stars for the steak, 0 for the rest.
Old school interior with a nice bar area. Terrific steaks that were nicely cooked and seasoned and good beer and wine selection. Highly recommended!

The WR Chicago Cut steak cooked medium rare might be the best thing I have ever had! Best steak hands down. We also had the Porterhouse which was great especially in flavor but honestly, nothing bests the WR Chicago Cut... soooo good!

Literally the best steakhouse I've been to in Chicago. The steak was fantastic. The filet mignon and porterhouse were tender and the baked potato was just simply delicious. The service: phenomenal. Our waiter definitely took the time to get to know us a little bit and was very attentive. And for dessert, we were debating on a sundae or a slice of cake. Our server recommended that we get the cake because to him, the sundae was too small. Well we literally got about one fourth of a whole cake, and it was well worth it. This place is a must-try for anyone looking for great steak and service.

My boyfriend and I had decided to go to Gibson's on Mar 17, 2013 (which happens to be the most 'drunken' holiday, St.Patty's day). He had never been to Gibson's before, and although Gibson's is in the 'Viagra Triangle', and there are many other surrounding bars nearby, I was under the assumption that the 'drunks' would be elsewhere besides Gibson's. And BOY, I was WRONG. I loved the fact that we were seated right away, without making any reservations. That was a shocker.  The server was friendly, helpful, and attentive.  The food was immaculate. Well, of course, the Steak. Our starter was a 1/2 size of French Fries (amongst 2 people, I recommend the 1/2 size). I ordered a Filet Mignon, he ordered Sirloin Steak. Our dishes satisfied us 100%.  And then......... Drumroll please.... Ok. I've been to Gibson's in the past. The atmosphere was classy. People were on their best behavior. NOT TODAY. The 'drunken-holiday'. Out of all the tables available in Gibson's, the hostess sat 3 drunken fools next to us. NEXT to us. The 1 drunken broad said to me (while I was enjoying my steak).... "We promise, we'll be nice". The 2nd drunken broad said to me (while I continued enjoying my steak)... "Weren't you at that bar we were at?" The third drunken bastard spoke extremely loud about his 'sexual prowess" to the 2 broads.  ARE you fucking kidding Me?  They let these 3 fuckers in, and sat them next to us? Right before they were seated, they were already loud. I thought to myself, "OH, GREAT".  I feel totally insulted by Gibson's that they allowed this behavior in their establishment. They did NOTHING to quiet them down. After steak, I wanted to complain right away, and leave Gibson's forever, but both My Boyfriend and I decided to order a Cherry Pie, which was exquisite, and in disbelief that the table next to us continued to be disrespectful. We spoke with management before deciding to pay. My boyfriend complained to the manager, and we were given $25 off of our bill. Then, the manager offered us free drinks at the bar. "Absolutely NO I stated". Honestly, I wanted to get the hell out of Gibson's.  After paying, My Boyfriend decided to politely lash out his frustration and anger to the 3 drunken fools. He stated that they were the three rudest, disgusting, grotesque human beings that we have ever had to dine next to. He continued to say 'he didn't give a damn how much money the 3-drunks made.. they should be ashamed of themselves, and their behavior'. Gibson's let NON-CLASSY 3 drunken fucks into their establishment. Sat them next to Us. What the fuck !  Will we visit Gibson's again? Probably NOT. It was a real disappointment. At Gene at Gorgetti's (on 500 N.Franklin) is much classier. And they have been a steakhouse since 1941. We regret not going there instead. Lessons learned.

Gibson's is a great place to go any time of the day. Excellent selection of steaks cooked to perfection. The best sides are the double baked potato and the brocoli. It's welcoming atmosphere is relaxing and upscale. Great place to go for light night drinks at the bar. You have to save room for dessert if you go to Gibson's. They are phenomenal and could feed about four people. You will definitely leave full and satisfied.

A nice steakhouse on Rush Street near downtown Chicago ... how you rate it depends on what you were looking for. This place is a raucous and noisy restaurant, jam packed with tables and people. There isn't much room between tables, and you pretty much have to yell across for your table mates to hear you. But if you really came here to have a great steak - you won't be disappointed. Portions are very large, and they know how to cook steaks - red or pink in the middle, you'll get it right. Service is friendly but basic ... with many tables and a busy house, service is often inattentive. They forgot to offer us another round of drinks, probably in their hurry to turn the tables. While this is not a Four-Star dining experience, it is a famous watering hole in Chicago and many people have it on their must see list for entertaining out-of-town guests ... as such it is always busy, so reservations are recommended. This is not a place for kids or even teenagers ... strictly an adult steak joint. It also is not a stop for a quiet, romantic dinner. If you are on your way to a Blackhawks hockey game at the United Center or simply walking over from the Drake Hotel on Michigan Avenue for a change of pace, this is a great place to stop for a big steak and a strong drink before the puck drops or the night sets in. You'll often see some of the Chicago beautiful people hanging around, or sports names in town for a game. The steaks come with a nice big char on the outside and are tender inside. But remember - this is a steakhouse and not a fish or chicken joint.

Our family decided to entertain my son and his three friends from the West Coast.  Our experience was disappointing.  The table where we were seated nearly abutted several others. The din is such that we frequently couldn't hear people on the other side of the table.   When the waiter brought samples of the steaks we might order, we simply couldn't understand him.  Not only was it so noisy, but the waiter spoke so quickly and with so thick of an accent it was a wasted effort.  He also took our drink order without explaining the different types of wine available.  Later on in the meal, my husband ordered another glass of wine.  I declined, but the waiter brought me another glass-not gratis, I might add.   When the salads arrived, my son's salad had the wrong dressing on it.  The busboy was apologetic and quickly replaced it with the correct choice.   The steaks were gargantuan, but good.  It's a shame that they're so huge, as three of our people were women, and didn't come close to eating half of their serving. They need to offer a small portion for those of us who can't eat Flintstone-sized steaks.  The vegetable tray (at over $11) was sparce, and not worth the expense.  One member of our party had to ask twice for his glass of milk. As a dessert choice we ordered the Essie Kup cake, which is about 10" tall and definitely enough for an entire table.  It had a very mild chocolate taste with chocolate shavings.  To eat the cake, we were given very large, unwieldly tablespoons instead of small teaspoons.  The cake also had several scoops of vanilla ice cream flanking it.  But it didn't come with any spoon to serve the ice cream.   Finally, one of our guests was given her filet wrapped up to go, even though when she was originally asked if she wanted it wrapped, she declined. I would not recommend Gibson's if your party includes children, seniors or people who don't eat massive portions of beef.  There are plenty of other excellent steak houses in Chicago.

For the price, I expected much more. First off, this is not a romantic, quiet dinner place. They cram everyone in like a sardine can which makes the noise level in the room pretty high. The decor is like old timey steak house. I knew this place was a tourist trap from reading the reviews but my friend insisted that she received good recommendations for it so we made reservations. My friends and I got the bone-in ribeye, prime rib, and BBQ ribs. For sides, mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The steaks comes with soup or salad, both are just average and nothing too memorable. The rib eye came pretty well seared, and when I say seared I mean close to being burnt. A little char is good for flavor, but black and crusty is another. The prime rib was better than the rib eye. The BBQ ribs were dry and bland. Overall the meats weren't bad, but I've been to Mastros, Ruth's Chris, Flemings and all of those were better than Gibsons. This was one of the few places on my visit to the city that I was sorely disappointed. I really wished we had tried some place else.

I rate the quality and flavor of Gibson's steaks above Ruth Chris, Smith & Wollensky, and Morton's.  4.5 Stars would be more accurate. This location is upscale and busy, with lots of famous faces in the crowd. The cuts of beef are aged and premium. Their steaks have a delicious flavor without tasting over seasoned. The family style sides are fresh and prepared as expected. The wine selection was extensive. The wait staff is professional and knowledgable.  My favorites: the filet (medium) and garlic mash potato

Stellar service, and inCREDible steaks.  I got a perfect medium rare steak, which is a rarity indeed (no pun intended).  Although I was excited to try the blue cheese baked potato and gruyere cauliflower, I thought they missed the mark a bit.  They were unique, but not exactly good. Vodka martinis fully equipped with blue cheese olives (also hard to find for some reason), and were delightfully strong.  Piano player in the corner on a Monday evening added a much-appreciated tone of sophistication.

Steak good.  Preparations excellent.  Local fish tasteless, preparation excellent.  Bread and butter excellent.  Vegetable side dishes:  brutal, better produce at Costco.  Not worth repeating.  Service very good, but too much of it.  Open late is a real plus.

Classic Steak House. Great food, great atmosphere, and a killer wine list. All of that comes with a price though. Make sure you get a reservation or else you will be waiting for a while. Wait staff is top notch, as it should be at a place of this caliber. Service is fantastic as well. You will only have dirty plates in front of you for a few moments until a busser or another server stops by to grab it. I got the Chicago cut steak and it was AMAZING. I did not get any dressings as I think it masks the true taste of the steak. The deserts are MASSIVE as well. I would make sure you have a partner to eat them.

Damn good traditional steak. Cooked juicy and beefy. Weird huge broccoli side. This seriously, just one huge broccoli head. I would suggest the amazing ice cream and macadamia nut cake. It was a preset dinner but they did well.

Finally made it to Chicago, and this place was at the top of my list of restaurants to try...it did not disappoint.    Service was impeccable.  Super friendly, non-pretentious, very attentive. Started the dinner off right with a "Rush St. Manhattan", maybe the best Manhattan I've ever had. Ordered the Australian Giant Lobster Tail & Porterhouse.  Steak was big, juicy, flavorful, cooked to perfection, could cut it with a fork.  Lobster Tail was the size of a football and amazing.  If I was on death row, this would be my last meal.  This exact meal.  I'd die smiling.  I think this is the only high end steakhouse I've ever been to that includes soup, salad, side with an entree, which personally I feel they all should do.  When you're meal is like $100+ per person, would it kill you to include some veggies and whatnot...not exactly breaking the bank.  Blue cheese salad was good (dressing was homemade), chicken soup was like mama makes. Props to Gibson's for doing the right thing.   Wine list had a wide array, starting at like $7/$30 per glass/bottle, going up to a few hundred per bottle.  Which is nice, because I love good wine with good steak, but I hate being forced to buy a super expensive bottle.  (::cough cough:: Bryant & Cooper) Our waiter was a die hard Yankees fan, & so our bromance was formed.  This lead to a enormous piece of homemade Pecan Pie a la mode.  On the house. and it was some of the best pie I've ever eaten.   I've been to the majority of high end steakhouses, and I have a new favorite.  I'm contemplating flying back to grab dinner next weekend.

First time at Gibsons last tuesday night.. Great steaks and big tasty rich sides surpassed by great service. So here is what happened- I hade made a reservation for 6 at 7:30, I call back next  morning to tell them we are now a party of 8, however due to some friends bailing at the last minute, we show up 15 minutes late with only a party of 4. The place is packed, and the nice girl up front tells us we will have to wait about 15 minutes. 20 minutes later the girl comes back to us and tells it will be another 10 minutes and they want to buy all4 of us a drink for being patient, we say ok, 4 Makers Mark Manhattens (not a cheap drink), no problem the drinks come quick. 10 minutes later we are seated with AA nice window table on Rush St, then the terrific waiter, Elvis,  comes over and apologizes again for our delay, and says they are giving us a complimentary cold Seafood Tower for 4 w Shrimp , crabmeat etc, it was great. Steaks, about 3 sides for the table and a couple of glasses of Cab and Zin later, waiter then tells us Dessert is on the house ! We had some humongous Apple Cobbler a al mode. Check comes and we tell him we have 4 separate credit cards due to our expense accounts, lol, he says no problem. With all that (and they were big 20oz ribeyes), the checks come to about $70 each after tax! We were all appreciative of the great service, freebies, not to mention the awesome meal we left about a 25-30 % tip. Just a great dining experience evening. Great food, terrific waiter,  restaurant staff appreciative of our business.  Will definitely return on our next trip to Chicago.
Had the Chicago Cut steak.  Perfectly cooked and the perfect size for one very hungry guy.  I also recommend the double baked potato.

I took the husband to Gibson's for his bday. It was the first time either of us have been there. We didn't have a reservation, but we only waited about 40 minutes until we were seated. That was fine because it was a Saturday night and we sat at the bar to have drinks first. It was PACKED! But the atmosphere was cordial. We were seated and had a GREAT steak tutorial from our waiter. He was so personable! Husband had the NY sirloin; I had the bone in. Both were to die for. We also had the double baked potato and broccoli. I would suggest not adding cheese to the broccoli (my husband ALWAYS does) because it became cold quickly. All of the sides were good. Then for desert, they sang (more like yelled) for him and gave him the BIGGEST slice of macadamia turtle pie! It should be against the law. We had a great time and the bill was less than we thought it would be. Finally, right before we left Dr. Cornell West walked in and I took a pic with him. All in all, great atmosphere, great night, great food, and great company (my husband). Go!
Husband and I went here last summer (2012). Food was amazing. Prices were as expected, and ambiance was great. server was extremely attentive! No complaints here. I would definitely recommend.

Gibson's, what can I say, Classy, Delicious and Fun. I had a 7 oz. petite filet, so amazing. I also enjoyed all the wine, they have quite a list. I went with 2 girlfriends for a ladies night and everything was perfect. The service was impeccable. GO to Gibson's! It will not disappoint for a great steak and a great time.
Great stakes.Graet location.Make reservation is hetting very busy on the weekends.Love the outside area summertime.
Best bone-in  ribeye  ..Never,never had a bad meal. Not cheap but worth ever penny..

Just thinking about Gibson's makes me laugh.  What a scene.  I won't even eat in the dining room because the bar is so entertaining.  First of all, get a hightop table in the bar, enjoy the live piano music, and enjoy the parade of characters.  That's all I'll say because if I elaborate, I'll end up offending someone, or possibly many someones.  Service is good, wines by the glass are good, and the food is really good!  Who knew?  Shrimp cocktail are huge and really good!  The creamed spinach was the best I've had in years.  Steaks are luscious.  What's funny is that this place is such a mill.  Definitely not a foodie haven.  I'm sure "serious" foodies look down their noses at Gibson's.  Not my problem.

We were in Chicago last week it was my first time, and was not disappointed I loved the city and can't wait to go back this summer. We linked up with one of my wife's friend and she recommended Gibson Bar & Steakhouse we loved the atmosphere it was packed with a lot of energy and had piano bar. The service was great as well as the food we had a great time we will definitely go back after checking all the other restaurant's in Chicago.

So me and the bf have finally returned.  It's been 7 years since we "accidentally" walked into Gibson's and were too shy to leave after realizing where we really were.  This time, the visit to Gibson's was intentional - a special occasion in fact (my bf's big 3-0).  And this time around we didn't develop stomach ulcers when we saw the check (since we are no longer broke undergrads - woohoo!). The service and food was fantastic.  Our waiter made great suggestions about drinks and food. The birthday boy (I mean, birthday man) had some serious aged Scotch.  Gibson's has their own USDA grading above A, I mean that is some serious sh** and they deserve such a high grading.  I usually am a filet mignon kinda gal but I wanted something with more flavor.  Our waiter suggested the Bone-In Sirloin (I got the 16oz, the not-so-little portion) and my companion ordered the W.R's Chicago Cut (22oz).  For sides, we shared bleu cheese scalloped potatoes and creamed spinach.  Everything was delicious, and my Bone-In Sirloin was so flavorful without too much fat.  We were way too stuffed after the steaks, so we took dessert to-go - a larger than life slice of pumpkin pie.  I usually don't enjoy steakhouses, but Gibson's is definitely an exception.  In fact, I'm making the bf bring me here for MY next birthday.

FANTASTIC. Phenomenal. WOW! Went there for lunch on a Thursday afternoon, and this was the place to be. We had reservations, so we were quickly seated.  The place was busy, but not packed.  We could have skipped the reservation and been seated just as quickly.  There was outdoor seating available, but it was a bit chilly.   I ordered a French Martini and was shocked when it arrived.  Huge is an understatement.  WOW!  It had to be twice the normal size.  For $14 it better have been.  And it was STRONG!  HAPPY LUNCH TO MEEEEE!  ;) I'm not much of a steak person, but being this is the restaurant TO have red meat...I decided to try the Prime Rib French Dip.  It was very good...and if you're a prime rib person...if would have been phenomenal.  I'm picky about the color of my meat...and it was VERY pink.  BUT GOOD! Now, my friend...she had "The King of All Sandwiches" USDA Gibsons Prime Angus Ribeye Sandwich - 24.00 Topped with Sauteed Spinach, Garlic Chips & Blue Cheese Dressing.  (minus the blue cheese)  She gave me a sample... OH MY GOD.  If you don't say that after one bite, you are CRAZY.  This was the best thing I've ever had in my entire life -- in the steak category.  If all red meat tasted like this...I'd be converted!!!  Holy Moly................wow.   If you can't get it from my review...you never will.  But if you do -- GO TO GIBSONS!  Save your appetite...portions are HUGE... The decor is also second to none.  Pictures ALL OVER of the different celebrities that have dined there.   GO TO GIBSONS!  :)

My fiancé visited here with the university of San Diego football team and they all said it was phenomenal! The steak was cooked to perfection and the sides were delicious . The best part of the meal had to be the dessert!

best steak place in chicago, hands down. Most certainly the place to see and be seen in the city of broad shoulders. Get the WR Chicago cut steak. You cant  go wrong with sides but the best dessert is the macadamia turtle pie, which could feed a group of 5 or more. Unless you make yourself a known customer of Gibsons, youll need to make a reservation way ahead of time or youll be just another face in the crowd of young chicago twenty and thirty-somethings waiting for their names to be called.

My original review is below *** This place has now become a regular hangout for me.  The crowd at the bar is always great, have met some good people there.   The reason for my update is that while their full dining menu is amazing, you really should treat yourself to it at least once.  They also offer a smaller menu.   Since my first visit I have eaten off their smaller menu numerous times.  And I must say, even that smaller menu some amazing food.  Tasty and plentiful. Also, the bartenders are great, but since I usually deal with Mark, I consider him my main bartender.  He does his job well, professionally, and knows how to keep the patrons  at the bar happy and welcome. *** original review  Decided to treat myself to a nice steak at the bar to send off a year that I am glad was ending (2012). Great steak, my drink was made just right. The bartenders were also friendly and attentive. I will definitely return.

So I finally got to enjoy a Gibson's steak... and the best service ever. As soon as we were sat, the servers came over and introduced themselves. They were very amicable and made us feel very comfortable from the start. We (I) chose a bottle of Oberon, which was very decently priced and very delicious. After which our server, Paco (probably the best server I have ever had) explained the different cuts of meats to us. From bone-in steaks to lobster.  We finally decided on a pepper-crusted Fillet Mignon and a New York Sirloin with mashed potatoes. I am not a big mashed potatoes fan but they were exquisite. I didn't have the gravy (not a fan) so I cannot comment on that. What I can comment on, however, are the fillet and sirloin... which were prepared to perfection. Juicy and extremely flavorful. I don't know how I'll be able to go back to a Golden Nugget steak after this (I'm kidding. I know it's sacrilegious. but funny). Seriously. To summarize this experience... Yes! Again... Yes! Magnificent food, magnificent service, great ambiance (Loud. It's a steak house. We know) and great Vino. Definitely worth every second and every penny.  p.s. Make a reservation....

Phenomenal!!!  I am usually not a meat (reds) eater but I could not resist.  We ordered appetizers.  Then for the main, we ordered, fish, pork chops, and prime rib.  Since there were three of us, we shared each others plates to enjoy different meals. Over all, amazing!!!  Pork Chops were moist and tasty (ordered blackened).  The Prime Rib melted in your mouth, the fish (Salmon) was so good. Being that this was a business trip, made it even more enjoyable, that we didn't have to pay for it. Even though expensive, great place for a date or a special evening!!

While visiting for the Christmas holiday, my sister and her husband took us to Gibsons for a nice dinner out.  We waited a while for our table, but you can tell the place was SUPER BUSY.  It was fun to wait in the lobby and stare at the countless autographed photos of various celebrities that (I assume) dined here at one point or another. Once we sat down, our dinner experience was just shy of amazing.  Our waiter Andy was super friendly and made some pretty crucial recommendations since he knew some of us were from out of town and he explained how they "do things" here at Gibsons.  All of his recommendations were spot on, as far as the steak cuts and eating family style.  All the sides are a-la-carte, but Andy was good about telling us if we were ordering too much/too little... and we ended up with a great meal and finished everything! I was actually pretty jazzed to hear that the guys from the FX show "The League" eat here so a lot of fantasy football players come to Gibsons to give their seasons that extra "umph" or mojo they may or may not need the coming season. Great wine, great meats, awesome sides, and good company made this night pretty special for my family.

This was the second year in a row that my husband and I, with a few other couples, went to Gibson's for NYE.  The food and atmosphere were excellent.  I had the 10 oz filet cooked medium and it was perfect.  If you like horseradish, ask for some of the sauce on the side - it's delicious!  We had appetizers - crabcakes (large and best I have had), crab legs (good, not the best ive had), and the goat cheese (so good- kept going for more).  The side dishes are large and you can easily split them between 3-4 people.  We had the sweet potato (so good, you dont need to add any butter, salt, brown sugar, etc.), sautéed mushrooms (very good, but on the small side), everyone liked the sautéed spinach but i thought the garlic was too strong, and the mashed potatoes and gravy were very good. The atmosphere is very fun.  The room we were in were filled with late 20s to late 30 year olds who were all in the socializing mood.  The restaurant provides lots of NY gear to ring in the New Year.  I hope to continue to make this a tradition here.

We took my mom and brother (from Charlotte) and uncle (from San Francisco) to Gibson's for dinner Thursday night to celebrate our first Christmas in our first place in Chicago.  Hubby and I have wanted to try this place for a while. We had to wait about 30 minutes after our original reservation time for our table.  Other than that, the rest of our experience was wonderful.  Even though the dining room was darkly lit (like other steakhouses), the ambiance was welcoming and cozy (no pretentious air like other steakhouses).  Our waiter Andy, made my family feel right at home.  When he discovered they are from NC, he talked about his girlfriend's love of the Bo'Berry biscuit (a hometown favorite from a local fried chicken chain).  He made great suggestions regarding wine and portion sizes.  My uncle, who loves eating steak, was impressed with he brought out the different cuts of meat to show the table.  We took his advice and ordered family style, where the meats were pre-cut and shared on a platter.  This way, all of us (5 of us) could try the different cuts.  We had the Chicago cut, 14 oz. filet mignon, and rib eye.  My favorite was the Chicago cut - so tender, juicy, and nicely marbled.  We also had a crab cocktail appetizer, spinach with butter and garlic side, and double baked potato side.  It was just the right amount of food to go with a nice bottle of red wine.   The dessert menu was not too impressive, but we ordered a slice of simple pumpkin pie and my uncle ordered a black cherry sorbet.  Sometimes simple is just right to cap off an indulgent meaty meal.

Always weary of when several hotel staffers overly recommend a place but it was getting late on the night before a big meeting and I desperately needed to do my eat a good steak and drink a good wine ritual. The hotel recommended Gibson's a familiar name to those in Chicagoland and Nashville but for very different reasons. My colleagues and I sat outside on a wonderful August night and ordered our familiar fare: rib-eyes all around and a bottle of Caymus Cab--how woefully unimaginative. We started with wedge salads and creamed-spinach accompanied our steaks. Too stuffed for dessert but never too stuffed for espressos with Sambuca (Molinari of course).  No excitement thus far. And that's the point. The steaks were fantastic, service was terrific and our evening was a success. Hence on my next return to Chicago I'm heading strait for Gibsons before heading for the hotel.

Gibsons has been on my radar for a while and, being a staunch believer in saving restaurants like this for special occasions, I was excited to celebrate a life milestone here. For starters, the experience did not start out great.  Our table was not ready when we arrived for our reservation and we ended up in an overly cramped bar area fighting to get a glass of wine.  It was hardly enjoyable since we kept getting bumped into by old men and women in fur coats, but we kept our eye on the meaty prize.  We were seated 30 minutes after our reservation (on a Wednesday no less!) and placed in an awkwardly inconvenient table in front of a door in the sunroom side (or whatever area they call it).  At least I had a slight buzz. Our waiter came by with complimentary bread and a tray full of their available steaks.  I had already had my heart set on the filet mignon, and we both opted for the 14 ounce instead of the 10 ounce (for $8 more, completely worth it).  Each steak came with a house salad or a soup, and we ordered the twice baked potato to split.  A bottle of red wine was to be split, too.  55/45, though, since I savor mine a lil bit more ;) The salad came out quickly.  It was small, but filling, and had some of the most amazing dressing I have ever had.  It had some kick, too.  Peppers?  Seasonings?  I don't know.  Whatever it was... YUM. The steaks and potato quickly followed.  My steak was deceivingly large and, although I requested medium, came out more on the medium rare side.  I consider it a blessing since it was one of the best pieces of meat I have ever had. So good, in fact, that I ate a 14 ounce filet mignon.  Myself.  As someone who weighs 2,448 ounces, that's approximately .6% of my body weight.  That's a lot, people. And that baked potato?  Well, even when the waiter split it, it was about the size of my thigh and I knew I had to devour it.  Piping hot cheesy potato-y goodness, you were conquered. Don't let the skinny frame fool you, I'm a chubbo at heart. The bill?  Not bad.  Actually, considering what was ordered, Gibsons is less expensive than other competitor restaurants in the area, and I would go as far as saying it is in my top 2 steakhouses overall.   Gibsons.  An institution.  A home of meaty goodness.  You win forever.  I wuv u.

The dinner was fabulous, my drink was kinda so so, and the bartender not so great, but once we got seated at a table it was smooth sailing.  I had a the filet, it was perfectly cooked and we had a wonderful app and desert.  Also, the lob tail was perfect.  Great time and great sevice. Very pricey totally worth it!

I have had the displeasure of dining at Gibsons and as a vegan and a person with taste buds I have to be honest: this place stinks. I get that Gibsons is known for its animal flesh but what I don't understand is how they can call a romaine lettuce salad an "adequate vegan salad.  I have dined at restaurants similar to Gibsons that were much more accommodating to my cruelty free dietary lifestyle. I just don't understand why a place like Gibsons charges a premium for a sub par romaine lettuce salad.  Here is my suggestion for Gibsons: Use dark leafy greens in your salads. Kale, spinach, chard, or collard greens are excellent options.

Wonderful from beginning to end. Perfect service, beautiful atmosphere and the steak could not have been better. I got the fillet, medium (with a hot pink center) was cooked to perfection and tasted delicious. We also got the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and the shrimp were huge, tasted fresh and the even the cocktail sauce was memorable. Classic restaurant in Chicago and a must for anyone wanting amazing steak, seafood with incredible service.

I moved to Chicago recently from New Orleans. I took my wife to Gibsons' for our one year wedding anniversary. I regret this choice immensely.  There was nothing remarkable about the experience. The food is good and the prices are quite high, but not higher than you'd expect for a restaurant in that area of Chicago.  My complaint is the hostess. she seated my wife and I at a tiny table in the back corner where three screaming kids were already throwing tantrums. I have no idea why she chose that table when there were plenty of other tables available at the time. I mentioned it was our anniversary when I made the reservation. Also, the hostess was rude to me when I placed my reservation weeks ahead. In sum, I am not happy with my experience and I feel Gibson's just doesn't value their guests time and money.  If you plan to spend $200 on dinner for 2 in Chicago, I promise you can find much better food, staff, and overall experience at numerous places than what's offered at Gibson's.

After nearly 20 years of eating no red meat and a bit longer for pork, you'd have to wonder why one would stumble into a landmark STEAK HOUSE for a posh, weekday meal? Because they have years of getting high end food right and did not disappoint with my blackened Salmon with sautéed fresh spinach with mashed.  Salmon is a tired menu item and I rarely order it.  But Gibsons did not disappoint and achieved the right amount of tasty black char  that complimented the natural creaminess of the fish.

Let me be clear, I completely understand that this is a tourist trap.  I think everyone who goes here understands that 90% of the diners are tourists looking to enjoy the Gibson's and "Chicago" steakhouse experience.   Let's call a Spade and Spade, as I just did, and now... let's move on. Who cares!?!?  It's still freaking awesome.  And it's still freaking great steaks and great service.   At Gibson's you will be shown the steak of your choosing and they will cook your steak to perfection of the temperature that you have requested.  Most recently, I had a nice sirloin cooked Rare Plus and it was elegance in my mouth.  Seriously, I'm pretty sure that that is what elegance tastes like. Not quite the carnivore that I am?  Fine.  Gibson's also has massive heaping salads of every sort.  Personally, I am always a fan of a Wedge salad when I go to a steakhouse because nothing compliments a fantastic and perfect steak quite like 1/4 a head of lettuce topped with delicious and creamy house made (that day) bleu cheese, and ... nom, nom, nom... bacon. (FYI:  my mouth has now started to water writing this review... my dog is starting to look "tasty"...  I might be grilling out tonight just thinking about Gibson's) Don't like meat?  Don't like vegetables?  Ok, fine.  How about desserts?  Do you like desserts?  You do.  Great.  How about desserts the size of a small child?  Oh, even better.  Then I hope you left room after your wedge, your massive steak, your stupendous wine selection (and multiple glasses... or bottles...), and the side items.  Because  you could order a CARROT CAKE "slice" that's as big as most newborn infants.  Seriously, it must be 1,000 pounds of carrot cake (Yes.  That is an exaggeration. Thanks.)   I'd write more... but... I.must.go.buy.steaks.lettuce.carrot cake.now

Steaks gr8 @GibsonsSteak. Drinks ample and well-mixed.  Wine list strong.  Ambience -- classic steakhouse with history.  Service superb.  Hate being seen in the Viagra triangle but this place keeps pulling me back.

Great part of town.  Had a business dinner here last night.  Lots of good activity and great place to be.  Ate in the bar area. Ordered bone in filet. with asparagus and double baked potatoes.   Was delicious!   We ordered carrot cake (All desserts are HUGE!)  My customer took rest home to feed family....probably twice...)

4.5 stars Great steakhouse & great service!!! My bf and I had dinner here one night around 5:30pm... it was empty haha. Why did we have a reservation? so silly. But once the it got later people started to fill the restaurant. The service here was great. It's everything you would expect from a great steakhouse. They brought out samples of all the meat that they served so you could see the product and see the different sizes that were available. The waiter was also able to answer all the questions we had about the different meats. Very impressive.  Started with a salad and chicken noodle soup. Salad was standard but the soup was super tasty. My bf ate most of it bc he was in heaven. From just a couple spoonfuls I could already tell it was delicious. That's when you know you're in for something good..if they can nail a simple soup like chicken noodle. For my entree I had the porterhouse with the garlic mash and mushrooms w/ spinach. EVERYTHING was on point and met all my expectations. The mash potatoes were absolutely divine. I dream about their buttery goodness. The porterhouse was cooked to perfection. A little char on the outside but juicy and succulent on the inside. It melted in your mouth. And for dessert: ice cream sundae. This was by far the BEST ice cream sundae I've ever had and my bf agreed. We don't know what it was about it but it was absolutely perfect in every way. Just the right amount of vanilla bean, chocolate and crunch. If I could have that everyday I would.  The next time I'm in Chicago I would love to come back to Gibsons. They also have outdoor seating available which would be perfect on a sunny afternoon in May. Gibsons is near many other restaurants in a cute area of town that makes you feel alive with energy. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because it's not the best porterhouse I've ever had. Despite that fact, I highly recommend this steakhouse and would be happy to return.

A girlfriend and I came here before hitting up a piano bar down the street.  She's a "regular" there, and LOVES and raves about the piano man.  We enjoyed salads, wine and dessert while we listened to some good piano playing and singing :)  The bartender Dennis was great, would have liked to stay at the bar longer, but a table opened up!  I ordered the House Salad, (can't go wrong with that), and my girlfriend ordered the Wedge Salad.  The bread there is DELISH...I don't know what that raisin bread is, but I could have eating that whole half loaft by myself! Yummmmo! For dessert we ordered the hot fudge sundae, delish :)  Good service, enjoyed the bar area a lot! Would love to check out the dinner menu sometime with the hubby!!

This place is iconic (even if it is a chain now). I first came here when I was 14 and its charm hasn't faded away in those 8 years. I've never come here without a reservation and I don't advise it either unless you call ahead and check the wait times or want to be acquainted with the bartender over an hour or two. The tables are pretty close together and many of the patrons are dressed to the nine, or at least aren't wearing jeans.  Just about everything here is a la carte and done in courses. To start, go with any salad on the menu and any seafood bisque that they have. Trust me, it'll be awesome just don't think about the calories. I normally get the surf and turf when I come here, the money is already being spent and I might as well spend it right. I always go with a rare steak. Yes, I like it bloody and cool in the center. The servers always look at me funny when I ask for a rare steak but hey, they can keep on looking. The lobster is always tender, just order the regular one. The large Australian ones don't taste as good and they cost a lot more. As far as sides go, any sauteed vegetables are good bets as well as the mashed potatoes. If I'm really going for the gusto, I'll get the baked potato (one is enough to share at least two ways!). For dessert, you can't go wrong with any option at all. I'm partial to anything chocolate so I normally go right in for the kill and order chocolate cake. The drinks here are also quite strong and wonderful. They really know how to take care of a gal here. The service is always attentive and on the spot. Wait times for food can be a little ridiculous but hey, they're perfecting my order. A perfectly rare steak is a work of art!

I love this place for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Breakfast/Brunch: They bring out a variety of breads and butter. The raisin bread is my favorite! They have a variety of brunch dishes, which I've tried the omelettes, the eggs benedict (crab cake and filet), and steak and eggs. Everything is really good and high quality. The prices are really reasonable, which is why I prefer coming here versus Tavern on Rush (which is across the street).  Lunch/Dinner: The steaks are perfect. I think Morton's (which is around the corner) is a slightly better but Gibsons knows how to make a filet mignon, that is for sure.  If you prefer seafood, just head next door to Hugo's, it's the same menu plus more seafood options.

To be clear, this review is limited to the bar.  Based on the experience I chose to pass on the dining experience.   The bartender only paid attention to regulars in taking drink orders, it took about 15 minutes to be acknowledged in any way.  The first attempt at a basic no frills martini was unsuccessful.  It tasted like cucumbers, the reason for this was unclear.  Either something extra was added or the shaker he used was not properly cleaned.  Round two was more successful, the cocktail that consists of exactly one ingredient was perfectly acceptable.   I asked to settle my tab and wasn't sure if I was heard as there was never any eye contact or other attempt to offer the basics of service, he was more interested in chatting and sharing stories with a group of locals.  After about 10-15 minutes of a continued lack of acknowledgement, I again asked for my tab.   This time, I get a response. Here is the verbatim quote:  "I heard you the first time, is it okay with you if I finish making these drinks first?" (marinated with sarcasm).  Wow. This is the worst service experience I've ever encountered in a fine dining restaurant. I don't recall the gentleman's name, grey hair, heavyset, mid to late 50s.  Maybe try the dining room, perhaps they don't allow trolls.

Gibsons is for sure my favorite steak restaurant in Chicago. I would highly recommend making reservations ahead of time or hope that you're lucky enough to be able to find an empty small table near the bar area when you arrive. I was with 2 coworkers and we all ordered the T-bone (20 oz) with asparagus and mushroom as our sides.  The food was amazing and the service was great even when it was super busy. I will definitely return here the next time I'm in Chicago. Also, if you are trying to decide between Gibsons and Chicago Chop House, do yourself a favor and come to Gibsons. Chicago Chop House was a waste of money.... crazy expensive for mediocre food and service ($500 for 3 people)

While in town for a Bears' game, my buddy and I met his relative up for lunch.  She is owns a local periodical, so we figured she would know a great place to go.  She suggested meeting at Gibsons, which was great because my foodie friend recommended this place as well the previous week.   Upon getting there we learned they shared a kitchen with Hugo's Frong Bar and Fish house.  Now the night before we randomly met some fellow Houstonians in front of Hugo's and they invited us inside to sit with them.  We had just eaten so we just grabbed beers with them. When their food came, it looked and smelled delicious.  As they ate theirs, they moaned and complained about how expensive it was for what they ended up getting and how it didn't compare to any Texas steak.  We were offended by how rude they were, so we ended up ditching them after on beer.  So when we learned of this shared kitchen, my buddy and I were a little worried.   When the server brought over the raw meat selection and the lobster tail to show us, it was a carnivores dream.  It looked so fresh and well marbled.  The lobster tail, which I was informed was on the medium to larger size, but they had much bigger in the past, looked as if they had removed the tail of a dolphin or mermaid.  I even took a picture of it, that it was so ridiculously huge.  We both ordered the WR Chicago cut steak & his relative ordered the lobster (petite size which was what I would call a medium to large sized tail in my experience).  We split fries for the table.  They got the salad and I got the white fish soup/stew (it had a famous name to it because it came from a famous restaurant in Philadelphia (but I cannot remember or find the name online). For dessert we ordered the Macadamia turtle pie to split.   The soup was delicious and their salads looked extremely fresh.  The steaks were amazing, one of the best I have ever had.  Her lobster tail looked so great, she said it was delicious.  The turtle pie was huge, we split it three ways, and it was so good!  I love ice creams cakes and this was basically ice cream, pie crust, Macadamia nuts, & chocolate and caramel sauce.   Gibsons is a must eat spot for anyone visiting near the Magnificent Mile in Chicago. Thank you for a delicious experience!

Yep, I have to say that I am a fan.  Gibsons is one of those places that you should experience once in your life.  Epic portions of some of the best red meat served in Chicago and served by some career servers who know what's what. Just be prepared to wait...even if you have a reservation.  They get a little behind when people are to full to leave and then camp out in one of the tall booths.  You can always try and grab a seat in the bar as well

If you are out of towners, you must dine this place. The service was great, food overrated. If you are a big meat lover like my boyfriend, you won't be impressed by the steak.  The ambiance is nice. Definitely must visit if you are in Chicago.  But make sure you won't forget your credit card there. We had to be on the phone for 45min to get to someone who could check to see if they had my card. By that time I was already back in the restaurant and luckily found my card.

If I could give ten stars, I would! Gibson's is the standard for steaks, service, atmosphere and enjoyment! It's the BEST steakhouse I've eve been to. I wish that I visited Chicago more... Just because of Gibson's. The sides are huge and perfect. The desserts should be illegal! The wine list is great and the bar is where you want to start and end the night. I'm going back and I always tell people that they should try it. If you love steak, you'll love Gibson's. EVERY staff member was top shelf and the place is loaded with class, comfort and charm.

How haven't I reviewed this yet? Gibson's is everything it should be, dark, somewhat cramped, wooden booths, lots of people, piano bar, celebrity sightings (I've seen some Bulls players and visiting musicians here) oh and tasty meats. And when I say meat, there are also a lot of dudes here. Yes it's in viagra triangle but I'm not looking to date that much older than me. Gibson's steaks are fantastic. The service is excellent, the wines are great, the ambiance is so much fun. What doesn't make this a 5 star homerun for me though is that the strength of the steaks doesn't necessarily carry through the rest of the menu (see my review for Keefer's). The appetizers/raw bar is good but the desserts are eh. In fact, I had the apple pie the other week and it was awful. The crust was just disgusting. Plus it's not a slice of pie, it's a quarter of a pie. Fortunately I've never paid for a meal here. Gibson's is hands down worth checking out. Make your reservations in advance regardless of what day of the week you go. If you can't get in, Hugo's Frog Bar next door has a different menu but serves Gibson's steaks.

Of all restaurants, high end steak houses are, by far, my favorite. A great steak and red wine is pretty much impossible to beat in my book. Out of all the other options (Morton's and  Ruth Chris are nearby) for steak, this is my favorite place to go. Well worth the price. And being able to order off Hugo's Frog Bar menu as well makes it a no-brainer when I'm looking for really nice dinner.

So disappointed.  When you are with a group I get that you may not get your best experience, but I have to say that this was subpar. Oysters good, beef Wellington bites gummy doughy and after one bite just an embarrassment on my plate.   Bone in sirloin just abysmal, and the sides of asparagus and potatoes were boring. Dessert better but not memorable.

I wish I could remember our waiter's name. He was very good even though it was extremely busy on a Saturday night.   Had the New York steak. You can't go wrong with that juicy steak. The restaurant is also located on Rush at so you can go have some beers at Dublins located across the street during your wait.

+Gibsons has "OK" beef. Most Chicagoans have never been to a real steakhouse because there hasn't been a real steakhouse in Chicago. (Delfriscos is slated to open in the fall of 2012). +The wait staff are nice and friendly.  +I'm not a fan of the massively large cakes...they simply are not "ridiculously good" that I would expect at a high end steakhouse +The mixed drinks are delicious however.

Wow! Fantastic! Amazing. The dinner made up for our ridiculous wait even with having a reservation that I made nearly 2 weeks ago. My friend and I came here yesterday, he had never been so I was really excited about the treat he was in for. To start, we had a 10pm reservation we weren't seated until nearly 10:45pm. It was really crowded so we just waited until we were called. We were seated at our table and immediately served water. Our waiter came, Karl who I HIGHLY RECOMMEND, and told us about their drinks. We got a bottle of Pinot and I had the cosmopolitan martini, fantastic. STRONG, but very good :)  We both got two separate steaks- I had the bone in filet, cooked medium, wish I would have done medium rare for that but, I know next time. And my friend had the Porterhouse cooked medium rare, absolutely spectacular! We had a double baked potato and I also had gotten the wedge salad. Our waiter was fantastic about going through the cuts of steak, the different way they are cooked, the seasonings you can get, I was super impressed. The sides are definitely meant for two, and we passed on the dessert, although they were HUGE and looked awesome. Definitely a pricey place- for two people you'll definitely spend around $200-$300 but well, well, well worth it!!

We were taken here by a local while on vacation. Swan-ky. I definitely felt undressed, good thing we just popped in for a quick martini. My cosmo was very good, but it didnt really stand out. What did was the large wall of pictures, headshots, and caricatures of all the famous people that have eaten there over the years. Very cool. We hope to go back for a meal the next time were in Chicago.

In a nutshell, we had a shoddy server in the bar.  She insisted she did not have a printout of the bar menu (which we requested because at 9:30 pm we simply wanted a couple of drinks and a light supper).  "Sally's" goal seemed to be either to get rid of us or to sell us expensive food.  We've ordered from a bar menu at Gibsons on prior late-night visits, so I believe we were being played for fools here.  Gibsons management should engage employees in a customer service refresher course.

Recently had an anniversary dinner with my significant other. The wait for our reservation was our only tiny issue due to massive Overcrowding, but the food more than made up for the 30 min wait. The 22oz sirloin I had was "too die for" the waiter even retrieved creamed corn from next door for us and the bottle of "prosecco" was the exclamation point on a great night.

I live in California but have been visiting Chicago at least once a year for the past 23 years.  On every trip, I make it a point to have dinner at Gibson's and often times will stop by more than once.  It is always crowded so highly recommend you make reservations far in advance.   As far as steakhouses go, Gibson's is among the best in the country for overall experience.  The atmosphere is very lively from the piano bar room to the restaurant.  It is the ultimate "hopping" restaurant filled with Chicagoans and visitors.   As for food, the steaks are always prepared very well and are quite large.  I rank Gibson's in my top 3 steaks (number 1 belongs to Wolfgang Puck's Cut in Beverly Hills).  However, if you are looking for overall great, fun time, with exceptional food and service, then Gibson's is the place to go in Chicago.  Kathy, the Manager/hostess, is very accommodating and friendly to all guests.  I recommend requesting to sit in Mohammed's section for the ultimate Chicago steakhouse experience.  You'll understand when you do.   The Chicago cut bone-in rib-eye is the steak you want.  Flavorful, full of marbling throughout and very flavorful.  The large lobster is the perfect compliment to the steak and has always been cooked perfectly and delicious!  Without question one must order the crab avocado salad.  It is bar far the best crab dish I have every had.  The light vinaigrette they make it out of this world.  The lobster cocktail is also quite good, but not in the same league as the crab avocado salad (note - it is not a salad in that there is no lettuce).  Side dishes are huge and make sure you bring your A-game appetite to finish an entire meal plus desert.  A great wine list with very reasonable prices for a high end restaurant.  You can also bring your wine, which is what I generally do and a corkage fee of $15.  You can't find that at most high end restaurants.   Speaking of desert - the turtle pie macadamia nut ice cream slice is enough to feed 6 - 8 alone.  WOW is it good!  Just order it regardless of how full you are.  You will end up eating it as once you start you can't put your spoon down!

I went for a group occassion.  The filet mignons were very small.  Clearly, they were trying to save $ on this group affair.  In the end, I will not go back on my own dime. The sides were good.  The wait staff were very kind and professional.

Humongous portions! Especially desserts, do not order more than 1 for table of 8 or less. Exceptional steaks, pay attention to how they cook em, tends toward more rare than most (you may want to go up a grade from your usual, several of us wished we had or sent them back but we were warned). Sides are good but lacking imagination, Joe's killed in this category. Dessert is delicious but more of a novelty than anything else.

Gibson's has always had a reputation for being a top notch steakhouse in Chicago. Not anymore. What a huge disappointment my visit was today! The lively crowd could not save this restaurant from itself. Our server Andy was personable and pleasant, but even he couldn't help that the food was a disaster. The bread and (frozen) butter didn't come until after our soup was finished. My fillet and mashed potatoes (I've had better at weddings) were ice cold when they arrived. Seriously? A $30 plate and it's cold? When I got a new portion it was warm, but had ZERO seasoning. The mashed potatoes reminded me of the stuff I was served in public school. The asparagus was cold as was the hollendaise sauce. I was expecting a lot but got very little at Gibson's. Truth be told, I only went there because Ruth's Chris was closed. I will never make that expensive mistake again!!
