By far, my favorite restaurant in the city. Service is always excellent, and I specifically ask for Elvis, yes his name is Elvis. The food is always excellent, and the location makes it convenient to bar hop to other places after. This place makes it hard for me to check out other steak restaurant's, but I figure why mess up a good thing.

What was supposed to be a visit to the local bar from one of our favourite TV shows turned into an episode of the show!!!  We sat on the patio to enjoy a nice Chicago beer and our server asked if we wanted food.  We told him no and that we only came by because we wanted to grab a drink at the bar one of our favourite TV shows hung out which is The League on FX. What happened next was about an hour of shenanigans and fantasy football talk!  It was pretty awesome and even the manager came out for a quick greet and to talk some fantasty football!!! Some notes, the staff were amazingly friendly but honestly they were super biased to us since we had a few things in common to chat about.  However we did notice the table beside us not like one of their appetizers and their server said she would exchange for anything he liked on the house and knock that item off their bill.  The couple said it was fine and thanked the waitress. The area is beautiful...I'm not sure what was up with the intersection but it was pretty decked out with a very European feel. Note to League fans, the inside does not look like the TV show.  It's much like Tom's Restaurant from Seinfeld which kind of sucks because we wanted to go in and trash talk some :) I wish I had a chance to try a steak but we were full before getting here.  I'd definitely come back and enjoy the great atmosphere and what seemed to be an amazing serving staff.  The hostess that walked us in was very pretty, witty, funny and down to earth.  It seemed the whole staff was pretty cool and made me feel like a regular.
The Service was Fast and Attentive. The Steak was a Great piece of meat and cooked exactly as directed. The Lobster was tender and delicious. The Price was most agreeable.
Can't say enough on how pleased we were with our evening. Food terrific, service OUTSTANDING, thank you Elvis!  Easily one of the best dining expierences ever. Can't wait to get back to Chicago.

Casual dining atmosphere. You can wear jeans. Filet mignon was good, not great.  Hamburger was overcooked. Wine was good. Chocolate cake for dessert was obnoxiously big. It was the size of an entire birthday cake. As soon as i saw the size, i knew it had to be crap. No wonder we have an obesity epidemic in this country. Will not return to this restaurant.
I enjoyed my steak and the sides that we chose to go along with it, but I'm sorry, I was #notimpressed by the caramel turtle pie.

My Fiance and I have been to Gibson's many times, and I have to say - I just don't dig the vibe of the main dining room. It feels so touristy and cheesy.  You think of a steakhouse that has been around forever, you think of fine dining. You want to dress up. This is always a mistake at Gibsons unless you luck out and can tuck yourself into a table in the bar area - which is far more romantic.  That being said, onto the food!   I am not a huge fan of steaks so I usually order the appetizers we know we love. - In particular the crabmeat avocado (crabmeat stuffed in or lying under an overturned avocado with some kind of sauce on it) which is almost always delicious, as well as the oysters for my fiance.    This time we also ordered the 'spicy lobster cocktail in steamed artichoke' - though the lobster wasn't spicy and the artichoke was merely a serving element; I really feel we were robbed on the artichoke part. Don't advertise it as a steamed artichoke if you're going to completely gut it!  Still, we enjoyed the lobster well enough.  We got the lobster bisque, which is fine but pales in comparison to the amazing lobster bisque you can get at Capitol Grille.   The Caesar salad was decent as an add-on. All in all, go if you know what you want, but don't expect to be bowled over by anything high-class.  This is a steakhouse, with checkerboard table clothes.

Definitely not the typical steakhouse. The attire, the atmosphere, everything but the staff is much more casual than say a mastro's.  The prices are similar, maybe a few bucks cheaper, depending on how you look at it. I ordered a surf and turf- lobster and steak. yum.   But what I think makes the biggest difference between this steakhouse and others is the size of the sides.  They're huge and worth it.

I came in on vacation just because I wanted a steak.  I saw it was like 40 dollars for the cheapest steak (just the meat) but was too embarrassed to leave and wanted the steak anyway.  I ordered the new york strip (i guess it was the sirloin according to their menu....and medium rare of course).  It was the best steak I have ever had.  It was so good that for years I have been trying to use google maps to find this place because I never took down the name.  The pics confirmed it though this is def the place.  I think maybe it is hit or miss though because others have called their steak mediocre in these reviews.  Maybe because i came in during an odd hour and they had time to pay attention to cooking my food well as nobody else was there.

Steak was excellent. The service was very good. The ceasar salad was ordinary. The french fries were cold and not  flavorful. Asparagus was bland and water logged. The cream spinach was good. We had a baby and they were accommodating.

My man and I came here for an anniversary dinner a while back. I made reservations a month in advance, got a call a week ahead of time to confirm, and showed up on time to the restaurant. I was meet with the rudest hostest I've ever encountered, enough so that it put a damper on the rest of my evening. She blatantly ignored me and spoke to other customers behind me first. Only after her boss asked if I'd been helped did she act like I existed.  After waiting some more, we were seated at the smallest table in the place. There were other open tables and couples seated before us at larger tables who had arrived after us. Enter, our waiter. Poor thing, I probably had the worst grimace on my face. But he still managed to turn it around and get me focused back on the wonderful dinner I'd been hoping to enjoy. We shared the shrimp appetizer and some raw oysters, both of which were delicious. Not fishy and the shrimp even had a little kick! I ordered the 10 oz filet, medium, but it came out medium rare, so I ate what I could and shared the rest. We also shared the double baked potato, which was HUGE, but really nothing special. They wanted something ridiculous for the lobster tail, so we opted out. The whole feel of the place is just a bit dated. For the price of the food, they could at least update the dishware; it looked like cafeteria plates and bowls. The ambience was enhanced by the weirdo crowd- those 60+ looking to supper club in gaudy suits, awful tans and thick jewelry, lots of middle aged women in the piano bar up front trying in vain to look appealing, and packs of suited-up business boys celebrating that fact that it's Friday. Pros: seafood starters-try 'em out! large serving sizes reservation confirmation call a week ahead of time Cons: hit or miss on staff friendliness expensive for lack luster food crowded I think I'll try the other steakhouses in town next time...

It's hard to say this is the best meat I've ever had...cause let's face it, this Midwestern girl's had her share of meat;) I will say it didnt disappoint. The filet is perfectly cooked and aged. I tried some of the salmon...perfectly cooked. The big butcher handed guys walking around= love it.  You will not experience something new or cutting edge exciting, but you will def. not be disappointed.

This place is completely overrated.  The hostess was rude and condescending and the waiter was indiferrent.  I ordered filet mignon and asked for it to be medium-well.  It was completely dry with no flavor. I really expected more from a steakhouse. I wish I'd spent my money elsewhere. This place is over priced and the service is barely satisfactory.

Substandard food. Ordered crab avacado app, tenderloin, lamb chops, potatoes and asparagus. Problems with cooking temps and service was too casual. Couldn't wait to leave, spent 220. Too much for what we recieved.
Food not fantastic. Service good and desert was awesome  way too big. Steak was not cooked properly for our entire party. Too many others places in Chicago to consider this a place to return to.

Everything was perfect. Lobster, steak, sides, everything. We also had the most knowledgeable, likable, helpful server that I've ever come across. I believe his name was Mohamed. Ask for a table in his section. He truly enhanced our experience.

I went for brunch for the first time today and it was very good.  Been before for dinner as well. Staff is very attentive. Had mimosas, caprese salad, and turkey Reuben. The steaks are flavorful, and the portions are always very big.  Dont be afraid to share! Seating outside in the front is a bit better for people watching than on the side. Legendary Chicago steakhouse. Best bet: traditional steak dinner at a Chicago landmark. Highly recommended.

I dined here last night with a friend & her 5 male coworkers. It was my first time getting the full Gibson's experience besides a few networking events & bar visits at their Rosemont location. We had an 8:30 reservation & of course, we weren't seated until closer to 9:30. That's all part of the experience when dining at Gibson's so it didn't bother me. We went in the lounge & had some drinks which is exactly what they want you to do. We were seated at a spacious table in the dining room & ordered a few apps. I'm not a big fan of oysters but I'll try them every single time in hopes of finding that I actually do like them. The oysters last night may have done the trick- they were delicious! The crabmeat avocado was great as well. I didn't try the tomato goat cheese but it looked great! My friend & I split the 10oz filet and with all the sides ordered, the 1/2 portion was more than enough for me. The sides I tried were the hash brown potatoes, mushrooms, and asparagus with hollandaise. Each one was delicious! I'm kind of ashamed to say that this was my second dinner of the evening (after a HORRIBLE meal at Porkchop in the West Loop- see that review for more info, haha) but when you're at Gibson's, you have to eat... especially if someone else is paying =) The service is excellent as well! The staff knows how to customize the experience for each table. We were a rowdy group so the staff had some fun with us but I'd see the same set of servers at a more subdued table & their demeanor was completely different. I think adapting to your customers is the secret of great service! When my friend sitting to my left spilled her red wine in my direction, the staff was quick to respond with fresh napkins. When her coworker sitting to my right spilled an entire glass of water in my direction, again, the staff saved the day & cleaned up the mess. They didn't seem annoyed or put off by these accidents as I'm sure they have to deal with a lot worse on a daily basis.  Gibson's really does cover all the bases & dining there can be enjoyable for just about any type of client (families, businessmen, couples on a first date, sugar daddies, cougars, etc...). I hope to be back again soon but more importantly, I hope when I do go back, someone else is paying. =)

I had been here before for drinks, and remember admiring the food on the table... but I had eaten elsewhere and was just meeting friends... This time, there were four of us and we came to eat and drink!  And boy did we.  The service is so damn good and so stellar... Unobtrusive but attentive... and funny as all hell.  This particular group loves jokes and having fun and every one played along.  I fricking love that!!!  And the food... Come on... The Lobster Bisque... silky, rich and delicious... my Gin Martini... perfection and they even brought extra olives... Every detail was covered... and the Chicago Cut, Cajun style... So good!!!  That was my breakfast the next day, too.  Huge portions.  Comped dessert.  From the hostess all the way up and down, the staff is fantastic, great atmosphere and just a fun, fun place!!!  Wish I lived closer, that's for sure.

This place greets you with an anorexic bitchy hostess. (i tried to be sweet to her and even made a joke & she was so rude and stuck up).. Husband got the steak; me the lobster.  No joke husband had to have them remake his steak THREE times.  They couldn't get it right.  They're known for steak and couldn't do it right!  My lobster was chewy and not that great.  We were disappointed.

Typical upscale chain Steakhouse right?? :) No way!! Seriously, I truly enjoy coming to this Gibsons location, not only for the steaks but to people watch and to socialize. Service at this restaurant is usually some of the best in the business. The knowledgeable staff seem to know how to handle steak veterans like myself or newbies to the prime steak world. I have no complaints here. Now I am hungry again!!

Gibson's is arguably one of the best restaurants in Chicago (and one of the best overall meals I've had in quite awhile) where both locals and tourists alike enjoy an old-school ambiance with massive (and I mean MASSIVE) portions.  Gibson's is perfect if you're in the mood for steaks, which vary in size but all have delicious quality and flavor.  On my visit, I had the hamburger that was a perfect size, and while the sides that accompanied our meals were delicious, they were bottomless plates of food!  Luckily, we saved room for some dessert but ended up getting a nearly 5 pound mousse cake that was both fantastic as well as inedible because of its size (doggie bags here are a must).  Adding to our great meal was professional wait staff that was prompt and great with recommendations.  Along with its great location in the heart of Rush Street, Gibson's is the place for a memorable meal in downtown Chicago.

This is an excellent old school steak house.  The servers are very attentive and the food is very high quality.  I had the Spicy Lobster Cobb salad which was really delicious.  On a prior occasion I had a filet Mignon which was cooked perfectly to my rare specification.  (Its hard for some places to get rare right).  This place does it right.  I also ordered broccoli sautéed with garlic and oil.  It was a little on the soggy side, but not terrible. The macadamia nut turtle ice cream pie was amazing.  Its gigantic.  Enough for 4 people. Even if you don't finish it, its worth a taste. I will definitely go back to this restaurant again. Plus, they use the outside for the TV show "The League".  Give it a try.

There are plenty of reasons to visit Chi-Town and one of them is to try one of the steakhouses. I'm from Texas so we know steak. I know you may see a four star here but that's because there's a steakhouse that has won my five in Texas.  Gibson's is not falling short by any means. My husband and I shared the W.R. Chicago Cut for 22oz. Did we finish all 22, YES and walked it off for the rest of the evening in Magmile but I digress. I still find the finesse in presenting the cuts of steaks on platters for suggestions much like you would present the dessert tray. Guys, if you go here, expect to pay the price because of the service and the food. We had the loaded wedge salad to start and sides of sauteed spinach and mushrooms with garlic as a side and double baked potato. Both are very large enough to share. We had the carrot cake for dessert and a bottle of red wine which I do not remember.  At a place like this, don't be on a budget, use your motto that you only live once. Go the mile by getting at least more than two courses so you can enjoy the experience. I've been seeing also guests ordering more than just a steak here. I think one day, I'll try crab or lobster at some point but the presentation of the cuts of steak always gets me.

The Filet Mignon and the W.R. Chicago cut are the steaks to get here.  The filet was absolutely melt in your mouth amazing.  The sides were great as well.  The alaskan king crab fingers were the only sore note, being unusually small compared to their portions on basically everything else.  Goat cheese and tomato was also great.  Sheldon was a great waiter, I'd definitely recommend asking for him if you get the choice--real classy and made you feel like you were worth the meal you were eating.

first time I went there, I was with a relatively large party for lunch.  I was treated well and enjoyed the meal very much...actually pretty reasonably priced for lunch with a good selection and the steak I had was amazing. However, the last time I went there...I went to the bar since I was by myself and was COMPLETELY IGNORED for 10 minutes!  I got up to leave and only as I was at the door did someone sort of say something to me.  I walked out and went across the street.
I had the ribeye and it was excellent. I couldn't finish the whole steak and it was still excellent  the next day as leftovers. The service was excellent.

I would love for someone to have even one complaint. Absolutely impossible. While I was visiting Chi-town this past week I went to Gibson's first for dinner and then again for lunch a few days later. It was THAT good.  First night I tried the Salmon, and it was AMAZING!!!  When I saw that they offered twice baked potatoes I had no choice but to order it! When is arrived it was a potato on steroids, it was HUGE and extremely delicious! One of the folks I were dining with ordered the Chicken, and it was the largest portion you could imagine. Literally a full chicken. Two gentlemen sitting next to us ordered the chicken to share, grown men!  The ambiance is of a great steak house. Could not ask for much more, that is for sure. They have a full bar inside and looks like at night becomes some what of a minor social scene. When I went back a few days later for lunch a friend and myself split a Hamburger and a side of Mushrooms and Spinach. All the food again were large portions, extremely filling and absolutely a treat for our stomachs. If ever back in Chicago I would most definitely make sure to put Gibson's on my agenda!
Expensive, to be sure. Very good food, the steaks were good. Having recently been to Lawry's, I'd have to say the food was better at Lawry's - with the exception of the spinach. Quite delicious here.

These are what we ordered: Crabmeat avocado  Chandon red wine Baked sweet potato Mushrooms Ribeye Chicago cut Everything from start to finish was amazing, not spectacular, but amazing enough. The only thing I would comment on is don't bother showing up early for your reservation.  They will not seat you until your reservation time, which is not bad nor good.  Just a comment.   The decor inside is also very cool.  It's great for parties or getting a drinks with friends.  Enjoy!

I'd like to start out by saying that I've been in the hospitality industry for a number of years and have frequented some of the best steakhouses in Chicago. To boot, I've been to Gibson's a number of times in the past and each time it has come up short more and more each visit.  This past visit (Yesterday) a fellow previous patron and myself both ordered the bone-in sirloin medium-rare and both of ours came out VERY well done. We addressed the issue with our waiter who proceeded to second guess us by asking us to cut the steaks in half and igniting a lighter while asking us to what degree we thought the steaks were over cooked after we had already told them that they were charred.  A manager brought two steaks back that were blue in the middle meaning as rare as a restaurant can legally serve meat without breaking health code. We sent the steaks back once again and upon return received steaks the were charred to an-uneatable crisp with a very cold blue 1/4 inch center.  Never have I seen such a reputable and renowned steakhouse handle a mistake so poorly. It will be hard to make a return to Gibson's.

Last year my wife and I ate here. The service was top notch and food was really good. My wife had the crabcakes which was very tasty and I had the 48oz prime rib which was the shit! I love steak and this place is one of the few i would come back when were in town (from St. Louis Missouri). I highly recommend this place.

Service was fabulous- our waiter knew everything there is to know about steak. Also loved the display of he actual steak cuts before we ordered. Got the double baked potato which was- without doubt- the best baked potato I have ever had.  Sadly, I got the 14 oz filet mignon and I must say I was disappointed. I ordered it medium well but the central 70% was essentially rare and the flavors were just NOT there (I've had much better homemade filet mignon and at other steakhouses). Will probably try a different steakhouse next time we're in town but will come back for the baked potato.

If you are considering a private party in Chicago, go to Gibsons.  Britini is the catering manager and one of the most competent people with whom we have ever worked.  The staff is fantastic, we have never had better service at any private event.  And finally, the food!!  The tenderloin sliders and crab cakes were so perfectly delicious along with all of our other food choices.  Britini did a great job assisting us with everything, especially the amount of food to order.   This party was a welcome party for out-of-town guests before our daughter's wedding the next night.  It was perfect! BBW

There are a number of things that must all come together to merit a five-star rating: service, attention to detail, food quality, food preparation and presentation, ambiance and, above all, taste. On my last visit, Gibsons had it all. What a pleasant evening. This old style Chicago steakhouse has yet to disappoint me. Better yet, it has each of the three times I've been there met my expectations -- which, by the way, we're pretty high.  You know ... Chicago ... steaks.  So, yes, my expectations were high. I arrived on time on a Saturday night with my girlfriend and another couple, having made reservations a week earlier.  We were promptly seated, despite there being a fair crowd awaiting tables.  The server couldn't have been more perfect: friendly (but not too friendly), knowledgeable, attentive (but not too attentive) and helpful. Bad wait staff can ruin an otherwise wonderful dining experience. He enhanced it.  But let's get to the food. Before I go into what I had, though, I have to offer a touch of "USA" -- unsolicited advice. Go hungry.  The servings are massively large; and if you order and eat everything from soup to, er, creme brûlée, the last thing you'll order is a wheelbarrow so they can wheel you out of there. I really enjoy good bleu cheese, and started with the Loaded Wedge. One really can't screw up a wedge, so I don't have much to say other than what I ate of it was really good.  (Remember, I had to save myself.) Then the waiter brought out the tray that showcased each cut of meat. When in Rome, right? ... I selected W.R.'s Chicago Cut.  Twenty-two ounces of medium rare heaven.  My guests and I ordered three sides to share; the creamed spinach, mushrooms and the not-to-be-missed (really - don't miss it) double baked potato.  My USDA Gibsons Prime Angus Chicago Cut came out perfectly prepared. Really, perfectly. Couldn't have been better. The creamed spinach was very tasty. Not to thick, not too runny. The mushrooms were nicely done. And then there was the double baked potato. The double baked potato was bigger than my size 11 shoe! OMG, a meal in itself.  And it was very, very good. Please, share it with at least two other people or call for the aforementioned wheelbarrow. Dessert is unnecessary at Gibsons only because so much food precedes it. But, at Gibsons, the dessert IS necessary if you get the Macadamia Turtle Pie.  Another OMG experience that you have to share -- this time with three other people because it is so large. We four had good, fun conversation, and the enjoyable company topped off this five-star dining experience.  There are a lot of excellent steakhouses in Chicago. This is one. I highly recommend it.

I've been to some good steak houses in the areas i've lived in...and this experience ranks among the top. From the moment we walked in - the service was spot on as expected from a place like this. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly and easy to talk to. We ended up talking about sports, Chicago restaurants & nightlife. They also do a good job of not making you feel rushed here.  The food was outstanding - that goes without saying. We split a porterhouse and got a few sides to go with it. The steak was cooked to perfection and couldn't ask for a better meal.  We didn't end up getting dessert but we saw a few at the tables around us and they looked incredible. Definitely worth going all out for a good evening at Gibson's.
I just don't get all the buzz.  Food is 'ok' - but nothing spectacular.  It is a great place to hang out with some friends - but have had better.

Steak was good. Filet Pittsburgh with a little horse raddish sauce made the meal. Our waiter Moe was spot on. One of the best servers I've ever encountered. No BS knew GIS stuff and was in point the whole meal. The mouse cake for dessert was ridiculous. One slice was enough for 8 if us. A great place to eat on Rush Street.

I love the old school feel and the steaks were delish! one of the best steaks, if not the best steak I've ever had. The seasoning was so tasty, I took my bone-in sirloin home so i could gnaw on the bone. minus one star for having average sides. I ordered the mashed potatoes and broccoli sauté. both were just okay. come here for the steaks! i tried both the rib eye and sirloin and would definitely go back for more scrumptious red meat.

It was my first time trying Gibsons and of course I had to get a  steak.  Everyone was right, perfection is a GREAT STEAK,  it was a perfect day to enjoy lunch outside.  The service was outstanding and I will be back soon. Thanks Brian..

Enormous servings!   We SPLIT the 19 oz NY steak,  AND a potato but had our own salads.   If we hadn't, the meal would have been $150 and we would have had leftovers(not good for a fridgeless hotel room).   All this talk about hardly cooking the steak is better?   It was crusty good and flavorful on the outside but cold on the inside.  I would have preferred the whole steak to be at least warm.  Tons of waitstaff for your every whim.  The place was packed but they seated us right away.

The best steak I've ever tasted in my entire life! If you love steak, you have to try this place! It's very crowded and loud here, so just be prepared. Not the best place for a romantic and quiet evening. Make a reservation if you can.

Great steakhouse to bring clients. People have often heard of it before we bring them and the added novelty of celebrity photos on the wall helps give it a very interesting vibe. I would call it a "safe bet" for out of town guests.

One word - BIG!!!  The food here is prepared for giants, I swear!!  I can't say that it's the best steak I've ever had, but, it was good!!  And we're talking indulgent.  They don't skimp on anything... steak was even served with a decadent Bernaisse sauce.  The sides - even the sides were massive.  And OMG - I almost fell off my chair when I saw the desserts.   All of the desserts are made fresh there - sure, they are pricey but when you are getting an entire cake as your slice, it's really not all that pricey.  We couldn't finish our slab of cheesecake so we packed it to go... I swear, that bag weighed the same as a small infant!   The atmosphere is a cross between a family steakhouse and a nicer establishment.  The service was nice.  Definitely a must try if you are in Chicago. And it's located right near the Rush Street area - totally happening area that you can pop over to after having a hearty meal!  Of course, we were too full to get drinks... couldn't fit anything else into our stomachs!

Simply the best steaks in Chicago.  Great food, excellent service, a great bar and professional bartenders. Great atmosphere.  The hustle and bustle is part of the scene.  People watching at its best. Yes, it's expensive.  Great food & drink are these days.  And for a fun time, just sit at the bar.  Have an app or 2, (great shrimp cocktail), a couple of drinks and call it a night.  If you are tempted to order dessert, make sure to share with your neighbors.  You won't be able to finish it yourself.

The steakhouse is located at a very nice area with lots of restaurants. The service is great. They have a good selection of win and some realy nice stakes. It is a litle expensive but it is a must try if you are into a good amarican stake. I couln't prebook, but went there anyway and got a table. Right next door is Hogo's - the owner is the same, so if you can't get a table at Gibsons, try Hogo's. It is the same!  PS: I would give Gibson an extra star if they had free wifi - I was there alone due to a business trip so wifi for my smartphone would have been great.
Gibsons has fantastic steak. Classic Chicago steakhouse with great food. Chicago Cut is a "cut" above, if you will. Still, you can't go wrong with Gibsons Steakhouse.

A Chicago institution.  Definitely worth trying as it's up in the stratosphere of elite steakhouses.  I think Chicago Cut slightly edges it out as best, but it's much better than mortons, capital and the other standards.

Wavered between 2.0 to 3.0   Finally Overall 4.0 rating.    On our last night we were anticipating having dinner here to wrap up our getaway.  Anticipation, anticipation.  I ordered the filet mignon with bone in.  Of the 8 of us, they forgot my order.  What!!!  Forget the Yelp Elite's order?  Strike one.   Now I've got to share the oversight here.  Our server apologized. Luckily I had my doubled cooked baked potato to work on.  My filet mignon with bone in arrives.  I begin to eat.  I ordered medium rare   After several slices, I see it's rare.  No can eat anymore. It's moo'ing at me now.  I bring it to the server's attention.   Now it's strike number two.  We compromise.  He says instead of $53.25 filet bone in price adjusted to the small filet mignon $37.75.  Also offered to bring back to the kitchen.  I decline.   Had at least three ounces plus some of hubby's 22 ounce porterhouse so I'm fine.   What saves the evening for me are the great cocktails, wine, and desserts.  We share the pecan pie and the lemon meringue pie.  Both are excellent.   I can't say it's great service but it's an overall nice dining experience for party of eight.  Very noisy.  Hustle bustle.  But when in Chicago must try.   $170.00 for the two of us.   Separate bills for four couples and no imposed gratuity.

The BEST part about going to school in Chicago, was dinner at Gibsons whenever the parents were in to visit. Parents weekend was the highlight if the semester. My parents would take me and my roomate(Steak Face) here whenever they were visiting from Jersey. Steak Face's family would always reciprocate whenever they were in town. The lunch options are some of the best in Chicago. I would usually order "The King" sandwich for lunch, but their French Dip was always my number two choice.  If it was dinner time, then you are hard pressed to find a better cut of meat than the Bone-In Fillet. It was the best steak I've ever experienced in Chicago. The old time feel of the place just adds to an amazing dining experience. You must eat here when in the "Chi"

Meh. The food is not worth the hype.  Oh- unless you like 50 year old men, tourists, undercooked steaks, and bowls full of butter (well, who doesn't like butter?).  The redeeming qualities are the service which is phenomenal and the desserts which are delicious. But ultimately, if the food isn't good then quite frankly I don't want to go back. Sorry Gibsons.

I went here with my Mom who was visiting from out of town. AMAZING STEAKS! I had the lemon meringue cake for dessert which was kind of a let down though. It was gigantic and looked pretty, but tasted a little bland. But like I said as for the steaks it was amazing. Friendly service and also a nice steakhouse kinda atmosphere
One word: Yes.  Better than my last Morton's experience. I waited an extra 30 mins past my reservation time - they gave us free dessert and shrimp cocktail and crab avocado appetizers.

Second time back Awesome shrimp cocktail- goat cheese tomato salad- grilled swordfish (my chicken/steak of the sea) Perfect Roy Rogers served w mini Coke bottles Service amazing.Try the raisin bread in bread basket! Don't recommend the asparagus unless u like it steamed w fibrous stalks left in tact.  (request a booth & get early Reservations reservations reservations)

If you live in Chicago and want the best of everything, especially steak.. go here. I know all the steakhouses advertise "We're the best" or "We're #1", but in the case of this place, its true.. this is where to come for steak.  (Joe's further south on rush is where to go for fish :) And all the others either smell funny or just don't deliver on their bloated promises.  I used to live in Chicago and this was my go to place for years. Avocado crab salad is excellent if you don't feel like having red meat. ALL of their potato options rock.. and when you ask the service to explain any of the food options they really know their stuff. These people are not working because they are really actors-models-etc., they are professionals and really take care of you. You never feel like you are bothering them with special requests which is exactly the way it should be.. because you definitely pay for it!  Desserts are massive, order one for the table unless you are trying to be diabetic.  Excellent for all events. It gets busy. It's fun to dress up.. but you can be casual and that's no problem either. It is in viagra triangle so people watching is also fun times!

Nom. Nom. Nom.  Yummy yummy yummy I love a great steak... and this was a great steak. The asparagus was cooked perfectly and the twice baked potato - oh yeah.  The portions are HUGE. We split the sides we ordered between 4 people and it was plenty.  The desserts are like... a 4th of a cake.... enough for a whole table.  The piano man is awesome - ambiance is great. Fantastic steakhouse. Apparently number 1 in the U.S. for value.  :-)  Next time I'm craving a steak... I'm going here

I'm slowly scratching major Chicago steakhouses off of my 'to try' list.  Last night we tackled this biggie while celebrating a birthday.  Honestly, it wasn't my fave in the steakhouse category - the original Morton's holds that title - due to a much more calm, classy atmosphere.  [ As soon as we stepped inside, the term 'viagra triangle' kept popping in my head - as many older, well-to-do-looking men were swarming to and fro in packs ]  This place definitely had more of a touristy, bustling vibe.   Not necessarily a good thing, but it did have energy - and a hell of a lot of celebrity photos adorning the walls, if that tells you anything.  BTW, we had our own celebrity sighting too, which was very exciting... (movie director + actor) Reservations were placed well over a month in advance and times at that point were tight, so we got in at 6pm on a weeknight.  We ordered a bottle of red, and enjoyed the comp table bread (3 kinds) while looking at the menu.  The man ordered a big ol' steak and a big ol' baked potato.  I ordered the planked whitefish with mashed potato and tomato/onion.  Entrees also included soup or salad - we both got the beef barley soup (pretty good, but salty).  The food was good - not outstanding.  I enjoyed my fish, but it was on the boring side.  Serving size was huge - for the fish and taters - which I appreciated, but I would have loved an accompanying sauce or more color/flavor.  It did come with a nice dill tartar sauce, but that gets a little heavy...  A solid "good" report on the steak and baked potato from the man.   We were too stuffed for dessert - especially here, where their desserts are literally the equivalent of an entire pie or small/medium sized cake.  I saw more than one waiter walking away with a dead dessert that had only a tiny fraction eaten off of it.  What a sad waste.....  The birthday boy did get a surprise group of staff huddled around him for some kind of birthday chant and a martini glass of ice cream with a candle.  Nice and festive. Gibsons was an experience.  Partly because of its big name in Chicago.  Party because of the celebrity aspect (seeing all the pics/history and seeing actual celebrities).  It's one of those places that I've been to, but don't really feel the need to go back to - unless I want to try and pick up a sugar daddy and/or I have a SERIOUS craving for a big ass piece of cake.
Always order the 24 lawyer cake first. Love the asparagus for an app and filet cooked rare.
Great presentation,attentive service,good place to bring Chicago wanna bees-Parisians loved their steaks, and marange  pie.They felt at home at Gibsons:)

I don't eat red meat really at all. So this review is based off what my friends ate. I had some white fish which was over seasoned so I wasn't impressed with my dish really. But my guy friends all order the steak and loved it. One had the new york, one had a filet and the other had the W.R. Chicago cut.  The 2 who had the new york and filet loved their meat and it was cooked exactly how they asked. My friend who had the Chicago cut asked for medium and it was pretty cooked. The baked potato and steamed broccoli were great.  We also had the shrimp cocktail which was fantastic. Their cocktail sauce has tons of flavor with fresh horseradish. We tried 2 desserts: carrot cake and lemon meringue pie; both atrociously huge. The carrot cake was good but a little dry. The lemon meringue could have been better.  The service is wonderful and prompt, if you're dining. If you are at the bar, it tends to take awhile for a drink.  Also, if you're into seeing celebs, this is a spot. We saw Kim Kardashian and Scotty Pippen the night we were in.

What's this I hear? There's a steakhouse near my hotel that is the only steakhouse in the US with their own USDA certification and they have this cut of meat called the WR Chicago cut that's supposed to be absolutely divine? I'm there! My in-laws and I went here for lunch upon the recommendation of their restaurateur uncle. We were blown away! The WR Chicago cut was amazing when served medium rare. It melted in my mouth! Per the suggestion of you lovely Yelpers, I also ordered the double baked potato. AMAZING. It tasted like a baked potato but with a mashed potato consistency. It was cheesy and perfectly seasoned. I will dream about that potato for the rest of my life. The portion is huge, though- it was able to feed the three of us with a lot left over. Our server was also pretty effing awesome, one of the best I've experienced anywhere. She knew everything about the menu and was very upbeat throughout our entire meal. Highly recommended if you're in the Chicago area. Ambiance is lovely and fancy- dress to the nines! Dinner seems to be very busy, but we were able to have lunch on a Saturday without a reservation.

Anytime my husband and I get to enjoy dinner together alone it's always a pleasure. We were given a gift card to Gibson's and made it our date night. First, it's best to make a reservation, we didn't, and ended up waiting an hour and a half on a Friday night, so we ate at about 10pm, there goes our movie :(  Overall, the dinner was OK. I had a steak and the largest baked potato I have ever seen! The double baked potato was good, and the creamed spinach was OK. What made this restaurant fun was our waiter Elvis. He was comical and would say something funny, and disappear quickly to do something else. I thought it was funny. It is also a place to be seen on Friday night (and Saturday, I'm guessing) so if you are not comfortable with that then this is not the place for you on these nights. We also had a great bartender who was very friendly. I liked our experience at Gibson's, the food was OK but prepared to spend some $$. Between my hubby and me it was 150 for 2 drinks, 2 sides, a steak and fish.
Great scene! Live piano music, and the food is to die for!

Rules: (1) Green means GO, red means STOP. (2) You now live in CA, you go back to Chicago - EAT STEAK The place is right in the heart of Rush street - plenty of bars and cabs to hop in and out of. It is nicely decorated and was bustling even on a Sunday night. The service is friendly and prompt. We got the crab and avocado appetizer - it was gone quickly.  Their side dishes are ridiculously huge - the fries must have been a huge bowl of at least a couple of pounds of fries. The spinach and mushrooms side dish was good - you know, I heat healthy.  The steaks are huge (sorry don't eat like a Chicago guy anymore), I ordered the smallest - a 10 oz fillet. None of us were able to finish our steaks. I ordered my steak with peppercorns and it was delicious. The wine and cappuccino rounded off the meal nicely. No room for deserts but we saw they were the size of bean bags and bigger than some of the billboards in Terminal 1. Starting today - I am a vegan. But you should go to Gibsons.

Restaurant Review Wrong order but still a good meal! Gibson was pushing toward 5 stars based on my prior experience at Hugo Frog Bar. I ended up going for lunch today. Luckily there was no wait around 12 pm on a Saturday as the crowds trickle in later. The service overall was amazing as the wait staff was lined up at the door greeting guest as they entered. As soon as we were seated, two glasses of water and bread basket appeared. I ordered the "Prime Rib French Dip" sandwich and somehow my waiter heard "The King of All Sandwiches" USDA Gibsons Prime Angus Ribeye Sandwich. I would be okay with this if it was for dinner, but for lunch this was way too much meat and cost 1.5x more than my original order. I didn't realize this until my order arrived. Unfortunately I didn't want to create a ruckus so I just took on the sandwich. This would be amazing at dinner time with thick slices of prime rib cooked medium rare with sauteed spinach and blue cheese dressing. The shoe string fries I would avoid, super crunchy and over cooked. My wife's lunch was significantly better and lighter with a crab cake with spicy mayo. Giant lumps of crab cake with minimal fillers. Overall food was great, service was good except for the order mess up... Still trying to digest all that meat Pro- super friendly staff, top grade steak house, the raisin bread in the bread basket is amazing Con- my order was messed up and I ended up SPENDING and EATING a lot more than I should... still digesting my lunch now Hidden deal- Lunch specials, less expensive than dinner time. I would recommend the WR cut which I had at gibson which was the best steak I have ever had.
Fabulous in every way!  It was a memorable evening for our family!

For an "upscale steakhouse" I found nothing upscale about my steak. But it wasn't bad either I had a filet migion.  But my favorite thing about the meal was sauteed spinach and mushroom with garlic. Order the small portion for two, plenty. The double mash potatos were good.  The service was nice.  And we found really nice bottle wine on there list, Cakebread Chardonnay.  It's place you should go just to say your tied it once.
Massive Desserts...Great Twice Baked Potato...Great Steak. You might even catch a celebrity

Great food, great service, great managers.  It was all great.  Even though our server forgot to ring in our salads we still had an amazing time.  I understand we all human and the staff did a great job making sure everything came out perfect.  The quality was all over the place.  Will return again.

I've only eaten here two times:  once inside at the bar and once outside.  I thought it was really good both times.  The inside is very beautiful but it is nice to sit outside too and watch people go about their business.  I had the shrimp cocktail before the first time I went there.  I didn't have an appetizer the second time I was there.  I had a chicken breast sandwich and french fries the first time I went there and the second time I had broiled salmon and mashed potatoes.  I never tried any of their desserts.  I hear they have good steaks but I don't eat beef.  My friend loves their steaks though and she thinks Gibson's is the best steakhouse in Chicago.  I do think it is very neat and clean there though but very expensive.  I expect that of the Rush st. area though so you should know that you better be ready to open your wallet if you want to hang out in this area.

I guess it helps to be a Yelper!  Friends tried to get in for a Tuesday night meal and were told there was a one week wait. I signed on at the time I wanted with my party of four first try. That said lets get down to the important stuff... beef.  Chicago has a lot of steak houses. Many chains, which to me can be good, but they are chains and have different issues maintaining constancy around the system. I was looking for something good and local. Gibsons fits that. Essentially the same format as all the others. Good beef examples, presented during your ordering, side dishes for the table, pricy wine list with a few fairly good selections for us cheapskates with a number of three digest priced bottles for the grandiose and so on ...  this is the current formula for "steak dining " in America.  The steak and sides were fabulous... no question... but they are fabulous in the chains, most of the time, as well.  What made the Gibson's experience special was the service. In particular Elvis O. Wilson,  our waiter. He not only provided great service he had an encyclopedic knowledge of steakhouses and restaurants around the USA. He helped make this visit a cut above the rest.. If you can get in... ask for one of Elvis' tables. You won't be disappointed.

The only reason for 4 stars versus 5 was the filet seasoning or maybe it needed some more seasoning.  But this is a power dinner, business-deal-closing-celebration type place.  Also the parking was an issue so I couldn't go 5.  But this is for power brokers and big names to be seen.

If you only go to one upscale restaurant while in Chicago, make it Gibson's. Gibson's is the quintessential Steakhouse - complete with walls of celebrity photos, a piano in the main bar and cocktails that will leave your head spinning after just a few sips (and all of this before you even get to your table!). Once we were sat, our server got straight down to business. He suggested a great bottle of wine and even offered to comp it if we weren't completely satisfied (we were). He then brought out a tray full of plates with all of their different cuts of meat and explained the differences in each and did a fantastic job answering our questions. I went with the bone in sirloin and it was amazing! I wish I could learn to cook a steak that perfectly. The sides were huge and we just split a few among the 4 of us and still had tons left over. The sauteed spinach and broccoli as well as the mashed potatoes were huge and easily split (with leftovers) among a table of 4.  For great steaks, amazing service and a fantastic atmosphere, Gibson's is a can't miss while in Chicago! (Just to give you an idea of prices/clientele - Matthew Stafford and Calvin Johnson were sitting next to us, right after Johnson signed his new contract. If the highest paid player in the NFL picks Gibson's as a place to celebrate - you know it has to be good!)

A fantastic old school steakhouse.  I go to steakhouses in a lot of the big cities in the US and I have to say this place is one of my favorites.  Got the Chicago Cut served rare.  It was slightly more cooked than rare, but overall, it was an excellent steak.  Very flavorful and wonderfully marbled.  Service was top notch as well.  I thought the monster dessert portions were a bit of a gimmick, but it did not draw away from the excellent meat.

Went into Gibson's hesitantly. I normally stray away from "high-end touristy" spots. I should have stayed away. Only went in for something light as it was lunchtime, but I expected a nice meal nonetheless. I ordered the Spicy Lobster Cobb Salad. It was nearly 12 dollars for the small, but I didn't want to spend almost 20 bucks for a salad, lobster or not. So the bread came first, not warm which was disappointing, but the bread was good. The salad came soon after. With a name like Gibson's, I would expect something more than iceberg lettuce. I had to pick out the stem parts in order to find any edible leaves. The lobster was near nonexistent and was chewy and overdone. At the end of the meal, I had a piece of bread, two bites of lobster, and a quarter of an avocado all for the not so low price of 12 bucks. They might have good meat, but if they don't take pride in something like a salad, they will not be getting my money again. Good riddance.
Classic Chicago! Amazing!

Sorry Gibson's.  I've lived in Chicago for 25 years.  Been there over a dozen times and each time I go the food is shoddier than it was the last time.  I was there last week and my filet was a joke.  It looked like a raw piece of meat rolled in dust, and it tasted like a Jewel steak cooked in my oven.   Maybe I'll continue to take clients and friends there for drinks, but never for food again....Hopefully

On par with any top tier steak house in NYC.  Lobster appetizer is tremendous. Service is always great. Steaks are prepped and cooked to perfection. The only draw back is that if you have a party of 6 or more it gets a little stuffy at the table. Not enough of a detractor though, the experience is that good.

Wow! Absolutely amazing steakhouse! Make RSVPs and it's a must eat at when in Chicago!! I had a Porterhouse steak. I can't remember all the fancy terms the waiter mentioned, but that steak was a hit!! I also had their dirty martini with the olives, onion, and cheese. Stunning pairings!
Just a good steakhouse.  Really enjoyed my surf and turf.  Filet and lobster with double baked potato was great!

Amazing, this place is really one of the best steakhouses in Chicago and in the US.  Fantastic cuts of beef, sides, drinks and desserts.  The service was stellar, we really enjoyed our waitress and she took the time to explain all of the cuts of beef and the pros and cons to each.  We wanted to try something new and my friend got the Chicago cut (makes sense since we were on vacation the Chi) and I got the New York Strip (my new favorite).  The wine perfectly complimented and steak and the lobster bisque that came with the steak was one of the best bowls of soup I've ever had.  Creamy, hearty, and full of bits of lobster. Overall this was the highlight of our trip and can't wait to go back when we're in Chicago!
Yummy food. I give it four stars because when its busy its hard to get a hold of your server but other than that, the food is spectacular and so is the ambiance.
Best steak place around! Piano Bar,fun people,busy place and great location !

Oooooh yaaaaaa!  This place is the standard when it comes to steaks and service.  The hunks of meat are bigger than life and once they hit the table, total photo opp!  The prize is a savory and cooked to perfection, bone-in steak to absolutely die for!  Great, must eat spot when in the area. Bottom line: Beast steaks and you'll leave way stoked!!!

After a grueling hour and half hot yoga session we decided we needed a damn good steak where else is a girl to go?? Gibsons! Luckily they were able to seat us considering we walked in and it is restaurant week. Major kudos for their incredible service! The wait staff was friendly and god damn they know their meat!  We got the caprese salad, mashed taters, mushroom and onions, and of course the WR Chicago's Cut...cooked rare of course! The caprese salad was simply delish! The tomatoes were firm, juicy and giant with huge slabs of fresh mozzarella slices and good helping of basil. The portions here are huge...so the mashed potatoes and mushrooms were more than enough for us!! Now let's get to the steak! We both got the WR Chicago's Cut...yes it is 22 ounces of meat just shy of the 2lbs of pure goodness! If you get the peppercorn rub try a light rub of it, otherwise it can be a little overpowering. The cut was perfect! Just enough marbling to give it a great flavor without too much fat.  As for dessert, we had the turtle pie. Good lawd! This pie was giant, huge, big...actually it is the size of a human head! Not going to lie it is that perfect food when you are feeling down and need a pick me up....finish this whole pie and a bottle of wine or whiskey (whichever floats your boat) and ta-da all your troubles are gone! I do recommend the pie, but make sure you have several people to share due to the size  Great service, amazing food, very attentive, and expensive! Will go back again!
The mini Filet Burgers are amazing. Fast service. Ordered in the bar not the restaurant though. Got a few dirty looks for having tattoos and jeans on but other than that everyone was friendly enough.

Simply love Gibsons. Been there more times than I can count. One of the top 3 steakhouses in Chicago. You pay the price...but the price is worth it...EVERY TIME.  Excellent staff. Accommodating hosts. Excellent bartenders. The food...well...the best.

Not going to lie, I had an urge to try Gibson's because of my appreciate of The League. While I didn't get to sip 'tinis with Ruxon or Taco, I did enjoy a few cocktails and the ambiance. And by ambiance, I mean the side show that is the Gold Coast on a Saturday night. Lots of rich white folks and yuppy couples out on the town plus a good dose of Mich Ave tourists coming in for steaks. Rumor has it the lounge plays home to high class escorts. If it's true, those girls blend in seamlessly, mainly because a good swath of the patrons are dressed semi-trashy and Real Housewife-d out to the nines. There was an awesome piano player for part of the hour and half I was there, which was pretty enjoyable and made the whole scene more eclectic than weird. I took up a table for four by my lonesome for about an hour before my companion showed up with nary a salty comment or glance from the server so props to this place for not trying to churn me out. Our tab wasn't cheap, but then again, you wouldn't be here for $3 PBRs.

Our waiter was the self-proclaimed mini Kobe Bryant / Don Cheadle... (I only wish i had taken a picture of him) When we asked one of our local friends "Where is the best steak you've ever had in Chicago," he said to come to Gibsons. The ambiance of the old school steak house was great. The menu selections were awesome! Our waiter was the best... (he even gave us recommendations for nightlife). They bring you out a large plate with an uncooked sample of all the nights offerings so that you have an understanding of the type of meat and the size of it as well. It was great to know exactly what I was getting. We also got a loaded baked potato on the side (which was HUGE... enough for us three girls with leftovers). The steaks were cooked to perfection and were tender and juicy!  Quite pricey, but worth it for the quality.

I went here with the wife for a Valentine's Day dinner. I had the bone in Rib eye and she had the grouper. If I could have I would have licked the plate. My wife probably would have too. Excellent wine, service and meal. I will attend again. AND for a steak house downtown, I found the prices to be very reasonable compared to the other Steak joints in Chicago.

I went to Gibson's in search of the quintessential Chicago steakhouse restaurant, and left disappointed.  My expectations may have been too high, but this place wasn't the five star experience everyone talks about. The service was good, but nothing that made me feel warm and fuzzy inside.  The martinis were great and came out quickly.  I would have loved a beer with my steak, but they had nothing on draft!  I know this is more of a wine / cocktail joint, but a couple solid draft beers would be great. Now to the steaks.  For $50, I want something that is 5X better than the $10 steak I can get at Applebee's.  This was a good steak, but it was lacking and flavor and was a bit dry.  My wife got her steak with the peppercorn and you could only taste the peppercorn (they cake it on like crazy).  This was not the amazing, buttery, tender, and flavorful steak I dreamed about the night before (and believe me I'm not a steak snob).   I would consider some of Gibson's competitors first, but this is an A-OK steakhouse if you're in the neighborhood.
Not going back. Awful crowd. Boring steaks.....can't believe people think it's good

Why, oh why did it take me this long to eat at this Chicago Institution of Steakology!!! As soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted by the hostess and led to a nice big booth.  The walls leading up to the upstairs area are adorned with all the countless celebs, and athletes that have dined here.  Our waitress was exceptional, as she described the different cuts of steak, and recommended the W.R.'s Chicago for me.   I ordered it medium, with a glass of J Lohr Cab Sauv.  I also ordered garlic mashed potato and she warned me that it was big enough to feed a small village.  I have been to some good steakhouses, and I was eager to compare how the steak here would stack up. The steak finally came and she had me cut it to see if it was to my liking.  It was more on the red side than I usually like, but she promised that it would taste better that way.  She was absolutely correct!!! The steak was OMFG delicious...I think I had a meatgasm.  That was easily one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life, and it was paired with a nice red wine=perfection. The night was on the slow side (it was the Monday after the Superbowl). She comped us our dessert, and we decided on the Hot Fudge Sundae.  The combination of the great service, and exquisite steak equals a 5 star review. It is no wonder why this place is considered one of the best steakhouses in the country.  I will be back Gibson's...this is a promise.

This is where you should go to get a taste of The Chicago Style restaurant - Classic and classy! At a great location in downtown! I'm passionately a meat and potato dude and have tried many steakhouses on both coast as well as the south, but had the best bone-in Ribeye at Gibsons - though granted I had to make reservation two months ahead and even then they didn't have a table available past 6pm! But worth it! Huge place, but virtually packed with different types of people.  Professional waiters with positive attitudes!  Expensive, but again worth it. If you're in Chicago do try this place!

The steak here is definitely over rated and over priced, but the sides are huge and delicious. My party all agreed that the baked potato was delicious and buttery soft. Probably wont come back for a potato, however will stop for a cocktail if in the gold coast again.

Gibsons- Resting on their Laurels a Bit? So after a long wait for a reservation, we finally made it to the famed Gibsons.  First let me say the service was first class, and Greg and Jeremy made up for a series of memorable weird food incidents.     The Dwarf Oyster Caper My husband ordered a plate of raw oysters as an appetizer.  It came with a dwarf oyster.  It was so small, it probably wasn't legal to harvest, let alone serve to a diner.  When we pointed it out, Jeremy very quickly proclaimed he would bring us two to make up for the dwarf.  Problem Solved!  But really?  They should have known better.  Bet they wouldn't have served it to Mayor Daley.   Tough Cows and Cold Potatoes So we both ordered filets.  My husband complained (after I left the room) about his. They comped his.  But after we got home, he told me about his filet, and I then told him that mine wasn't that good either. (I only ate half-but didn't complain) On top of this, we shared a cold potato.  It was shivering.  In fact, the butter didn't even melt when placed on it.  (We didn't mention this either).  Its about the Food Stupid So I am thinking Gibson's is losing its shine.  I didn't go there thinking we would have issues with the food.  Its sad-because I really wanted a great experience.  I was on their side!   They blew it.   On a positive note, the service couldn't have been better, more attentive, or helpful when we pointed out errors-but really-there shouldn't have been errors in the first place.

Gibsons is great, but I don't consider the best steakhouse by any means.  They aren't in my top 3.  They have a good cut, but it is doesn't compare to Ruth Chris or Morton's.  My roommate had the salmon which looked great.  I just can't give it a 4.   After two attempts and different cuts (filet and WC Cut), I will not make a return trip.

When visiting Chicago, it was a hard decision to pick which steakhouse to visit. I picked Gibsons based on Yelp reviews and talking to a friend who lived in the area. With all the glowing compliments of this place, I was truly looking forward to a great piece of meat. Once you're seated, your waiter will come around with a plate of the different cuts of steak. You can see and ask questions as you like and I agree that seeing the different cuts was great. Here's what we ordered: -W.R.'s Chicago cut ($45.75) -Filet, 10 oz ($35.75) -double baked potato ($8.25) -vegetable combination ($11.25) You also get your choice of soup or salad with an entree so we tried the gumbo soup as well as house salad...both alright. I don't know if I had hyped this place too much for myself, but I did not enjoy my filet at all. Don't get me wrong, it was cooked exactly how I specified and the cut was USDA (for goodness sakes!), but I was unimpressed with it and didn't even finish it! The double baked potato was delicious and I would recommend it! The vegetable combination had 4 different veggies and was too large of a portion for us to finish. Service was great and the portions were generous, but I walked away not satisfied at all with my meat or dinner. 3 stars because the inner wasn't horrible...just didn't live up to what I was expecting.

I love Chicago for meat and the steakhouses. This was one of the better steakhouses I've visited. Only was there once but I still remember it being the best ribeye I've ever had. The deserts are very good but are insanely huge (great if you like leftovers). The waitress was a Phd of meat and knew all of the cuts and what you'd like. The side dishes were made perfectly but it was not a fancy smancy deal on those... this is a steakhouse, so meat reigns over all else. The decor and vibe is loud and busy, but so is most of Chicago, so I didnt mind. Also they really pack you in there, I felt like I could use just a touch more breathing room to enjoy my top priced meat :D

Surprisingly excellent value for your money!  Portions are good for two people sans take home bag. The only steakhouse I know of that serves salad or soup with an entree.  Yummy raisin bread with butter.  Slightly warm please.  Hearty soup of the day was 5-bean chowder. The Chicago Cut steak (the most marbled meat) was juicy, well seasoned and perfectly grilled.  The waiter brought samples of raw meat into our table to explain.  Waiter also has a cheat sheet to show the different levels of cooking.  No room for miscommunication. The carrot cake for $15 serves 20 people. I got a thin sliver courtesy of my Bucket List Buddy... It was 3 layers, ate one strip and the rest in the take home bag.  Delicious!  In other establishments, a dessert is $8 for 1 or 3 servings. Fabulous gift card promotion during the holidays -- extra $25 lunch card for every $100 till Jan 15. It's an old establishment with tried and true ways of serving quality food, value and service.  The phone jack on table is a sign when the establishment opened. Mixed Patrons -- a table with one adult and 5 kids, grandma and grandchild, charming gay guy who called a stranger beautiful, young couple, mature clientele, family get together etc. For the rest of my gift card, I will NOT hesitate to try the rest of menu -- fish n' chips and Cobb salad.

Hubby and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. I ordered a Med T-Bone, seafood gumbo soup, and we shared a doubled baked potato. Hubby ordered WR Ribeye Med. I didn't like my steak because it was way overcooked so I mooched off my hubby's steak. His steak was delicious! The double baked potato was to die for yummy! The gumbo was great! I wanted Calamari which wasn't on the menu, but because Hugos frog bar is owned by Gibsons our waiter was able to accommodate. I was disappointed in the calamari too, but other than that it's a great place, great service, great atmosphere, & the food, eh hits & misses. We had reservations and they sat us right down no wait, yay! ;) must be my good looks! Lol
I've been here a few times and love the steak! So good you can't go wrong. Now for dessert lol reminders that when they say a "piece" it feeds about 10 people but good mmMmmmm

One of the best meals of my life. Literally everything we ordered was phenomenal. I'd eat here twice a week if my wallet and body could afford it. Had: - Crab Avocado Salad: I hate seafood and still thought this was delicious. Very fresh. - 10oz Filet Peppercorn: Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. I don't really have anything else to say. - Boyfriend had the rib eye which he said was amazing. - Side of Spinach: Best spinach I've ever had. - Side of Twice Baked Potato: This thing is gigantic. We barely made a dent in it, but it was so tasty and you could reheat it later as a leftover. - Piece of Chocolate Mousse Cake for dessert.  This thing could feed 10 people easily.  Again, barely made a dent, but it was heavenly and was finished off later as leftovers. Very expensive dinner but worth every penny for a special occasion.  Loved it.

So it's our first night in Chicago and my awesome bf had made reservations for Gibsons for that night which was amazing!  We shared the 19 oz. New York Strip which was SO delicious medium-rare along with the double baked potato.  This was my first time trying the double baked potato and I gotta say, that is almost a meal in itself!  The potato was the size of my head so we also split that.  If you've never had a double-baked potato, then you must find a place where you can try it.  It is basically a baked potato that gets carved out and re baked with some cheese on top.  But the great thing about it is that it's almost like having mashed potatoes within the baked potato shell, all that yummy, tasty skin!  You get the best of both worlds!    I was so full by the time I took a couple of bites an so I packed the rest and took it home.  To be honest, I had eaten so much of the initial bread and butter that was so yummy!  But had a great lunch the next day...  The portions are family sized so you can definitely split them with your honey like I did! The atmosphere is awesome at Gibsons!  There's a million people waiting so reservations are very heavily recommended!  The palce is pretty big but it is packed, packed, packed!  They sat us at a small table with a spectacular view of the city.  We could see Tavern on the the Corner and it was great for people watching!  The city look so alive from the window, people are just walking the streets and the xmas decorations all around made the scene look whimsical!

This is now my Go To Steakhouse in Chicago. The steaks, the sides, the staff-WOW. The only downside was the rowdy drinking table at our elbows, but they finally toned it down when their food came and their mouths were full. We will return!

Without a doubt - best steaks ever. 4 went there on 12/23/11 Big portions, reasonably priced wine list. Great selection, friendly, knowledgeable service, huge portions, and massive desserts.  One piece of pie feeds 4 hungry or 6 average folks.  Old school charm meets fast modern, bustling restaurant = quite a place -- Go there!
i love having good meal and the steak did it

I'll just go out and say it; Gibsons is my favorite steakhouse. Period. Don't get me wrong, Gibsons is very much a standard higher-end steakhouse. The menus for these types of places are largely comparable and extremely similar. I wouldn't say that there's all too much that's unique about this place, with the exception of the quality of the meat. But although the menu and ambiance is 100% steakhouse, it's truly a cut above its competitors making it a wholly unique experience. FOOD: USDA Prime Angus beef! Given that I wasn't completely famished, I did something rational and logical; I ordered the smallest cut on the menu, a 10oz filet. Of course, 10oz steaks are nothing to scoff at, but compared to the monster 32oz+ prime rib that one of my friends got, the filet was tiny. I ordered mine rare and a friend ordered hers "Pittsburgh" style (rarer than rare), and both were cooked perfectly. We did have a mixup at the table where we received each other's steaks, but a quick switcharoo solved this. Our other friend got the Chicago Cut, which is a 22oz bone-in ribeye, which he only raved about. I normally get the ribeye, but I felt like a filet this time around, but I was able to try the different steaks. I do have to say, the ridiculous prime rib was my favorite and the one I'll have to get next time. Overall, meat was fantastic. Our normally talkative group fell silent as we marveled at how great these steaks really were. Then we began to verbally express our happiness with our perfectly cooked steaks with a nice char. To those that are purists, Gibsons doesn't seem to really season the beef too much; the chefs let the high-quality beef speak for itself. And I thank them for that! For sides, we ordered the gigantic twice-baked potato and spinach with mushrooms. Both were fantastic choices. The potato was creamy and didn't feel dense and the cheddar cheese was definitely higher quality than what you normally see. The spinach was light and cooked quickly to avoid the wilting that often accompanies spinach dishes. Dessert: we were graciously comp'd the Jerry's Cherry Pie and we decided to try the Turtle Macadamia Nut Pie. My favorite of the two was the cherry, with a nice crust and delicious cherry filling. This was served a la mode with an amazing vanilla ice cream. The Turtle Pie was essentially 10+ inches of ice cream, surrounded by a unique crust, chocolate, caramel, and of course macadamias. Our server was explaining the crust and the two(?) types of ice cream, but we were all too busy marveling at the size of the thing. None of us could recall what she told us and we were too busy eating.  To be honest, given everything we ate, I can understand why Chicago remains fairly close to winning the crown for fattest city every year. With places like Gibsons, you just can't stop eating, no matter how many STOP! signals your brain and overstuffed stomach send you.  SERVICE: Excellent. Extremely friendly, and eager to talk about the various cuts and cooking techniques used. The servers weren't afraid to run back into the kitchen to verify the answers to some of our questions, which I truly appreciated. VALUE/OVERALL: At first glance, Gibsons might seem to be a bit on the pricey end. Of course, once you understand that the place has its own beef designation of USDA Prime Angus, you start to realize that not only is it not really too expensive, but it's actually quite the value. Other places might have the same cuts for cheaper, but when you really look at the menu and realize what you're getting, Gibsons stands as one of the best steakhouses for your money.  I used to be a consultant and had the good fortune of both traveling and eating at some of the best restaurants different cities have had to offer. And when it comes to steakhouses, Gibsons really takes the crown. This is my new go-to steakhouse when I really want to throw down, and I recommend everyone to give this place a shot if you're looking for a first-class steak dinner.
A classic Chicago steakhouse. Great food, perfect martini's.

In another one of those "why am I admitting this on the internet?" moments, I'll fess up to following the last 4 or so seasons of The Next Food Network Star as closely as one might follow a more respected reality series, like Top Chef, or Khloe and Lamar. While such an admission may give you reason to think twice about trusting my restaurant reviews, I needed to come clean so I don't sound anti-sandwich.  As it turns out, one of Gibson's newer menu items, The King Of All Sandwiches, was apparently conceived of by none other than the winner of last season's Next Food Network Star and Sandwich King Of Chicago himself, Jeff Mauro. At $24, this sandwich is a definite no go. Ribeye, sauteed spinach and blue cheese dressing combine to make a fairly lackluster creation. Give me some gruyere or lardons (got a hard on for lardons), or something to give this sandwich some richness that plays well with the toppings. All I got was a bitter aftertaste.  Still gotta give it up for Gibson's. The service is always great, and as long as you order the right thing, you probably won't be let down with your food. In my observation, those things are: 1. The French Dip (less expensive and far far tastier than the aforementioned royalty of handheld meals) 2. The Prime Rib (presentation is potentially terrifying as it looks like they had to kill multiple cows to produce a piece of meat this large, definitely puts the laughter in slaughter) 3. The New England Clam Chowder (the secret ingredient is Tom Brady's tears) 4. The Wedge Salad (so retro, antiquated slang like "groovy" and "daddy-o" enter my vernacular while consuming) Anyways, I'm sure I could come up with more to say, but you're probably done reading and there's a very special episode of Aarti Party on in like 5 minutes, so I'm gonna boogie. You hear that Ryan L? That's the sound of me stealing your mojo.

We stopped in on a Saturday evening with no reservations. They were able to seat us in the bar area. Even though it was busy, our waitress was very attentive. They do not have a separate allergy/gluten free menu but our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and how items were prepared. The meal was mediocre and the experience was nothing special. Not bad, but we probably won't go back- there are much better choices in the area.

All about the atmosphere at this location.  Be seen at one of the hottest spots in the city.  The bar area here is and has been a hot spot for years.  Bartenders pour nice drinks, the staff is on top of things and the food is good but its definitely not the best steak in the city.   But the macadamia turtle pie is one of the best desserts around.

Not only was the food Amazing but the customer service was spectacular! I came here in October with some family and friends and have to say was wowed!  I made a reservation earlier that day and once we got there, we were immediately seated in the bar area for a pre-dinner drink. When they called my name, they said they had a table ready for 2 but I actually had 4 people so they immediately said to go have a seat back down and that they were preparing a table to be ready in the next 5 minutes.  It was! We got seated and ordered the steaks, this is where you come for steaks! The best steak in Chicago...we all ordered something different and they were all delicious.  While we were eating the GM came to our table to shake my hand and make sure everything was going okay and asked if he could get us anything.   He let us know whenever we were in town to shoot him an email or give him a call and proceeded to hand me a business card with all his information. Gibson's is definitely worth every penny you are spending, from the food, to the drinks, to the service!

I must say, I really loved their creamed spinach! Best creamed spinach I've ever had. The steaks were alright too...haha, I guess that's an understatement, they were great! This place is awesome. The meat has great flavor and is cooked exactly to your liking. The sides are tasty and offer generous portions. The drinks are strong. The service is top notch. What's not to like? Meethinks yes!

I have dined at Gibsons twice over the past year once for dinner and once for a late lunch both experiences although different were fantastic.  The dinner was a Christmas season date night with my wife. The atmosphere here is great the people watching is fantastic both in the restaurant or if you are seated next to the window and watching the action outside. The service is second to none professional career waitstaff not a kid working on the weekends. They know what you want and need and seem to be there when its needed with out hovering over the table. Our waiter was also funny friendly and knew everything about the food and options. We had a strip steak and a lobster tail our waiter served them cut to serve family style the lobster was in big chunks served in the tail it was great melt in your mouth lobster and the steak is prime aged steak as good a steak you will ever get. We tried to order a vegetable side but our waiter stopped us telling us the lobster comes with a vegetable, this is the kind of service I appreciate where they look out for you so you order what you want and need but not to excess so they can pad their tip. We also split a wedge salad they served that already split but it looked like just 2 regular salads I checked yes we where only charged for one. At the end of the meal I was stuffed they bring a bread basket out at the beginning of the meal and I am a sucker for a good bread basket so I did not have to much room for dessert.  Our waiter asked if we wanted something sweet I told him I was full and would have a Jack and coke for my dessert he would not hear of it and brought us out the biggest slice of cake I have ever seen it could of served 4 or 6 people and not only was it big it was yummy, turtle macadamia nut ice cream cake and what made it more sweet is he gave it to us complimentary. Best steak house in the city, best service and a interesting place to people watch. Lunch was post day of shopping while waiting to drop a family member at the airport. We where one of 3 tables the place was almost empty a stark contrast to the dinner where it was all action every table full but service still was perfect and we sat next to window and watched the show outside. Food was very good I had split pea soup my go to soup when I was a kid I like a little more ham flavor but it was good and served with bread basket so you can get full fast. I also ordered a burger it was tasty standard lettuce tomato onion not real thick but still juicy the fries where crisp and seasoned perfect I ate it all. The only problem was my burger sat in its own juice for a bit and bottom bun got soaked I pointed it out the waitress took care of it no problem. My wife and her brother ordered prime rib sandwich the sandwich came with a pile of fries that almost touched the ceiling and the sandwiches where huge also they both could only finish half even though the meat was juicy and flavorful and had some great toppings. If you want this you might consider splitting the sandwich is massive and its a bit expensive. My wifes brother got the blue cheese sauce for the sandwich on the side  and a note do that and dip your fries in it so good. serves was once again a highlight little things taken care of friendly and fun staff that are helpful but not intrusive.
