If you are in the area or want a great night out try Gibsons.

We (three) arrived at Gibsons at 745 for our 800 reservation on a Tuesday night.  We grabbed a drink at the packed bar and were seated just after 800.  Our table was a small round 4 top jammed in a sea of tables.  It met our needs but was by no means a good table...but that was within my expectations. Our waiter arrived and was a nice fellow.  He took our cocktail orders, returned with drinks and then brought us the cuts to view.  I am a fan of viewing the raw cuts, but others not so much, as they fear food born illness. In any event, our Waiter gave us an overview of the beef and we ordered.  I ordered the porterhouse, medium rare to rare, my comrades ordered the bone in filet medium rare to rare and the WR Chicago Cut medium rare.  Note the waiter specifically asks how do you want the medium rare and going closer to rare is an option provided by the staff without special request.  We also ordered sauteed spinach & brocoli, mashed potatoes, and mushrooms plus a nice bottle of Pinot Noir. This is where it went astray.  Our food came out looking good.  But instead of spinach & brocoli we were served spinach & mushrooms.  This was okay but our waiter proceeded to take it upon himself to individually pick all of the mushrooms out and toss them on his serving platter.  Strange and kind of gross - also - we ordered a separate side of mushrooms, we would have eatten them.  Anyway.  All of the sides were above average, nothing that really stands out.   Onto the steaks.  They were like butter.  We all enjoyed the taste and flavor.  In fact I loved my taste and flavor.  Only problem, my steak came out medium.  And the medium rare WR Chicago Cut came out bloody, and not medium rare.  The filet was cooked to perfection medium rare to rare.  To be fair the waiter offered a new steak, which I declined, as I wanted to eat and to keep my friends from feeling bad.  But for the reputation of Gibsons you expect them to get this aspect of the meal perfectly.  Here they missed. In the end the bill came and they charged us for for the mushrooms and spinach.  We thought this was humorous as the mushrooms and spinach are a bit more than the spinach & brocoli.  Also, if we paid for the mushrooms, we wanted to eat them!  We busted our waiter's chops a bit on this issue over cappuchino's and he comped the spinach. All in, everything was good but not great.  If men are going to throw down for manly steaks, getting 1 out of 3 steak temperatures correct just doesn't cut it.

Not much more can be said here. All of the good things you have read are true. Atmosphere, food, service, all top notch. I cannot say enough good things about how much we enjoyed our dinner at Gibsons. It was really a perfect night. P.S. Get the carrot cake and bring about 5 friends to help you eat it!

I LOVE this place, the manager, wait staff, bartenders, all make you feel like a VIP, and they are so professional. YOU are the star for the night.  The LOCATION for people watching is prime. The STEAKS (filet) are to DIE for, they are prepared perfect every time, pair it with a Pomo Martini made with gray goose and I am talking about HEAVEN.

Dined here this weekend....had an air of being a "legend" in downtown Chicago without being snobby or pretentious.   Had reservations for 4 which turned into 6 but they were very accomdating and seated us right away which was great because the bar was so crowded we couldn't even get closed to the bar!  Service was prompt if not a bit "hovering" especially by the guy filling the water glasses (literally we would drink 1/4 of out water glasses and there he was filling them again :-)...prices what you'd expect in Chicago but hubby and I split some things including a Filet and sides which they were gracious about and did not charge us a plate charge.  Wine was good.  We would return.

I have to be honest that after eating in a lot of very nice steak restaurants, Gibson's was above average but not as good as The Palm or Gene and Georgetti.  The ambiance was lovely, but there's no such thing as a sublime, peaceful evening here.  This isn't a romantic restaurant in which to pop the question; it's a place for "men of a certain age" and their pals to celebrate that certain deal.  It's also a place for mom and dad to take their large extended families during holiday season as judged by the number of big groups squeezed together throughout the main dining room.  This place is a chain, and they try hard to make you believe you're in an old fashioned steakhouse...but you're really not.  Any more cigarettes and cigars for sale at the coat check counter, and you'll swear you're eating in a supper club back in 1970. Once we were seated in a packed room at what must have been the worst table location available, our server got to work by showing us a large platter of raw cow muscle--nevermind that we might have wanted something from their seafood menu.  This place is all about steaks, so just gaze at all that raw muscle and sinew and hope your waiter washes their hands afterward.  A few minutes into our first course, we were fed up with our seating location and asked if we could simply move to one of the nearby empty tables.  Nope--unavailable.  OK, fair enough. My seafood gumbo was good, but my companion's dinner salad was bland and forgettable; a mix of basic lettuce, cherry tomatoes and...well, I forgot the other ingredient.  Probably something like red onion slices.  Places like this still haven't ventured much beyond traditional iceberg lettuce side salads.  They also haven't realized that Coke served in little 6 oz. bottles is not cute...it's cheesy and cheap.  The only other places that serve Coke in a can or bottle are cheap Chinese restaurants with names like, "Mao's Mongolian" or "The Emperor's Wok." My 14 oz. fillet mignon was hands down the best I've ever had...until I realized halfway through that they hadn't cooked it to my exact specifications--that happens at chains that turn tables fast, and I didn't want to slow my dining companions down by sending it back for another turn in the microwave.  We had our choice to share a large baked potato or twice backed potato.  Trust me: get the twice-baked potato.  It would have been twice better than the baked potato we were served.  You know you are really in Chicago in the 70s if a restaurant can't think of anything more creative than a potato, sour cream and chives to serve as a side.  They have other sides available, but only the potato is served as an included complement with steak dinners. My dinner companion's sourpuss expression and negative comments about our lousy seating location to our server got us, "How are you doing...can I get you anything?" from both the Maître D' and a manager.  It also net us a very nice desert treat at the end which was the second best part of the dinner after the incredible steak.  That was really nice.  Our server was nice.  She told us she washed her hands after handling the platter of dead meat.

2 weeks ago, I had my wedding rehearsal dinner in one of Gibson's private dining rooms.  We had about 16 people including 3 little kids.   I must say that working with Lynette to plan for the dinner was great!  She was responsive and accommodating.  On the evening of the event, Gibson's private dining staff was top-notch.  They were attentive and very very pleasant to work with. The food was excellent.  From the kids' slider burgers and chicken fingers, to the crab and giant prawn cocktail appetizers, to the steaks, sides and massive deserts, everything was perfectly cooked and prepared to our liking. I have nothing but high praise for Gibson's class act in the regular restaurant and now for their private dining experience as well.  Kudos Gibson's!  You are the best Steak House in Chicago!!!

It was my first time there, but I really liked Gibson's. Our waiter was excellent... very helpful, attentive, and funny. The steak was also really delicious, and actually cooked the right way... I'll defintitely be back!

I can't comment on the regular service, because I ate hear for a wedding reception.  Everything was great... the food, the drinks, and the service.  Our friend's wedding reception had king crab claws, oysters, jumbo shrimp, and some other stuff for appetizers.  Plus, an open bar.  For dinner service, we had a choice between for or five different entrees that were ordered at the table (not the typical choose before you get there type of thing), so the food was freshly prepared. The service by the wait staff was excellent.  It almost seemed like having a personal waiter...  Within a minute or two of finishing my drink, a waiter would come by to take my cup and ask if I wanted another.  When finished eating with the appetizers, the waiters would come and clean up right away.  Excellent service.
The Bone-In Sirloin was one of the best steaks I've ever had, baked sweet potato was awesome also.

Had dinner here on St. Patty's Day. The place was absolutely packed, but we didn't wait more than 30-min. for a table. This allowed us to enjoy the St. Patty's band and procession through the bar.  I had some stone crab claws, which were good but my son had a charred T-bone which was pretty disappointing. It just did not have a good flavor and he only ended up eating half of it. I took the rest home and re-seasoned it for breakfast and it was a lot better. The large sides were ok, but nothing to write home about. I guess I expected more from a place that specializes in steaks and charges such high prices. The service wasn't all that friendly either, but just chalked that up to it being a holiday crowd. Can't exactly recommend this place.

Had the pleasure of eating at Gibson's last week when in Chicago for a conference.  I had the bone in 16oz filet mignon.  Wow!  It melted in my mouth. Coupled with the twice baked potato and the spinach and mushrooms, it ranked as one of my best meals.  Then to top it off, we ordered the Turtle Pie for dessert. It was enormous and very tasty.  If you are in Chicago, Gibson's is a must go.

I check into my hotel in Chi town and ask the lady at the front desk where the greatest Chicago steak is, and she tells me you have to go to Gibson's. Ten minutes later, I am in a packed Gibson's at 10 pm on a Wednesday night. The Chicago chop is delicious, one of the greatest steaks ever. Service is excellent. I was dining alone since I was here for work, and did not feel alone at all. Staff is super friendly. A must visit if you are in Chicago.

Incredible steak at a classic location just off Rush Street. The house salad was really solid and the blue cheese dressing went nicely with it.  I got the Chicago Cut, a massive bone-in ribeye, medium-rare.  Expertly cooked and tasted great, there was some serious seasoning that added quite a punch to the flavorful meat.   Sides were good, but definitely not as exceptional as the steak.  The mashed potatoes were solid but maybe a little too rich/much butter for my taste.  The sauteed spinach and broccoli was pretty good and the baked sweet potato was also solid. The service is fantastic and extremely professional.  They bring out the cuts of steak before you order and provided a great wine recommendation.  I would look forward to coming back for some great steak.

We were a party of 6 for dinner there on Saturday. This restaurant deserves all the praise I had heard. Perfect steaks. I had a filet, others had the bone in filet and rib eye. We ordered 2 of the twice baked potatoes for the table to share. So gigantic that truly one was enough. Ordered asparagus to accompany which was served with a great hollandaise sauce. But back to the steaks, seared on the outside, cooked to perfection and they were obviously of prime quality. Best steaks ever! Come hungry. BTW, even with reservations, there is usually a 30-45 min wait for the table. When we left at midnight, the place was still packed.

There's a reason this is the best steakhouse in Chicago. They do it right. Wendy and I went last week for dinner while visiting the windy city. We arrived an hour early for a 730 reservation and...luckily found a seat in the bar area. Already packed. At 630 in Atlanta nothing looks like this. Had a couple drinks...not thrilled with the Bourbon selection which surprised me but good nevertheless. Were seated at 740. Great hostess and manager.waiter a bit business like but fine. Started out splitting their garbage salad which was delicious. I had the Chicago Cut and a loaded baked and both were great. Wendy had a baked potato and a bowl of beef barley soup and was really happy with both. The desserts looked amazing but we were too full. By the time we left, the restaurant was booming. We will return every time we are in Chicago
Always a great experience. Solid serrvice, consistent food. Steaks are well seasoned and cooked perfectly.

I visited Chicago on business and found this restaurant through yelp. This is why I keep going back to yelp. Anyways, this was hands down the best steak in the US. I ordered a t-bone and was in heaven.

My favorite steak house in the city! (!!!)   Prices are through the roof but there's only so many similar experiences you can get.  Drinks are good (strong), and the staff is very knowledgeable about the food.   Last time I was there I had a nice aged filet, medium rare.   Perfection doesn't really need much else.  Chicago Cut is also very good, and once in a while I get the lobster too.  Usually, side of potato is worth it too!

So, all week I have been at a conference and have been talking about my upcoming dinner at Gibson's.  All I kept hearing was they have the greatest steak on the planet.  Apparently, they were correct! WOW!!!!  I had the Filet, which is the size of a softball and was cooked perfectly.  I ordered medium and it came out perfect.  The seasoning was amazing and the flavor was the best I have ever had.   I travel quite a bit and have been to a ton of steakhouses around the US.  This was the best.  The place was packed, but we had a private room upstairs (about 17 of us) with the Brewer game on (they lost), but the steak was so good I almost forgot about the game, almost! A friend of mine just sent me a text bragging about how great his leftovers were at his house.  That pretty much sums it up.  AMAZING!!!!

There are numerous steak houses in Chicago and we're glad we tried Gibson's. Spicy Lobster Cocktail in Steamed Artichoke was not all that spicy, but the lobster was delicious. 22 oz. Bone in rib eye [W.R.'s Chicago Cut] was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten. Sides were excellent including mashed potatoes with gravy, creamed spinach, asparagus. The coconut cream pie was enough to feed our whole table of 8.  Salads better at the palm, steaks better here! Gibson's has a great vibe and our service was first-rate all evening long - attentive and full of great humor that made dining a pleasure.

As the 500th reviewer of this great restaurant on Yelp, I can say with conviction that this place does live up to its hype. We had a variety of items at our table of four.  Although the bill came to about $100/person, it was worth it.  Sure I didn't pay a dime for this business meal, but would my otherwise very frugal dining sense still feel comfortable dropping a bill per person?  Yes. The Chicago Cut is all that!  The prime rib is the same cut of meat; it's just broiled instead of grilled -- stick to the Chicago Cut.  Drinks are strong.  The side of spinach was bland.  Double baked potato was good and HUGE.  As a matter of fact, everything is huge: portions and the staff -- those are some big dudes serving!  And the desserts perfectly round out the meal.  Our one slice of chocolate cake fed four and the leftover continued to feed me everyday for two weeks! Whether you're a tourist or a local, Gibson's has the true Chicago feel.  As a proud Chicagoan, I'd be happy to recommend this restaurant to anyone.  And according to the rest of my restaurant ratings, that isn't all too common of me.  Save your cash stash and go for a special night out. Tips: 1) Wear some loose-fitting pants because you'll be stuffed.  2) Order the Chicago Cut.  3) Save room for dessert.  4) Jacket not required, but not frowned upon either.  5) Have a great time!

Kathleen, the Maitre d' treated my guest and I like celebrities... we weren't celebrating anything in particular and we were not as gussied up as we usually are, but from the moment we walked in, she took care of us like we were famous.  She even sent over a huge dessert and the end of the meal, on the house! Yelpers are right in saying this place is a MUST go to place for visitors, but it is our Go-to place for steak, seafood, or a luxurious meal without the hefty price tag.

Came on the recommendation of a friend and was NOT disappointed. Service was great and very fast (I was dining alone, so that may be why). I had the bone-in ribeye which was very flavorful. Only wish I had gone with my gut and had it rare instead of medium rare. Then, I had the macadamia turtle pie...or at least I attempted it! That thing is enormous!  I wanted to eat more of it, but only made it about 1/3 to 1/2 way through. All in all a great meal and a great steakhouse ambience. Would definitely add it to my list for special occasions when in Chicago.

Gibsons exceeded our expectations on every level. The steaks were tender, juicy, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The polite, attentive staff visited our table often without feeling intrusive. The manager visited our table to ensure that absolutely every detail was perfect. A salad was accidentally forgotten and the staff and manager profusely apologized then comped a dessert of our choice.  My wife and I experienced royal treatment and a delicious meal. A perfect evening in Chicago.

I have been at Gibson's... I don't know how many times. Service has ALWAYS been well above excellent. Food without a doubt is phenomenal. I had to finally write a revew because these guys seriously deserve 5 stars! My daughter has this obcession with Hugo's pan seared sea scallops so when we go to Gibson's she makes the wait staff fetch her a dish. This time the chef from Hugo's came up to our table and explained what was in this fantastic dish of hers so she can try it at home! I absolutely recommend this steak house to everyone who ever visits Chicago. Best food, best service in the city guaranteed.

On our visit to Chicago we decided to save a night for a delicious steak and Gibson was the perfect choice.  I've had my fair share of steaks and the filet did not disappoint.  Service was awesome!! We also ordered the double baked potato and it was delicious.  All this melted cheese on top it was amazing but I was happy I was sharing with 4 other people because that baked potato was a heart attack waiting to happen.  I ordered the 10 oz. filet and it was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  I would definitely recommend this place if you ever go out to Chicago!!!

500 reviews, here's my "Two Cents"/ Love the LOCATION! You really can't be more in the Epicenter of Chicago Nightlife.. Love the View/ Bar Room/ Great Pictures/ Great Windows, Etc. Great place to take a date or a customer from out of town. The Food is very well done, this is not usually the "Best" steak your ever gonna have but always Very Good.  They tend to do other things extremely well off the menu- Explore! Great Crab/Avocado Salad.  The Service is obviously great and it's old school style! GTFJD

Excellent steakhouse. Came here for my birthday and this along with the Chop House would be my 2 go to picks for great steaks when you just have the urge and need for beef. Double baked potato was amazing and if you can eat that as well as the steak then I will say to you...."Big Man!" These places have excellent service - seems like one wait staff per table and you do feel a little bit more special as a result. The old adage, you get what you pay for seems apt here. I'd eat here again in a heartbeat.

Several people told me that dining at Gibson's is a must for first time visitors to Chicago. Upon my protocol food research before my trip, I liked what I read, and so I firmly bookmarked it on my to do list.  Gibson's has a classic yet casual ambience. A pleasant departure from the sleek modern restaurants you so often find in big cities. It's nice to first start off at the bar and then work your way to the dining area after a drink or two. I had a yummy chocolate martini while waiting to be seated at our table. It's very strong; I reckon it put hair on my chest. It's also sweet, but not too sweet, so it's not necessarily a dessert drink.  For dinner I ordered the 22 oz. W.R.'s Chicago Cut. It was very juicy and cooked perfectly to my specification (medium). For my sides I stuck to starch overload--Baked sweet potato and french fries. Both were very good.  Ordering dessert at Gibson's is a must--even if you're at the limit of fulness in which you cannot fathom having another bite of anything. It's the most fun part of any meal here! All desserts are of behemoth proportions and can probably feed a small Third World country. We went with the classic Macadamia Turtle Pie. It's mostly a big hunk of vanilla ice cream doused in chocolate sauce, a bit of caramel, and macadamia nuts. The five of us barely made a dent in it, but it was still a satisfying fete.  Dinner at Gibson's was the perfect farewell from the city I now love so much.

This place came highly recommended by my best friend. She told me that I must go to Gibsons while I was in Chicago and since the prices were reasonable one of my girlfriends made a reservation weeks ago to have my birthday dinner here. We were a group of 6 with a 7pm reservation on a Tuesday night and this place was packed indoor and outdoor. Glad we made the reservation looking at how popular this place was. The offering of the different cuts of meat is shown to you by your server that brings it over in a silver platter. I shared the bone in rib-eye. It was cooked to perfection. It was nicely grilled on the outside and a little pink in the inside. It was called the Chicago cut. Since I came here with a group we ordered 4 different side dishes: double baked potato, baked sweet potato, asparagus with hollandaise sauce, and sauteed spinach in garlic. All the sides were a great compliment to all our steaks. The portions here are humongous so it was unfortunate that we didn't have room for dessert. Their dessert portions here are also huge from what we've witnessed. Sharing and going with a group is the way to go so you can try so many other things on their menu. This was the perfect place to have my birthday dinner and I will be back to Chicago and definitely going back to Gibsons.

great steak house went with a group for a friends birthday. we shared the appetizer of the crab and avacado which was really good and the spicy lobster bites main course i share with 3 people a porter house which as I love was really rare and i mean perfect. and the chicago cut which was really good at med rare great service and i like that they give you a soup or salad with your meal. all around good meal

Great service, I've been here a dozen times and never once had slow service. everytime I come here I order the porterhouse, oysters, and wine. great wine selection and the oysters are always fresh, only complaint I have is that it's always a little too over crowded, specially at the bar area while you wait for your table to be ready, but I guess that's what you get for dining at any busy restaurant in Chicago downtown.

A straight up steak house.  That being said, I expected better.  They overcooked my steak.  Sides were okay, but nothing super memorable.  I just feel that a place that specializes in steaks needs to cook it right and the sides should be show stoppers.   The highlight is the twice baked potato.  I warn you to not eat it by yourself unless you want to encourage instant heart disease.  It definitely covers two people and could probably be shared by more.
I was very disappointed in the steak - atmosphere and vibe are great.  It was like eating in a $300 diner.  Lots of hustle and bustle.

OMG! I'm in Chicago for the week and we HAD to check this place out and is was SO worth it! A little expensive but the food is among the BEST I'm ever, ever, ever had. Great service too! I want to come back the next time I'm in Chicago!
Place is great. Just go! First-rate food, service, atmosphere. Gotta try the macadamia nut dessert. Off the hook!
One of the best Filets I've ever had, highly recommend. Prepare to wait though, even with a reservation we waited 1 hour.

Wonderful street-side dining.  Crab and Avocado appetizer was perfect, for a warm evening. Filet perfect, melts in your mouth.  Lobster salad amazing with lots of tender, sweet lobster.  No, room for dessert, but they looked amazing as well.

Wholly cow this place rocked my world and changed my life. Extreme I know, but up until this point in my life I never knew steak could be so stupendous. Oh, and this is where I fell in love martinis (they make the best martinis) On a girl trip in Chicago for a few days and ate here TWICE it was that freakin' good! Both times I had the filet with some yummy potato dish as a side.  Pair your cut of beef with a vodka martini (or two) and you have an award winning meal in my book.  I don't know if this next part is customary or we 3 ladies were just fortunate, but we were the thrilled recipients of dessert both nights we dined here! WOW, gigantic and delicious desserts.  This place is insanely good. Wish I was a jet-setter because I could eat here every couple of months. One of the nights us girls visited there was a bit of wait which gave us time to suck down a martini and order an app all while enjoying musical delights from a pianist. The place is happenin' - spunky in the bar area, lively in the dining area, men in large groups getting there beef on (women are definitely the minority here, but that's okay with me). Go check it out and I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.   Great times!
Even though I went there with my horrible ex-girlfriend, it still kicks ass. Amazing food and service.

Love Gibsons!  Been here many times but this time we went for a piece of the amazing Macademia Nut Ice Cream Pie.  We had to go for dessert on my bday after a disappointing dinner at NoMI.  Gibsons did just the trick to turn the mood around.   When we got there it was still packed and there were no tables.  I told the hostess that we only wanted a piece of cake for my bday and she immediately sat us in the bar area at a smaller table but it was fine.  She came back to check on us twice making sure the table was okay.  The waitress couldn't have been nicer too.  The pie was amazing and the chocolate martini hit the spot.   Gibsons has become our bday dessert spot tradition.  I highly recommend that pie, but beware it is huge!!!
I've never been a fan of steaks. Nothing spectacular. They forgot to put the garlic on my fillet, it was tasteless. Just an interesting texture. Will ever go back.

In my first trip to Chicago, i was lucky enough to be taken to Gibsons.  In keeping this short and sweet I am just going to say this: The filet was done perfectly, from the cut of meat to the flavor. It was juicy and amazing. The twice baked potatoes were amazing. Simply the best i ever had.

I went here with my husband and his clients. It was our first time there and it was amazing! I ordered a medium Chicago cut rib eye and it was great!! Very juicy, exactly the way I wanted it, and tender...The BEST steak I have ever eaten. My husband got their prime rib, but it was only ok. It was kind of tough and fatty in some areas. Also, it could have been seasoned a little more than it was. Overall, we thought the meat was really good. When it came to the dessert, omg, we were so surprised when we saw how BIG it was. We got the 7 or 8 layer chocolate cake. The one slice was able to feed the four of us and was almost the size of a small cake. We had left overs for almost a week haha. Our waiter was awesome too! If you are able to sit in Paco's area, do it! He was cool and really funny. He also knew everything there was to know about the place. He was able to offer wonderful advice. It is pricey, but so worth it! I would definitely recommend this place!

best steak of my life.  cannot eat costco prime meat now.  beautiful char, a bone in ribeye that was as tender as any filet i've had, and flavor that is out of this world.  kelsey grammer walked by and eye balled our after dinner scotches.  we were eye balling the beautiful women on the next table.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in the city.  It has a great location within a few blocks of Michigan Avenue an really close to State.  Not to mention, it's within walking distance of the Cathedral and Loyola.   The atmosphere of Gibson's is very much your traditional steakhouse with a lot of wood paneling and photos of famous patrons.  The bar is a nice area with a piano and great big windows taking in Rush Street.  The dining room is a little crowded but I'd rather have a crowded dining room than a longer wait.   I'm a bourbon drinker and this place has a great selection of bourbon and other whiskeys.  The same could be said of their other drinks as well; a good selection of middle to high end liquors.   Now, onto the food.  A word of warning; the portions are massive.  If you come to Gibson's you better be hungry.  My favorite thing to get is the Prime Rib and it is incredibly massive.  I think the thing comes in at about 22 oz.  Needless to say, I took a lot of it home with me.  I ordered it medium rare and it was cooked to perfection: pink to red on the inside with all of the tasty juices left inside.  Since I had a lot left over, it was a big plus that it heated up well.  The creamy horseradish that came on the side was a great compliment, a good kick with a cream taste that balanced out the juices of the meat.  On the side I had the twice baked potato which would have been a meal in itself so I split it with my dad.  It was also delicious with the right balance of potato, cheese and bacon.   I have also had the blue cheese crusted filet with bernaise sauce on the side.  It's a great cut of meat though in my opinion not as good as the Prime Rib.  The one plus about it is that it is a reasonable 10 oz.  The service here is great as well.  They bring the cuts to your table to look at and help make your decision.  They are very attentive and the water was constantly being refilled as well as the other drinks.  I left a big tip for the waiter because of how attentive he was.  All in all I would recommend this place to anyone; whether a native Chicagoan or someone in for a visit.
Delicious food, decent prices and great service!  Best to sit outside, great for people watching and just relaxing!

Really impressed. As as good as advertized.  I had a MASSIVE steak overdose from the huge Chicago cut (bone in Ribeye).  Perfect char on the outside, melt in your mouth juiciness!  It was pure awesomeness!  I only wish I had a bigger stomach, because the steak was great.  I just couldn't inhale the rest of it because I was stuffed from the bread, king crab claws (huge btw) and soup. I can't do steak all the time because I can only survive a massive meat - food coma once in a while.  This would be a great choice if I wanted a fantastic steak. I had never tried lamb before, so I had some of my wife's lamb chops and that was excellent as well.

When I ask for medium rare, I want my steak to be pinkish red in the center and to be oozing juice.  My bone-in sirloin did not come out medium rare.  For all the hype that Gibsons gets, I don't understand why my steak came out medium. I was thoroughly unimpressed...we came here for a coworker's going away dinner and I had high expectations.   Instead, my steak was overcooked, the french fries we got were overcooked, the mushrooms were overcooked, the spinach was underseasoned, and the mashed potatoes were bland.  See the trend here? I'm really glad my company picked up the tab and I didn't actually spend any of my own money. Gibsons is completely overrated.  I'm not coming back here if I can help it...Joe's all the way!

So wonderful a top ten list is in order. I wish I was decisive enough to order these meaningfully but I am so flooded with fond memories that I'm unable to order my thoughts to be able...so in no particular order... 1. People dress to eat here but in a down-to-earth manner- every man in a button up shirt, some with sports coats, women in nice dresses 2. Professionals work here, not teenagers 3. The wait staff actually WAITS on you and the management MANAGES that staff with three suits to the floor for around 20 white coat waiters 4.  The cuts are brought to the table so you can see the quality 5.  The right kind of ambiance for a mid-west steakhouse with a dinner club flare  6. THE LADIES WASHROOM IS LOVELY! Staffed with the most charming lady who keeps things clean and in order. She has staffed the lav with mouthwash, breath mints, toothpicks, chewing gum, lotion, safety pins, every kind of hairbrush (seriously!), three kinds of perfume and so on. You leave feeling put together and ready to go out on the town. TIp her well- she is a professional and deserves every penny 7.  delicious bread- fresh raisin bread 8.  HOLY MOLEY THAT STEAK IS GOOD, I MEAN PERFECT 9.  good music 10 celebs eat here too- A Rod set right next to us...ok, 2 tables down:)

Definitely a love affair with Gibsons.  Chicago was a frequent stop in in after-college days with customer installs.  Did the Rush/Division tour in the "About Last Night" way and always wanted to go big at Gibsons but couldn't afford the coin. Finally saved up and had a college friend go in for a full deal.  Drinks, apps, steak, entree, dessert, cognac, port, and espresso.  What an experience. Gibsons continues to be a must stop for each trip to ORD. Steaks are incedible.  Dry aged as they should be.  Sides are huge, fresh, and delicious.  Desserts are outrageously large and easily feed the table of 4. Will definitely be back, hanging around the piano waiting for our table.

Your boy is back at it, folks!  It's been a minute, but I'm going to get back in the game.  Enjoy! Gibson's is a great eating experience.  For ATMOSPHERE, it's definitely got a "boss-like" feel to it that makes you feel like you're in the company of kings and queens.  I liken it to my experience at Sparks in NYC. Our server, Mohammed, took great care of our party of 6, especially since we were seated 40 mins after our reservation. The MEAL: we started off with the Crabmeat Avocado, which also came with cocktail shrimp.  Upon annihilating that, we were served Lobster Bisque soup to accompany our assortment of breads.  Mohammed then brought out a delectable tray of cuts from which to choose.  I was recommended to try the Bone-in Sirloin, medium slightly rare.  We also enjoyed spinach, broccoli, mushrooms, asparagus, and baked potatoes with the meal.  Complimentary dessert of apple pie with vanilla ice cream and chocolate cake were also provided. The LOCATION of the restaurant is also in a great area (Rush St) with lots of bars/clubs to hit up afterwards. You'll have a great time here. Giddy up, Ev
The service here is attentive and the food and beverage is the best there is in the Chicago area.  Steaks were cooked perfectly.

Having lived across the street for years I like to go to Gibsons or the attached Hugo's Frog Bar on off days and times to avoid the crowds that pack the place. Gibson's along with the other Viagra Triangle area restaurants gets slammed especially for dinner with businessmen during the week and locals and tourists on weekends so make a reservation. Gibsons is the classic Italian steakhouse with live piano in the bar, old school servers in jackets and all the steakhouse menu selections. The walls are lined with autographed pics of celebs and politicians, several Presidents have held dinners there and its got palm trees and ceiling fans going year round. For steaks its the bone-in ribeye hands down for flavor, the filet for tenderness or the pork chops for somthing different. If you want fish either go to Hugo's next door which is by the same owners and actually shares the kitchen or ask if you can order off the Hugo's menu. Side dishes are Flintstones huge such as the baked potato that looks like a football so plan on sharing them. You are not there for the side dishes and the side dishes are not the stars the steaks are and their steaks are some of the best. If you are there for lunch try the mini filet mignon sandwhich's which come three to an order and are served on tiny rolls with a garlic butter. Sit outside at one of their al fresco tables, order one of the many tasty options and people-watch the Gold Coast scene. You won't go wrong.
In the heart of the gold coast. Great steak and ambience.  If you are from Chicago, you know Gibsons.

Note that my review is based on a wedding rehearsal dinner I went to here. I do believe the quality of food and service would be the same if we had dined on a typical evening.  Service was fantastic! You honestly couldn't ask for a more friendly and attentive staff. The food was delicious too. There were a few passing hors d'œuvre, but dinner was where the magic happen. We started off with a very light lobster bisque. For our main entree we had a choice of a few things...I decided on the spicy pork chop (medium) and my boyfriend went with the sirloin (medium rare). That way we could share and enjoy both. Both were cooked perfectly. The sides were an incredible spinach (lightly sauteed with a hint of garlic) and a crawfish mac & cheese. We then ended the evening with family style strawberry shortcake and the most enormous turtle ice cream dessert I've ever seen. Loved it all.  Now since we were there for a private party...price did not come into play here. With that being said...I have no idea how much my meal would have cost, but I was very happy with how it tasted. I highly suggest this restaurant to all of my Yelp friends...and ask for them to tell all of their Yelp friends. When you're in Chicago...looking for fine dining...it's a must do!

I've eaten here many times after closing a deal or a successful show. It's always been a a favorite. I like the vibe of the restaurant. I've been here on weekends and during the weekdays. It's always busy. The porter house or bone in sirloin are my favorite cuts. I have never had to send my meals back because they weren't cooked correctly. I like my cuts cooked medium rare and dry rubbed with blackened spices.  The mushrooms and asparagus always go well with the meal. I have had the potato too, but will not order it since it is gigantic. I think someone called them the football potatoes. If you do get the potato, get the double baked. My last visit was interesting. After Eric Clapton's Crossroad's show, my friend's and I decided to stay in the city and then visit Gibson's to celebrate the milestone show. We traveled about 2000 miles for the concert. After being sat down at our table, I got up to wash my hands. I took my phone as I always do. Came back to the table. Ate, drank and settled the bill. I then noticed I didn't have my phone. went back to the table, no phone. Asked the attending manager to help. He asked the wait staff, still no phone. I back tracked to the wash room, the attendant asked if I was looking for something? I told him my phone. He said he was holding it for me.)) Whew! Gave him a nice tip and thanked him.

Make a reservation and your night will be easy.  Service is world class.  The food is world class.  Every steak on the menu is delicious.  The lamb was the single best cooked rack of lamb I have ever had.  Every portion is monstorously huge.  It deserves all the accolades.  A little pricey, but worth it, and you get so much food.  Eat a small lunch to prepare. And it is a pretty inviting environment for anyone.  Definitely can go as yourself.

I should preface this by first saying I am not a big steak person. Nonetheless, Gibson's is not really my kind of place in general as it has a chain vibe and many of the patrons seem like megalomaniacs or gold diggers.  Came here on a Saturday night around 9pm and it was packed, which is to be expected. Unfortunately, many of the people in the bar area were a little too drunk and were basically elbowing everyone and awkwardly hanging over the tables in the area. As well, during our wait some guy was kicked out by the police for hassling his girlfriend and other patrons... Classy.  In terms of the food, I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. I enjoy seeing all the cuts of meat and the giant deserts (which I unfortunately did not get to try). As for actual taste though, for an appetizer we had the crab dip which was delicious -- but our entrees were just so-so. The two people who ordered steak mentioned they found theirs tough to eat despite being cooked medium rare.  I had the broiled salmon which was somewhat typical fare for a steak house. The fish was tender but the flavor was nothing to write home about. As well, the entire time we were there, our waiter only showed up twice and he never asked to refill our drinks -- which is a shame because we were definitely in the mood for having drinks (having just graduated the day prior). Overall, meh.

I had the unique experience of dining at Gibsons with the owner of one of the Midwest's oldest and most well-respected steakhouses.   So when I learned he was the one who'd picked this venue, I figured Gibsons must be legit.   Like the opposite of taking marital advice from Arnold Schwarzenegger.  Zing! Initial observation was that the scene didn't reflect as many older man/younger trophy combos that I'd read so much about.  This was slightly disappointing as observing socially objectionable behavior is never not enjoyable.  Instead, I witnessed more business and even multiple family dinners (we were there on a Tuesday night.)  Overall it was a pretty comfortable and upbeat vibe which is in contrast to the stuffy and slow steakhouse experiences we've all been accustomed to.   Our waiter was hard working and knew his stuff.  But he had an "apprentice" following him around who couldn't seem to get anything right.  Ya fired (virtual hand gesture included.)   I'm not going to spend much time on the steaks because they're darn good, as you would expect.  Let's just say I was more than pleased, as was the steakhouse owner, with our steaks.   If you don't get anything else, you MUST have the baked potato with melted cheese.  Holy momma this thing was worth the price of admission alone.  You could even be "that guy" and order the chicken breast sandwich at a steakhouse and totally redeem yourself if you were well-informed enough to get the baked potato w/melted cheese. The desserts were gluttonous to the point of embarrassment.  Order the Macadamia Turtle Pie and you'll see what I mean.  Even William the Refrigerator Perry (5 bonus points for the Chicago-relevant reference!) would tap out long before conquering this Mt Everest of desserts.

You know a place is great when your walk in with 9:30pm reservation and the place is packed on a Thursday. So busy, they were still full and seating at midnight.  To me, this is the essence of big city Chicago. HUGE thick perfect and tasty steaks, massive side dishes, the BEST shrimp cocktail I have had in years shrimp fresh, huge, crisp... OUTSTANDING effective service.  This meal is all business as is the relatively spartan interior. Its fast paced and fun and everything is A++ exceptional! THE clientele is everything from sports stars to power brokers to suburbanites for their once in a decade big night out.  To top it all off, the night we were here the Bulls won a playoff series and everyone was treated to a MASSIVE MASSIVE piece of cake that we took home. It was an amazing chocolate/banana concoction. If it grew legs, I would leave my wife for this sexy piece of cake.  This is not just dinner, its a theater of restaurant magic.

The food portion are huge here even the desserts!!!!  Food portion and price is equal to Mastros (LA) but I hands down prefer Mastros. I think the meat here is more tender but I think that Mastros meat has more flavo. I had the porterhouse. Didn't have the chance to try out Mastros in Chicago.
Totally not a beef eater so I can't comment on the steaks BUT the lamb chops were to LIVE for!

Service was good.  A big selection of whiskey as expected.  And it was nice move by the waiter to bring out our the raw meat plate to whet our appetites.  Food porn, check! The sides were decent - the highlight was the double-baked potato.  A mound of baked cheese over creamy mash.  Everything here is in huge portions.  The desserts are comically huge. One of my tablemates and the servers dared me to order the 48 oz. porterhouse.  I shot back I would do it if they would pay for meal if I managed to finish.  They both backed off immediately.  That's what I thought... bitches - I can do 3 lbs. in my sleep. The 24 oz. porterhouse I got was on par with the $50 price point.  Succulent, good marbling and a nice char.  However, I had a bite of the Chicago cut prime rib on the bone and I should have went with that instead - tender and juicy.  That seemed to be the marque plate.  Servers were at full attention. So why the middling score despite and overall good experience and a big and good steak?  Well... it's really what to expect from a premium steakhouse - it didn't suck but it didn't blow me away either. And this is just me - but it falls well short of what I think an old-school style steakhouse ought to be.  Place is cramped and boisterous... in a bad way.  And I always found autographed celebrity photos to be cheesy.  Is this place trying to be primo steakhouse or a tourist attraction? Give me Gibson's steaks, portions and prices in an environment like Pacific Dining Car.  That's would be the ideal steakhouse.

Mmmm, the filet mignon was good (but a little dry), with a nice crust around the whole outside. The baked potato that came with it was special (with some mashed potato and some cheese type of thing on top), but the broccoli was weird (they basically didn't cut up the broccoli, and a whole stalk was served, unflavored, unseasoned).  The dessert? Awesome! HUGE, roughly three regular size cakes stacked on top of each other. I got to try the carrot cake (3-4*), and the turtle cake (5* - it had macadmia nuts on it too!). It's in a nice location, where there are a lot of other bars and restaurants nearby too.  The service was wonderful also.

I'm from LA, so take caution when reading this. I'll tell you why in a bit.  The atmosphere was awesome! It was classy, but I still walked in with jeans and a shirt. I didn't pack a collared shirt. When I walked in, they seated us immediately (we had reservations for 3) and were greeted well. Even though the place is classy, it is definitely relaxed. It didn't have that uptight rich snobby feel as other expensive steak places. The waiters were really friendly and helpful.  Before I ordered, they brought out some of the cuts they had to show the marbling on the steak. I don't think any of the meats were dry aged. But that didn't matter. I got the Chicago cut steak (fattier than the filet) that came blackened that was a very good medium rare. Last time I had a blackened steak was in New Orleans at K. Paul's. Both are equally good. The reason why I was impressed, was the price for the size of the steak. The Chicago cut i think was about 20 oz. for about $50 and my friend's 16 oz. filet (blackened and bone in) was $56. Those sizes for that price compared to LA is GREAT! So immediately I was in awe.  The steaks were awesome and the sides were good as well. Double baked potatoes had superb flavor and the garlic sauteed spinach and mushrooms were well done! GREAT WINE LIST. For desert, I had their Macadamia turtle pie ($16). Vanilla ice cream topped with macadamia and chocolate. The best part, other than the size (serves 6), was the crust. The crust was dense, but when you bite into it, it crumbles so easily. IT WAS AWESOME. The waiter used a steak knife to cut the slices.  Finally, it's a good place to spot celebrities. That night I saw Ron Harper and Loul Deng (after he played his game).  Good food, GOOD portions, and good service ... awesome, but expensive.

I normally select a steak house very careful because everyone advertises as the best or unique well maybe that is the case  but this Steak House is one of my favorite for plenty of reasons been there a few times  Decor is back dated but very comfortable and warm welcoming and environment atmosphere    but plenty of areas to be seated and some of them have some privacy  Service is a 5 start servers very attentive to your needs and  always prepared for  answers.. like  their spicy lobster salad but my favorite is the avocado crab is just delicioso!!!!  Entree Their porter house is just their top notch item not because of the price but for the way they know perfection. Another item is the in-bone filet Mignon is as great  Sides spinach wit olive oil and baked potato is a most ... excellent wine list always order some Rufino Chianti of a nice silver oak Cabernet,or nice Merlot frog leap don't forget to try their small chocolate cake... WELL since my experiences have been the best i have nothing more to say.....
Im all about service and this is where you can find it. You def. pay for it but it way worth it.

4 1/2 stars rounded up because I just have a fond spot in my heart for Gibson's.  This last visit I sat at the bar (what's new!).  The bartender Joe is great. I started with a salad with blue cheese dressing.  Nice chunky pieces of cheese and plenty of tang. The bone -in filet was very good.  Was it the best steak in Chicago?  No, but it was very good and the side of creamed spinach was very good too. The best part of the experience is just having some wine and checking out the scene. If you can't have a good time in the bar at Gibson's, there's something wrong with you!
Very good steak. Very good fries. Heinz ketchup. Makes for a happy man.  Not a fancy place, in a frou frou sense. This is for testosterone junkies.

I'm pretty sure if gluttony had a poster child, Gibson's would be the number one candidate.  Steaks as big as your head! Desserts that weigh as much as a baby! 5lbs of butter crammed into that double-baked potato! Oh yes, it definitely would be Gibson's. And roll me out like a fatty when I'm done.  This is your grandfather's type of steakhouse. I picture mahogany books, cigars, and brandy when I walk in. Thankfully, they deliver on the steak. Steak is never typically something I crave, but I do appreciate when it's done well. And Gibson's bone-in filet is divine (not as good as Joe's, but then again, nothing is).  I also judge a steakhouse on their fish, and in that department, Gibson's also is very solid. The salmon and planked whitefish are both decent options. For a business lunch spot, Gibson's is actually fairly reasonably priced, and offers a nice variety of sandwiches and scaled-down dinner entrees (though they are still quite hefty). I hope you don't have to be productive post-lunch, because food coma will ensure regardless.  A Chicago staple, for good reasons.
Amazing. Excellent. Yummy very professional staff. Everything that we ordered was just perfect.

Over rated.  Over rated.  Over rated.  Really?  Big price, no taste on the steak.  Well unless you used the seasonings on the table.  Also do I really need to sit closer to the person at the next table then the person that I am dining with.  For the prices that they charge I should be able to dine in comfort.  Proceed directly to go and take a pass.

Dinner was awesome. I've been to a few high-end steakhouses in Chicago, and I think this was the best I've had. I had the 10oz filet, lobster bisque (awesome), twice-baked potatoes (also awesome) - and the waiter brought out strawberry shortcake on the house (which also happened to be awesome). Probably going to have to do a revisit here

This is what I've imagined a great Chicago steakhouse to be.  Loud, crowded, and boisterous, be sure to make a reservation!  Even better if you haven't eaten all day....vegetarians and dieters beware!  Everything here is ginormous.  Table bread = 3 loaves for a table fo 5.  Just when you think "holy cow", what seems like a whole cow's worth of raw cuts of meat are presented by the waiter to explain the different cuts you can select.   My friend and I decided to share a 10oz fillet mignon which was cooked to perfection.  Sides included mushrooms, spinach with olive oil, and french fries, all of which were delicious.  Even sharing the fillet, both of us couldn't finish it.  The others in our party attacked their steaks but the massive steaks won.   We decided we couldn't leave without macadamia nut turtle pie dessert the size of a human head.  What were we thinking???  Oh but it was good.  Headed back to the hotel to promptly pass out in a gluttonous food coma.

One of the best filet mignon steaks I've ever had...a knife was just barely needed, but if one happened to not be available,  I'm sure my fork could have cut through the uber tender meat just fine.  Their chicago cut steak was disappointing as I found it fairly bland and not as juicy as expected (ordered it medium, got medium).  I'd definitely return on any future trips to Chicago, but I'm sticking to the filet and leaving room for dessert.

Great steak. I particularly like it with their home made blue cheese crumbled on top! Also little known fact: if they are too crowded you can go next door to Hugo's Frog Bar and order anything off the Gibson's menu since they share the same kitchen!

I love Gibson's for a good steak.  This place reminds me of old school Chicago with mobsters and all. The bar is charming and fantastic.  You will also not find better service.  The waiters are very professional but fun.  Charlie is the best...if you can sit in his section, do it. Typically I get the filet but I've had the strip and lobster before. Always on point! Oh, and you must get the wedge...either with bleu cheese or 1000 island dressing. Seriously, I dream about their 1000 Island dressing. Mmmmmm

Oh Gibsons, you are a steakhouse...getting the steak right is imperative! I went there last Sunday with an old friends parents who were visiting for the weekend. The experience started out great, seated quickly, the waiter was phenomenal. Bread was brought, appetizers were ate, salads were delivered. I was in heaven until the steaks came. Our table of four all ordered steaks, two (including mine) came out well done. We ordered them medium rare. The waiter was very gracious about it (I hate sending food back, but if I am spending $40 for a steak it needs to be right) and quickly brought us new steaks. The bar manager accompanied him to apologize, which was also very nice. HOWEVER, my second steak was no better. The outside was charred, well done and then went right into a bleeding red color. No gradual change, just tough then undercooked.  So sad.

There are people who can dig deep into their bellies and find love for restaurants based on how long the place as been open "it's an institution!". But since when does having pictures of celebrities smackedagainst the walls count as "good taste"? Walking into this joint, is like walking into a wanna be steakhouse.  It's dressed like a steakhouse, it's got meat juice in the air, baked potatoes on the menu, and bad checkering in areas...but it's not really a steakhouse.   Sortuv like the clientele: a blend of surgeon kissed senior citizens trying way too hard to dress and act younger - -  but they aren't really 40 years old.  The only other clientele this place gets...are trendy young people enjoying the viagra triangle...and cheesy businessmen, that haven't figured out Gibson's is a cliche - -  like their attempt to talk business in the viagra triangle.   Gibson's Steakhouse...is really the "triangle's" attempt at "drawing men who think you can still smoke cigars inside, and girls who know men like meat". (of all ages). And the wait...well with or without reservations be prepared you might have to wait...if you are young, you could be there until you're old enough to need hip surgery ---- which actually would help you fit in with the older gents: you know the ones who are slicking their hair and looking for the younger bait...so they have a reason to backslap the guy next to them.  And let's not forget, this is infamous for "sophisticated call girls" to meet  "cheesy business men". But, let's talk food.  While they do buy decent cuts of meat, they don't actually dry age their steaks - - a HUGE disappointment to anyone who knows about food...or for that matter...steak. Any good steak place...dry ages their steaks.  Ask.  They don't. I believe at BEST they "wet age" - literally soak it in water to hydrate in some flavor.  Not good! I'm a steak snob...so I admit, this might be brutal. The only places currently doing "dry aged steaks" in Chicago...David Burkes, and Capital Grille. (and maybe one of the two Morton's) In addition to this, they don't specialize in good quality ingredients, they don't bother to hire quality chefs, and frankly the celebrity black and whites on the wall aren't selling me either. I will say this though...on a nice summer Sunday.,..sitting outside...it's nice to people watch from this spot. TOP FIVE REASONS TO GO TO GIBSONS: 1) You like lively crowded atmosphere's  (of all ages) at your "steakhouse" 2) You like seeing boob jobs on young women and boob jobs on older women wanting to be young women 3) You like being near the viagra triangle 4) You don't care if the food is medicore you just want a steak  5) Sitting outside with a martini during the summer is great people watching time TOP FIVE REASONS NOT TO GO TO GIBSONS: 1) You actually care about the quality, and know a dry aged steak is the best - and they don't have it 2) You don't like the viagra triangle 3) It's a tourist attraction 4) You hate being overcrowded 5) It's food is mundane (anyone can pile sour cream on stuff)

A couple of buddies of mine took me here when I was visiting, they said I needed to try the Ribeye here, they hyped it up pretty good on the walk over to this place.  I have to say they didn't disappoint me one bit! Although there was a wait, the service was super quick and extremely nice, we had a waiter that apparently they get all the time, he even did a hand stand for us for some reason, he was a really cool guy.  He suggested how I should get the steak cooked and seasoned, and he gave me his personal guarantee that if I didn't enjoy the meal it was on him.  Needless to say we all paid for our meals with a pretty fat tip for him as well. I ordered the Ribeye steak, medium rare with their special seasoning and it was probably easily in the top 5 Ribeyes I have yet to eat in my life.  For dessert we had their crazy good chocolate cake, it was huge but I would definitely recommend sharing it, there were 4 dudes and we demolished that cake. Not to mention the atmosphere of knowing that celebrities need to come grab a steak here whenever they are in Chicago is pretty nice to know as well.

There are alot of places you can go in Chicago to get a great steak.  Since I only go to a steakhouse a couple of times in a year, I always try to go to somewhere that serves prime aged beef.  And If I were to recommend one steakhouse in Chicago to an out-of-towner that offers top quality steaks, lively atmosphere and great service, it would definitely be Gibson's. I just think it offers the best combination of these qualities I look for as a diner.  The portions are absolutely enormous....the double baked potato is seriously the size of a small football and is plenty for 3-4 people to share.  All the beef (I've had the filet/porterhouse/strip) is aged for weeks, cooked to perfection, and just melts in your mouth when you eat it.  There is no way any diner has ever walked out of this restaurant hungry...   Sure there are other steakhouses where I believe the steak is equal in quality, but I've never had a steak anywhere including Peter Luger's that's better than Gibsons.  Personally if I'm going to spend $75-100 on myself for a steak dinner, I want to know that its going to be a great experience and I've never had a bad one here the few times I've gone.  They go out of their way to make sure you happy with your experience and that's the reason I'll continue to go back.

Must get the filet mignon sliders which are excellent! Service is always top notch and its a great place to go for both dinner and lunch. The steak sandwich is always good and you can never go wrong with their steaks.  I tried the king crab roll and was disappointed, so I recommend sticking with the steaks and sliders.
I have to go against the masses on this one. I have been three times and all three times my Steak was not cooked properly.

Went here for the Mister's B-day.  I had the sauteed spinach, brocolli and mushrooms.  They were perfectly seasoned and prepared using olive oil.  Also had fries (i cheat sometimes, lol). He had the porterhouse (26oz).  So delish, he almost went "ghetto" on me! I had to threaten him to keep him from picking the darn thing up with his hands!!! The drinks were appropriately strong (martinis and margaritas).  The service was SUPER AWESOME.  I definitely was treated like a superstar (LMAO I think that may be the case everywhere i go though, go figure)...The only thing that I thought was kinda weird was the only AA person I was the female restroom attendant.  Really, it's just one of those things that make you say hmmmm....Anyway, if you've never been, treat someone you love...namely, yourself : ) but be a good sport and bring a friend~

I cannot imagine me going through my life in Chicago without ever going to Gibsons! I have been going there for years and have NEVER been disappointed. The service is great and so is the food! I wish they served the Lobster Bisque more. The turtle pie is the best dessert I have ever had. Everything is worth the price. The sliders are delicious also. It is somewhat costly but if you save up and spend a night there you will be so happy you did!

The only reason this isn't get 5 stars in my book is because I haven't been to this location in a while. I will agree with some people that would say the quality has slipped over the years however I still love it.

What can you really say about Gibsons...a Chicago staple. The food is magnificent, but the crowd on a Saturday night can be overwhelming if you're looking for a smooth romance vibe. Go there to eat, drink, and be merry. If you're looking to romance, maybe not the vibe you want unless you can get that good premium service if you know what I mean. Let's face it, if any of those people on the wall show up you think they're sitting in the bar! Still a must do if you live here or just visiting.
Great martinis, great steak and some of the best service I've ever had. If in Chicago a must go to!

This place is crowded on weekday evenings for a reason. Don't let crowds deter you, though - they have one of the best bars and outdoor areas for people watching in Chicago. I don't mind waiting to be seated if I can belly up to the bar for a while.  The staff is always prompt and professional. The steaks and sides never disappoint.  I'll always have Gibson's at the top of my list when I feel like a few drinks and some red meat. I've never left unsatisfied.

Normally I don't review places like Gibsons. It's a Chicago institution and everyone knows how fantastic it is. But last night surprised even me. We went there with the Gilt City deal -- a four-course dinner for two with a glass of wine for each of us. Given how cheap it was, I expected to be shoved into a corner, given some small appetizer and a tiny steak and be ushered out. Especially when we got there and they told us the woman who took my reservation didn't write down that we had the Gilt City deal. INSTEAD ... they took care of everything, gave us the first booth in the dining room and served us like we were with Mayor Daley (well, maybe not that well). The appetizer was a good-sized and delicious lobster tail, followed by salad and their famous steaks, done perfectly. The menu, which was personalized for us, said we'd get chocolate mousse cake for dessert. I thought there was no way we'd get a full serving, but we did. My fiancee almost cried when it came out. And half of that wonderful, giant slab of chocoloate lovin' is sitting in our fridge right now.  The service was impeccable and we felt like we belonged, not that we were there on the cheap. I've been to Gibsons a few times and Hugo's a few times and have loved it each time. If only I could afford to go more often.

The restaurant is my parents favorite to go to for steak and potato.  The dessert is a big block of fudge and marshmallow heaven.  The servers impressed us with their menu lingo making it easy for us to order that night.
This tip came from Graham, the bartender at the W: If you can't get a seat, go next door to Hugo's. They server Gibson's steaks. Also, the ribeye is amazing.
Certainly not my age group but great piano nonetheless.

Love this place.  Been coming here for about 15years and it never fails to deliver.  The only thing I can say I hate about Gibsons is the old bartender at the front bar....slow as molasses.  Plus, he'll acknowledge your there and STILL ignore you....errrr.  That's okay though, the waiters in the restaurant make up for the deficits of the front man.

I was so excited to try Gibson's for my first time today and left so unsatisfied and disappointed. People - do not use this restaurant to measure the quality of Chicago's restaurants. I've experienced food way better at a quarter of the price  with genuinely good service. I ordered the steak - blah - and trust me not only do I love food, but I typically love it better when I don't have to pay - and I don't know if you could pay me to come back. Here's the low down: It's very crowded and cramped - so cramped that when serving our meal they set the food 2 tables away. A server bumped into my bosses potatoes - which touched his jacket. The server serving us saw this looked pissed but still served it ? My meal included iceberg lettuce and nearly burnt steak - no seasoning. I had to keep drinking water and was not filled by the end of it. Our server was an odd gentlemen - very steril and unfriendly. Their house port wine tasted like cough syrup - and this is coming from a wino. And their manager came and introduced himself completely ignoring me and the other woman sitting with us and focused on the men and then when we left once again only acknowledged the men - very tacky. Gibsons - your restaurant blows.

Went to Gibson's for the first time since I have lived on North Side in the past five years.  I frequent many other steakhouses in Chicago but have avoided Gibsons because the popularity and swarms of people.  My friend from NYC booked reservations at Gibsons for his B-day for a friday night at 8pm.  We were not seated until 845 and their staff was less then polite.  On the brightest note, our waiter was awesome and amusing.  He gave you a good taste of Chicago culture and slang.  However, I come for the cuisine and not to be entertained.  I ordered a steak medium and it was well-done.  Its one strike for me in Chicago for steak.  I will likely never go back unless I have to.

I came here on a business trip that our clients took us to for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed my entire experience here. The food was very delicious where our server came by with a platter of raw cuts to explain the differences and flavor and how they prepared the steaks. The presentation was excellent, the food was great, and the atmosphere in the heart of Chicago was awesome! I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are visiting the windy city!
very cool and upbeat if you like that kind of vibe. You are promised to see someone famous Maybe Andy Garcia or Bears Coach Lovie Smith! Crowded but in a good way, if there is such? LOL..

Have been a loyal Gibson's fan for over 20 years. Still a fun night out and the service is excellent.  I am a little mystified, however, at the fact that the last three times I have been there over the past 3-4 months, either myself or someone at the table had a steak come out incorrectly done.  I order "blue/extra rare" and the past few times the steak came out heavily charred  and black and more rare to med rare on the inside.  Not sure if they are experimenting with cooking methods, but PLEASE go back to the old method (minus the heavy charring) with just a little searing.  With all the great new steakhouses in town, gotta keep the game up at these prices.

Visited Gibson's last night after not having eaten here in quite a few years....we were celebrating a friend's 40th birthday which was great except apparently EVERYONE celebrates their birthday at Gibson's which requires all of the waitstaff to visit the birthday person's table and sing a really loud one line song, thus our server disappeared 4 times in the middle of our service...once in the middle of ordering, once in the middle of wine service, once while cutting our dessert....you get the point.  While the steaks are great...the side dishes are lame and unoriginal, the salads made with iceberg lettuce and while old-school is fine, it's not even great old-school.  I would be able to give it a slightly better review but the really annoying birthday singing (I felt like I was at Bennigans or ChiChis) just kept getting more annoying as the night went on, especially because it was super disruptive to our service.  Gibson's doesn't need to use cheesey gimmicky acts like that to continue to be a popular steakhouse!

A-ok Gibbs.  Their menu as far as a steakhouses go wasn't as impressive as others I have been to. As far as aged steaks anyway- didn't even make me want to order steak!  I went with a group of people for lunch last week. Service was great. The waitress was very nice and was very polite. The water glasses were always filled and orders were all correct.  The Ruben was great crispy grilled bread with the right ratio of beef to crout. The Crab cake was good- it had nice lump crab meat but the outside could have been crispier. The side of Broccoli was mooshy over cook and it came with hollandaise sauce. Portions were healthy.  I would fain come here again.

I recently attended a rehearsal dinner at this restaurant and the service was amazing! They were so attentive and made sure we were never waiting for anything.  The food, although we ate on a limited menu, was delicious. I recommend the sirloin.

Good God Gibson's, you're better than I remembered!  As a girl who lives for a juicy, glorious, perfectly medium-rare steak, I know pretty much every spot in our city for where to find the absolute best in meaty, pink, tender perfection. For some reason, while I've never knocked Gibson's, it has always never quite made the short list of winners either... until now.  Came back after a many years long hiatus for one reason and one reason alone: to find older men.  I know what you're thinking, but the manhunt 'twas not for me, no Sir! It was for a special, drop dead gorgeous, single, more mature lady who has oft been wondering aloud where all the sophisticated older gentleman in Chicago are hiding. Well, at Gibson's, duh! If memory serves me right (and it did), this restaurant and its surrounds have always been a playground for those in their prime. Bring on the dudeapalooza!  While the male selection was a bit more of the gold chain variety than the Brosnan/Connery types - wah, wah, wahhhhh - one thing could certainly not go without a huge vote of confidence from both my DC and I... the truly stellar food!  We had:  - Silver Oak '05 Cabernet Sauvignon  - House-cured Salmon Appetizer  - Loaded Wedge Salad with Bacon, Tomato & Blue Cheese  - Bone-In Filet Mignon  - Sautéed Spinach and Mushrooms with Garlic  Wowzers! It was delicious... all of it. Not one misstep, nothing that went unfinished, very respectable wine offerings, and then, of course, the sheer luxury of that beautiful bone-in filet. Big enough to share, but why would you want to? A steak this perfectly cooked and seasoned, tender enough to cut with your fork, charred on the outside but glistening pink on the inside, this is the time to get greedy. And boy did we!  With our meal devoured and the last of the Silver Oak polished off, we took a last quick glance around for any potential suitors. Guess what? They were everywhere, at every table! T-Bones, Sirlons, Porterhouses! The best man meat here is literally that... meat. Enjoy!

Went here with my girl on NYE! Luckily, it was such a nice warm night and we got seat in the dining room quickly!  Everyone was dressed pretty and most people were there with a group. We loved the charm of our waiter as he brought out the frozen meat selection showing off the top quality steaks (which we did not order-darn!) Teacher discount's didn't apply there...but there were several items under "Local Favorites" so we sticked to that.  However, we did peek at the steaks that people got around us and I was clearly jealous. If I didn't plan on staying on budget, I would have spent the money on the steaks! Everyone around us were raving! But we were raving too. My friend loved the meatloaf more than me. We both got the same thing. But we both paid 30 bucks together at the end. We skipped dessert!  Loved the ambiance, the live music you come in hearing, and the formality the place presents. Will return back to Rush/Division...it's one of my favorite Go To Spots in the city!

This is definitely the place to have steak in Chicago. They have the choicest meats cooked exactly the way you want. This is Chicago at it's best. They are crowded seemingly all the time and you'd best have reservations if you plan to go there. The decor is reminiscent of old Chicago which is in keeping with the whole experience.
I had the best steak ever at this restaurant.  It is definitely a place every person should go to.

Wow so I hadn't eaten red meat in a little less than 2 months, so I was really looking forward to a nice steak. I tend to lean toward Rib Eye's the closer to the bone the better right ?! This place did not disappoint at all. We called for reservations a few weeks before and ended up with a 4:30 sitting, are we 70 years old and in bed by 8 p.m. ? No, we just can't commit all the time and tend to forget little details like making reservations.  Starters were amazing, my buddy ordered the wedge that came with blue cheese, bacon and tomato. I'm not big on iceberg lettuce but this thing was perfect. We ordered a dozen oysters which ended up being east coast(s) and were delicious.  For dinner I had the Rib eye and it was simply amazing. I ordered in medium rare and it was cooked to perfection, seriously perfection. If you order rib eye's a lot you know this can be an issue, but it clearly wasn't. The vegetable are ala carte' and we ordered some saut'eed mushrooms and asparagus and they were cooked perfect as well.  Our server was great, he challenged us with some sport trivia early on (baseball) and we failed miserable which pissed me off. The reward was a free desert on him if we were correct, I requested we go double or nothing and failed yet again. In our defense these questions were for people who actually watched baseball in the 50's and 60's. Maybe he was confused by our early seating and thought we might be 70. He caved and brought us a freebie anyway - my favorite price. This things was no lie 9 inches tall and consisted of moose / cake and just downright deliciousness. So much so that a couple at the other table leaned over and asked "good god, what is that ?" my reply "not sure but it was free"... Oh and they gave me a steak knife as a parting gift....maybe they didn't give it to me. Hey I was walking around in a strange city and needed protection...
Gibbons is delish. My dad is obsessed and the man is extremelyyyyy picky when it comes to a steak.

I never went here when I actually lived in Chicago, but when we came to visit, my boyfriend REALLY wanted to come here. Good call on his part! The waiter comes around and tells you about all the meat options they have and his recommendations. My boyfriend got the Chicago cut of steak - delicious. The only slight problem is that he ordered medium rare when he likes his steak medium because most places will overcook, Gibson's does not. They cook exactly how you want it. It was delicious though in all of its red meat-ness.  I got the lamb chops, and they were some of the most well prepared lamb chops I have ever had. SO DELICIOUS! When I think about it, my mouth starts to water...I don't know what they did, but it was amazing. The sides we ordered were nothing special, but ok. Also, the vino with red meat...so good. Get some red wine to go with your dish, its worth it, made everything taste that much better.

Have I had great steaks here?  Yes.  Is it THE place to be for business dinners, celebrities, and tourists?  Absolutely.  Great (the best) location, hoppin'  bar scene.  There's somebody famous in here every single night.  That's one of the reasons why people come here. But there are plenty of good steak houses in Chicago, and if you're not a celeb, you may be disappointed at Gibby's.  Regulars get treated great, but if they don't know you, don't be surprised if you wait 30+ minutes to be seated despite your reservation.  And more than likely you'll be squeezed into a space  where the tables are uncomfortably close together.  I've had great steaks here, but the last few times they were surprisingly overcooked (more like medium than my med rare order).  I say surprisingly because they tend to undercook-- a Gibson's medium rare is like a rare at most places.  The quality of the meat is excellent, but there are only a few top meat purveyors in the city and I'd bet that you can get the same steaks at other places. You can get as good or better food in a much more comfortable setting at Chicago Cut, or David Burke, or The Chop House to name a few.

Ok I was lame and just got a burger instead of a steak. But what a burger it was! Meat, glorious, juicy meat. It could benefit from better additions - e.g., tasteless iceberg lettuce and beefsteak tomato did not do this burger any favors. I don't add ketchup or sauce to my burger unless it's dry, and this burger didn't need it. Delicious fries came free with the burger, and at $10 - what a great deal for a gourmet burger. Service was super-friendly and top-notch, even though we had a really cheap tab. The desserts looked divine, but I had no room left devouring my burger and all the fries.
