Cut Steak and it was heavenly.  To top the night off, we noticed Michael Jordan was sitting a couple of tables away from us.  One of my colleagues got up some courage and finally approached him to ask for his autograph and he happily complied.  Overall, we had a wonderful time and really enjoyed ourselves.  From the wonderful food to the atmosphere to the wine and the overall mood that Gibson's can put into you, it was truly a great place to dine.

It's crazy busy at Gibson's!  I made a reservation for 8pm (on a Tuesday), and didn't get seated until 9pm.  I can see why people feel rushed here; we were brought to our table just as the party before us was getting up to leave!  We literally were standing with the waitress waiting for people to get their coats on and moved out of the way as they left! The steaks are juicy (I had a ribeye) and cooked to your liking, but are not very flavorful.  After the 3rd or 4th bite, it gets pretty boring. I have had better-tasting (and better-priced) steaks, bursting with flavor on my dad's grill (and at Tulio or at Daniel's Broiler in Seattle).  My party split a side order of  fries and the garlic spinach-mushrooms.   Neither were anything to write home about.   All in all, it's a nice atmosphere, good service when you finally get a table, and decent-looking steaks.  The Wow-factor just wasn't there.

Went here this week while traveling for work. I specifically wanted to watch the Warriors game and eat a good steak, so I took the advice from three different people and headed for Gibson's. I sat at the bar on a Sunday night and liked what I saw...tons of activity, great piano player, good wine list and GIGANTIC twice-baked potatoes. A pound-and-a-half. I'm not kidding. So first things first - come HUNGRY. Anyway, experience was great until towards the end of the night. I sat at the end of the bar with my purse hanging on a hook underneath the bar - when I went to pay, my purse was open and my wallet was gone. Which totally surprised me because I thought it was a pretty classy joint. However, after mentioning my drama to some local clients the next day, none were surprised - apparently the clientele can be fairly sketch and say they tend to stay away because of this reason. I have to admit, even though I'm so frustrated with what happened and probably won't return myself , I'm a little bummed for Gibson's because I thought my meal was pretty outstanding. And I'm a serious steak LOVER. I know a good steak when I taste one.  If I didn't get ripped off, I would have easily given them five stars for food and service. I'd still say give it a try but be sure to keep your eyes open...

We were in town for a bachelor party and our VIP wanted  a steak. This poses somewhat of a problem considering that we were in Chicago ... where to go? Too many darn great options!!! Chophouse, Morton's, Ruth's, Select Cut?!?! Gibson's it was because we wanted a real Chicago experience and a no-nonsense steak. And that's what we got. Our concierge somehow managed to get us a reservation on a Friday night (TOTALLY necessary by the way, ideally 2-3 days ahead of time). Their rib eye's were 22oz (!) and prepared Pittsburgh style, beautifully charred on the outside to lock all them juices in - YUM! Their wine selection was not overpriced as one would expect, we stuck with Ravenswood Zin throughout the night; at $30 a bottle more than reasonable. Hiccup. The staff knows their stuff, they serve in teams and as such run a tight ship - very friendly and professional. There's a hype about this place, is it justified? Suffice to say the group of guys I went with is still talking about our meal there. If you're looking for a quiet, intimate experience this shouldn't be your first choice. Looking for a perfect steak with no nonsense? Look no further.

Back in the day, i ended up here on Prom Night! I was going through my uber-earth loving vegetarian stage and found nothing on the menu to eat except for a plate of steamed veggies- yuck.  I asked the server if i could order a grilled cheese. He asked me to hold on, checked with the chef, and returned to tell me the chef would do it- but was very nervous because he hadnt made a grilled cheese for his kids in quite some time. It came out perfect.  The point of this story? I cant tell you much about the food here, but i can say the service is excellent! Would you be so nice to an annoying 17 year old trying to order a kids menu item in your 5 star restaurant? I dont think so. I would have rolled my now-judgmental eyeballs and sighed.
Wasn't impressed with their steaks and sides.  More hype and location than anything else.

The filet mignon was excellent.  I went with a group of friends, and 2 of them ordered the porterhouse to share.  It looked great.  Their garlic mashed potatoes side is yummy and of course, the turtle macadamia pie is ENORMOUS and very yummy.  They use Haagen-Daaz ice-cream.  The waiter said they change some of their desserts everyday, so you may not find the same desserts on the menu when you go back.  I have heard the chocolate cake is also incredibly delicious.

I guess it all depends on personal taste by seeing the other reviews, but so far, this is the best Filet I've had in Chicago. I haven't been to all of the major group of steakhouses yet, but Gibsons was the best one I've had to date.  My wife and I met her uncle who was in town for a weekend and we sat in the bar area for drinks and an appetizer. We decided to just eat in the bar area so I can't comment on the dining room at all. The bar was very typical. It had multiple TVs with some football games on and some high top tables to sit at.  We all had steaks and they were cooked just right and tasted delicious. The service was also very attentive and friendly. Overall, a great dining experience.

Dirty Grey Goose Martini  4 stars Service  5 stars Atmosphere  4 stars Mashed Potatoes  5 stars Creamed Spinach  4 stars Steak  2 stars What a shame, everything was great here except the steak!  Two of us had the bone-in New York, and one person had the small fillet.  The steaks were very average.  For the money, it was the worst steak I've ever had.

This has to be my favorite place in the city to get a steak!  Gibson's is everything that it claims to be and then some. Gibson's gets what service is all about.  From the bartender Joe, who has been there for 18 years, and knows your drink (a really dirty martini) and your name no matter how long its been since you have stopped in last, to the manager who comes over to greet you recognizing you as one of his "regulars", service is the name of the game and it shows. Even without a reservation, they will try to work you in on a timely basis- although I would suggest if you plan to go on a weekend- get a reservation. The bar with its live piano music is a great place to sit and have a martini or two and to people watch.  Given Gibson's location anchoring the "Viagra triangle", it is the place to watch the whole "night scene" in Chicago.  The crowd is a mix of Chicagoans and tourists as many of the big hotels send their guests here.   A note of caution- If you are a woman alone or with a group of your girlfriends- know that you may have more attention than you want as this bar is a known "pick up" place.  I tend to find it more humorous than anything else but others may not think the same.  I think the guys there all subscribe to the theory of a '"guy's gotta try"!!!  Whatever!! For dinner- know that the portions are huge so splitting sides and appetizers works well.  Tried a new appetizer the other night that I hadn't had before and it was amazing.  It was a tomato covered in goat cheese and served with warm button mushrooms.  Really great!  The bone in strip steak was also delicious- done perfectly and even a half of the double baked potato covered more than half of my plate. The service was attentive- they work on a team basis so there is always someone knowing what you need before you need it.  So when you are craving beef- served up in an environment that says service- give Gibson's a try.  Oh- and if you have a drink at the bar- tell Joe that I said hi!

Went to Gibson's for my firm's holiday dinner.  They totally catered to our large group!   The steak was delicious.  I absolutely loved the turtle cake....made w/ hagendaaz ice cream and it was big enough to serve 5 people. Will definitely be returning......

Steakhouse food is, well, steakhouse food. It takes a bit to get it right, and Gibson's does that rather well, but it wasn't the most amazing meal of my lifetime. It was GREAT, don't get me wrong, but I do appreciate creativity in my dining experience and I am aware that there is only so far a classic steakhouse can go. What I really want to do is commend the wait staff. The talk threads lately have been giving professional servers a bad rap, so I felt the need to send out some love where it is so well deserved. EVERYONE, from the coat check staff (who did check some odd items for me, with a smile, I might add), to the hostess, to our waiter who magically rushed my meal out to arrive at the same time as my fellow diners who arrived and ordered much earlier than I did, did their job impeccably and without showing a sign of sweat. They made the meal pleasant and if I wasn't paying attention, I would have missed how hard they were working. Kudos... lots of kudos. Thanks, staff.

Went here for a private party (wedding reception) and it was truly a class act.  We had a room upstairs with its own bar.  The bartenders were super - fast and friendly!  My kids had a great time bellying up to the bar to get their own sodas and the bartenders were having a great time chatting with them.  The food here was very yummy and hot.  That's always so hard when you have a large group to serve.  They had some shrimp, chicken empanadas and bruschetta for appetizers and all were great.  There was more food, but I just couldn't catch the appetizer guys!  They had some beef, fish, green beans and potatoes for dinner as well as a salad and it was all excellent. The wait staff was always on their toes and very accomodating.  I asked for a booster seat and got it within 5 minutes.  The bride requested special food for my kids, (chicken fingers and french fries, don't ask), not only was it good, they even brought ketchup for them! I have to say the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the women's restroom.  I think the one upstairs is for the whole restaurant, even if it isn't they should have more facilities available when you have a party of 100 or more.  I had to change the little guy's diaper in there and put his pjs on and basically had to lay him on the floor in the handicap stall.  I had something to lay him on, but still, yuch!  Then I had to listed to the other women complaining about what was taking so long.  Sorry!  Also they had an attendant who HAD to give you soap to wash your hands and your paper towels.  There's already too many people in there with nowhere to go, get out of there lady and give us more room!
Definitely the best steak in the city, and the people watching is great too!!!

Okay, yes, I admit, I was a total tourist.... but yo, who cares about the Cougars or whatever any other chicagoan complains about... their steak is GOOOD. The way it's prepared is absolutely perfect! I had a big ole piece of meat (too big in fact) with easy pepper corns, easy garlic. It was slighty crispy on the outside, super tender and moist on the inside.... ahhh, perfection! My broiler never cooks a piece of steak like that. My only complaint was that I did bite into one piece of fat (ick!)... I know, fat makes it taste better. But if I am gonna pay that much for a steak, I want every last bite to be enjoyable. You also HAVE to try their twice baked potato... big enough to feed 4 people. All I have to say is that I have had dreams about that steak and potato. The sweet potato was... average Ice cream sunday was great...I was stuffed and even then, I loved the ice cream sunday! If you're in town, try it! You owe it to your taste buds and your stomach. Trust me, you won't need protein for about a year!

At this point you're probably wondering, what's the deal? What's with this guy? He lives in New York, but rarely reviews stuff in New York anymore!! Well, it's time to be honest. I rarely go out in New York, preferring appartment parties to bars and my own cooking to most dinners in New York under $50.  I know, I know, sacrilege for a Yelper...excommunicate me.. Anyway, came in here tonight and the place was packed. Frigid night, snow everywhere, Tuesday night, place is hopping. Definitely has the well-heeled, but not at all snoody or trendy crowd down. Overall, very solid steakhouse, but not the best.  The appetizers were pretty weak, though some of the shellfish looked good. Both my buddy and I did the bone-in sirloins, which were very good. Supposidly they cook steaks at about 1800 degrees, which is absolutely insane. Unfortunately, the order's got messed up and my medium came in medium rare (Which is kind of like shanking a 6 iron, only on a shot you should have hit with the 8 iron so it works out) while my buddy's medium rare clocked in at medium well. Fortunately, the waiter agreed that the mistake had been made and got a new steak out to him in a few minutes. Still, this mistake was part of what I considered to be good service, but not top notch. If I want to go to a great steakhouse with so-so service, well, Peter Lugar's is still in business for a reason. The sides were quite good though. The creamed spinich was well, about what it should be (have you ever had creamed spinich that you raved about?) but the twice baked potato stole the show. It was incredible and you definitely should get it if you go here. We did not have desert, though the slices of cake were about the size of Peyton Manning's ego.  The wine selection was both extensive and reasonably priced. You can get a good cab from Napa for $40-$55. 3.5 stars.

Aaaahhh, Gibson's.... I first heard about this place about 10 years ago; their humongous lobster tails, even larger steaks and the double baked potatoes. Sounds like heaven. So of course, I had to go there on my first trip to Chicago. After a 4 hour delay at LAX and a re-route to another airport because of thunder storms, we finally landed 6 hours past our orignal time. knowing we weren't going to make our reservaiton for 9:00pm, I called ahead to reschedule. The Maitre D, was very gracious and insured us a table for whenever we arrived.  After a mad rush to pick up our rental car and unexpected traffic, we arrived 10:45. To my amazement, we were seated within minutes! SInce our last meal was at 7:00am PST, we were HUNGRY to say the least. Not knowing the next time I would be in Chicago, I opted for the Surf and Turf featuring a Gibson's cut Rib eye.  Even at 11pm, the place was full and the buzz of many conversations could be heard. The atmosphere was friendly and the people watching was just like LA. I definitely need to make it back, to take in the nightlife here.  Soon our food arrived and the visual was impressive. Portions are defintely not for the light hearted. This was a perfect time to whip out the digital cam and document our first night in Chicago. Upon slicing into my steak, I found it cooked to order; a perfect medium rare. Now for the test... Although it was soft and tender, the taste fell well below my expectations and this is the reason for me giving Gibson's only 3 stars. My lobster tail was tuff and didn't seem fresh, nothing like Lobsterfest at the pier. All in all, our experience was above average. Would I come back? Yes, but more for the ambiance than the food.  To say the least, I have found a soft spot for Chicago and will defintely be back.

I have been to Gibson's three times during my visits to Chicago over the last couple years.  I love it for the experience alone.  The food is pretty straight forward steakhouse fare, but done exceptionally well. My first visit  was back in March of '05 and our waiter was outstanding.  I am a sucker for servers waxing eloquently about the quality of the food, and this guy kicked ass when it came to hawking meat. The quality of the meat was truly outstanding and all the side orders I have tried have been very good as well.  Certainly not the type of place I would go to very often, but once or twice a year it can't be beat.

chicago tourist in the hizzouse! good food, nice service, and nice lady in the bathroom dispensing towels and soap (make sure you have a dollar or something to tip this woman... i was totally caught off guard by her presence). their mashed potatoes and lobster bisque were delicious and their steak was cooked to a perfect 'rare'. they also serve huge, mutant lobster tails that are probably the size of a small baby. it's very loud and busy here but at least the wait for the food wasn't too long (but then again i may have been tipsy and the wait may have flown by...) i liked this place a lot =)

Since I am a hardcore vegan, I decided to try Gibson's.  Wouldn't you know... no tofu.... no boca burgers... no vegan options whatsoever.   I couldn't believe it. I was forced to have the sliced ribeye with red wine sauce.  It was pretty good :). When I went, cigar smoking was allowed at the bar... thus the three stars.

I've been to a lot of steakhouses and this is probably the best of the bunch. The dry-aged rib eye is extremely flavorful and the sides are fantastic (make sure to share one of the baked potatoes with, like, thirty people). Not much else to say. Top-notch and in a great neighborhood for the night.

I believed the hype of this place!  I truly expected this to be the most amazing steak dinner of all time!  I guess my small town-ness showed through here. My  boyfriend suggested other place (and probably better) places, but being the woman that  I am, decided that I wanted to try  this place and there was no changing my  mind. Don't get me wrong, It was not all that bad but it did not live up to my expectations.  My fillet was good and we received a lot of attention but it bordered on the annoying.  The people watching was fun though.  Now that I got it out of my system I will most likely  be trying other steakhouses.

Gibson's is Great and if you live in Chicago you need to go at least once! I've been to Gibson's many times it's always fun and the steaks are good, Their Spinach Salad is above average.  The Blackened Salmon sandwich is awesome, delicious, and unique!  The wine list is great and The service is always the best.  You're never waiting for anything.  always attentive!!  There are some great views for people watching and the al fresco dinning in the summer is always fun.  I like some of their dishes, I love others...... the steaks I'll, personally, always take a pass on.  We have a lot of lunch meetings here that sometimes carry over to their happy hour  which is Great.... Gibson's for happy hour or for cocktails you can't go wrong...  It  does cater to a more Mature Crowd but for me Gibson's will always be a cool place to grab a bite or just to hang with friends!   (shhhhhh, I actually prefer Hugo's next door just a tad more! Unless of course you want to sit outside (summer time) and/or want the people watching Views from the bar )

When Pim visited from the Netherlands, he asked to go to Gibson's. He wanted to eat the biggest, rarest steak on the menu, and he was going to do it with gusto. Who was I to say no? I'm not a steak eater, so I watched him as he downed what was indeed the biggest, rarest steak I have ever seen. We had a side of mushrooms and spinach, which were both steak-house tastic. I think I had chicken (I can't remember, minus two stars for not being memorable).  The people viewing was excellent - big hair, lots of leather, a healthy portion of plastic surgery and big mercedesesess with tinted windows.  And Pim paid. Thanks Pim!

It had been a few years since I've been to Gibson's, so I was so excited when my mom suggested we go there for her birthday dinner.  I forgot how good this place is.  Everything we ordered we all loved.  I'll be honest that my fillet was a little overcooked for my liking, but it was still good and definitely eatable.  The twice baked potato is huge and absolutely delicious.  And the desserts...have you seen those desserts?  It may actually be the biggest "piece" of pie I have ever seen.  We didn't get any as we were all so full from the meal, but the turtle pie was calling my name...in fact it still is.  I must make more frequent trips to Gibson's.  This place is too good not to.

I went to Gibson's on the dime of Teradata, because the company I work for is one of their clients. All I can say is that it was AWESOME. There were about a dozen of us present in one of the private rooms upstairs. We started the meal with some mediocre appetizers, but when it was time for the meal that's when the real fun started. They broke out a double-magnum sized bottle of something pretty decent- the novelty alone was enough to please me. We had a bunch of much better appetizers, including oysters and crab salad. Then we had regular green salad, then they brought out those famous platters of uncooked meat where we picked which one we wanted. In addition to a mouth-watering filet, we also had several platters of lobster tails. For desert, there was a carrot cake that was, I kid you not, about a 18" high and also I think some chocolate thing- I was in such a food coma that I can hardly remember. They also brought out whatever type of after-dinner drinks we wanted, and the guys from Teradata had a blast watching me drink a bunch of port, whisky and cognac. Through our whole dinner, the service was really spectacular, and afterwards, because I was the only local dinner guest, they INSISTED that I take home 3 huge, gorgeous flower centerpieces, and they put me in a cab with them and told the cab driver to help me carry them once I got home!  Super awesome meal, really great staff, I'd go there again in a heartbeat!

Ok, the food isn't the best here but its still pretty good. The reason I go to Gibson's is for the experience. Its the place to see and be seen. Its the place to arrive at 5:30, sit at the bar for a couple hours, eat dinner, then head back to the bar. You can mingle with the most eclectic in Chicago and some of the most famous as well. Be prepared to shout during dinner, but like I said, its for the experience. Enjoy yourself will ya!

This is the place to see and been seen, but as for the food, it's a complete joke.  The raw steaks they show you at the beginning are misleading.  Ordered a medium T-Bone $33, and got a 1/4 inch thick diner-quality steak.  Could the steak be any thinner?  Sure, it was large (like a pancake the size of a plate).  And why bother asking me how I want it cooked?  When it's so thin, it only comes out well-done.  Comes with an iceberg side salad, just like a diner, baby.  Hubby got a peppercorn fillet, which was charred and tasteless, but at least it was thick and medium.  Needed salt to make it palatable, though.  5 asparagus spears for around $9.  Outrageous.  Basically, if your underling suggests Gibsons for dinner, and you have the authority to fire him, do it.  He/She obviously doesn't understand value and quality, and cares more about trendiness than substance.  You don't want him wasting company money on unoriginal, follow-the-crowd project ideas.  Fire him, immediately.

Steaks are great, but very expensive and annoying croud. People are pushy and think it is "the place to be" and its not. No where to park, and fight traffic to sit in this impersonal tourist trap restaurant, not my idea of a good time.

Gibson's gets 4.5 stars, because Mastro's gets 5. the midwest is known for their meat, so don't come here looking for a green salad or chicken breast.  there was quite a bit of a wait despite making reservations, but the bar kept us entertained. our client introduced me to effen black cherry w/ sprite and boy was that a delightful beverage. what really turned me on, were the slabs of raw cuts of steak presented before you, while you make your decision. that's hot. then out comes delicious bread, and we shared a caesar salad. i believe dinner came w/ soup as well. all very tasty (as opposed to non-use). and then came the meat. I literally hoovered the steak here down like a vacuum machine. We ordered the WC cut medium rare two ways, original and peppercorn crusted. I prefer the original. I like to taste my meat, at it's essence. by the end of this meal, i could not move.  it was well worth the pain.

At the advice of a friend, I came to Gibsons for lunch instead of dinner to avoid the rush (pretty much the smart thing to do at any place in Chicago if you can swing it).  First off - I have had better steaks at other steakhouses, but they are few and far between.  Gibson's though, was the best meal from start to finish.  The crabmeat avocado appetizer is a "flavorgasm".  The double baked potato should definitely be shared, but is also awesome.  The steak was slightly overcooked but like I said there are only a couple places with a better steak regardless of this fact.   Come early and take advantage of the ability to sample wine (i got a few generous samples before deciding what to order).  Bring your Amex, cuz this ain't cheap when you go for a full meal for the full Gibson's experience.

my boyfriend and i went here on his birthday and then again on mine a month later. it wasn't phenomenal but it was pretty damn good. we got seated in the bar area both times right away. we got there a little bit early though, around 5. we enjoyed our meals both times, i got the spit-roasted chicken, and it was so so good! their mashed potatoes are the best though!

After much anticipation, I went here last Saturday when my parents were in town.  I was not disappointed.  I really like the layout of the place - the bar is big and cool, but you can still peek in the back , see those white table cloths and know you're in for a fine dining experience.  We waited at the bar for 30 minutes (with a reservation, but I didn't mind because I wasn't in a hurry - I feel like you can't be at a place like Gibsons).  At the bar I ordered a cosmo and unlike most of the cosmos I have had - it was pretty strong (And I have the tolerance of a 50-year-old man with a hollow wooden leg). The bartender also served ice water with our martinis which is a sign of a good first-class bartender.  Onto dinner, our waiter was fabulous - very upbeat and attentive.  I ordered the small fillet, split a twice baked potato (the potatoes are huge) and started with the house salad.  All were great.  For dessert, it was my boyfriend's birthday so they brought out the LARGEST piece of cake I have ever seen.  It had bananas and all sorts of things in it.  Oh and it  tasted fantastic.  Everyone loved their meal and we all left stuffed and satisfied. It was pricey, but not as pricey as I had thought.  I would love to come back for another special occasion or some drinks at the bar.

Great food, massive portions, and definitely one of the best steakhouses in the city. However, the real reason to come to Gibsons is to get a first hand glipse of Chicago's power mongers in action, gladhanding, cigar-chomping, and adorned with cute twenty-something blondes on each arm. In the summer, grabbing a seat outside is great, and with the passing night Rush Street morphs into a veritable parade of Italian sportscars, short-skirted bachelorette parties and button-downed and blazered wolfpacks. Try the Bone-in Ribeye and the German Chocolate Cake. If you're a lobster bisque fan, I have yet to have a better lobster bisque in the city. If you can't manage to snag a table at Gibson's Hugo's Frog Bar has the same food, with a less glitzy atmosphere.

The food is great, the staff is great, the drinks are great.  So why only two stars?  I've been coming to this place for years and I've finally had it with the ridiculous waits - and I have always had a reservation.  Honestly, I think the fastest I ever got to my table was about an hour after my actual reservation.  Guess what, Gibson's? Keeping your patrons waiting long past their reservation ISN'T part of the charm.  It's annoying and demonstrates utter contempt for your customers. 20 minutes, 30 minutes here or there, sure, I'd understand that, but these wait times are consistent and epic.  Why can't I ever have my table in a remotely timely manner?  Why, Gibson's, why? I pay my bill.  I'm nice to the staff.  I leave big tips.  I'm totally unassuming.  I haven't done anything to you Gibson's, so why can't I just have my table on time once, ever?  You might be wondering,  if the drinks are so great (and they really are), why not be chill out and wait at the bar?  I'll tell you why. This is not a place you come to when you feel like a snack - it is like Thanksgiving day, you "save" up your appetite.  You are probably walking into that bar on an empty stomach, so unless you have powers of self control like Gandhi (and if you did, you certainly wouldn't be attempting to dine at Gibson's), you are likely to get drunk before you get to your table.  The drinks are great, but they pack a punch, and with hour plus wait times, go down a wee bit too smoothly.  On a lesser note, but just as annoying, this place is full of would be Don Juans, emboldened by their vast expense accounts and generous amounts of single-malt whiskey who think it's okay to hit on strangers.  Now, I don't blame them - they've probably been waiting for their table for hours as well and are bored and/or drunk, but still.  Being from out of town or closing that huge deal and getting a raise is no reason to be overly fresh with the ladies. FYI for all you would be Lotharios waiting for your table at Gibson's, I'll answer your annoying questions once and for all  - a) Yes, I'm from Chicago, b) No thanks, I really don't want to go back to your hotel and "party," and c) so thoughtful of you to offer me a cigar, but they are a little passe, don't you think?  This is supposed to be a restaurant, not Excalibur with a meat theme, so please save the lines for your wife and go home with some dignity intact.   Once you get to your table, I will happily admit, things are great.  Steaks and sides are good across the board, and the staff is always friendly and helpful despite having to shove platters of raw meat in drunken patron's faces all night, a task that would surely make even the best-natured of us surly.  That being said, for less money and hassle, I could go to Paulina Market, get a fantastic Prime steak, make it myself and get drunk at home without being subjected to unwarranted machismo.   Or I could just go to another steak house.  Hmmm...now there's a thought!

Work landed me in the Windy City a few weeks back and let me tell ya I can't wait to get back to Sweet Home Chicago All I can say it....bone in rib eye...sign me up.  Fantastic vibe right in the heart of the Viagra triangle.    Great eye candy, fantastic steaks, and a solid wine list.   Our meal went something like this: Split a Cesar Turley Old Vine Zin Bone in Ribeyes Spinach and Vegi sides What else is there?  Its not cheap, but neither are you so giddy up Don't miss a few pre-game cocktails across the street at Tavern on Rush.

Definitely a Chicago institution. Great service, AWESOME steaks and loud/busy/fun atmosphere. The restaurant is packed with tables and I'm amazed at the agility of the servers. The Filet Mignon melts in your mouth and the W.R. Chicago Cut is not bad either. They can also put toppings on your steak - pepper or garlic. I've never tried it but it looks good! I hear the ground black pepper is super spicy. The side orders are HUGE - they are definitely made for sharing. Try any of the potato dishes (they're all super yummy!) and the Asparagus with Hollandaise Sauce is really good too. They have an extensive wine list and the servers are extremely knowledgeable so they can help choose the right one. The BEST thing on the menu is the Macadamia Turtle Pie - A MUST - YOU HAVE TO TRY IT IF YOU COME HERE!!! The piece of pie is around 12 pounds and it is made with Haagen Daaz vanilla ice cream, the crust is covered with macadamia nuts topped with caramel and chocolate. It is just so good and you just have to stuff yourself!!!

Not as impressed as I'd anticipated when I attended an event here recently.  We were seated in a private room upstairs with a pre-selected menu.  The breads were decent especially the raisin walnut.  The salad was forgettable - was similar to bagged salad mixes with a horribly sour vinagrette/italian dressing pre-doused.  Having been warned previously that Gibson's likes a good char (their style) on their meats and that the filet, being a leaner cut, tends to suffer from this grill style, I ordered the bone-in veal chop from a selection of the filet, veal chop or salmon.  I had also learned earlier that they often overcook your request; I ordered my usual medium-rare and got it medium.  Everyone else at my table (aside from one salmon) ordered the filet.  I warned them that medium or medium-well was a bad idea; Nobody listened and they all ended up with overcooked steaks.  The "best" steak to order at Gibson's is the bone-in ribeye, medium-rare, which will come out best with their char-style "over" grilling.  Interestingly enough, their sides were somewhat uninteresting (as is with most traditional steakhouses); We sampled the twice-baked potato, asparagus and spinach/grilled onion/mushroom dish.  Valet's $10 and fairly swift.  Since we were in a private room, I can't speak to the ambiance of the main dining room.  Bar was decent - I had a fair grey goose martini (can't really mess that up too bad) - nicely chilled glass and well-shaken martini (olives were bad though).  I miss the steaks in Texas, sigh...  Sampled the mock-turtle and key lime pies; Excellent desserts and the slices really ARE huge - probably 1/4 - 1/5 of a pie tin per slice.

Very expensive steak restaurant in the gold coast.  Great food with large portions.  You have to try the carrot cake they give you a HUGE slice enough for more than two people.   The bar downstairs is a great afterwork or weekend hang out spot.

I can only say what was said before....Great Steak House and the perfect location for a night on the town.  I really can't even decided what my favorite entry is here, but each of them are soooo cooked to perfection, (The twice baked potato's are yummy too) You must try the chocolate cake here, even if you don't like deserts you will LOVE the cake.  Like I said great location, right in the heart of Chicago's "Gold Coast".  Take your date out for some steak at Gibson's then check out one of the many lounges or clubs in the area. A+++ service too!  Good times always here =)

The chopped liver appetizer here is awesome.  The steaks are pretty good as well.  It's a real scene and makes for some fun people watching.  If you go to the bar you can check out a lot of sleazy out of town business types. It's always a fun scene.  However, I think it's more of an entertaining out of town clients place than a dinner for two place.  It's a bit loud and hectic.

happy points: a grand display of the uncooked meats beforehand with a detailed explanation as to what each one meant.  i had never put so much thought into my slice of meat before.  we went for the tender cut.  it was good.  but i wasn't floored by the flavorings - slightly bland -  bad, expecially when you're expecting to get your tastebuds tickled by a 5-star steakhouse (4-star?).  anyway, major props for service and for the attendant sitting the restroom and for the gum/mints available in the bathroom.  sad points: i was wrestling with my steak knife to spread butter on my bread, and after a certain point, i decided that a butter knife would accomplish the task in a much more streamlined fashion.  so i asked our congenial waiter for a butter knife.  his response: we don't have any.  WHAT?  after all that [minor] frustration, i can't even get a butter knife at a restaurant that practically gets the foot traffic of disney world?  it was hard to hide my shock, disbelief, and disappointment.  anyway, the sides were nothing crazily impressive, but since one of the sides had something i didn't like (mushrooms), they cooked them separately from the rest of it and gave us two little plates so that my date could eat the mushrooms without having to pick them out (or watch me pick them out).  so i guess that's a happy point.

Good food, but it's mostly about the scene here. Loud, boisterous, obnoxious. And that's just the menu.  Seriously, huge portions and prices, solid steaks and seafood. Sides and desserts could feed entire African villages. Attentive service, but it gets lost in the shuffle. Throw the valet an extra $20 to keep your sportscar up front and impress the golddiggers that hang out at the bar, hoping the nice board of trade types will buy them a martini.  If you aren't looking to be seen, or want to get a word in edgewise, this place isn't for you.  If you want to watch some of Chicago's supposed A-list in action, belly up to the bar.  Reservations are essential unless you like long elbow-to-elbow waits in a bar where half the people are dining at bar tables far too tiny for the mammoth foodstuffs.  There are better steakhouses in Chicago, but this one has the best PR company.   Good place to spot Bears (current and former), Bulls, and Cubs, oh, my.  All you NBA groupies, this is a good spot to troll for roundball players. Pro athletes of any type, actually.  Let the games begin.

While Gibson's might be the most expensive steakhouse in the city, it's hard to beat.  The service is impecable (every table has two servers), and the quality of the meat cannot be rivaled.  This, for me, is a once per year type of place.  The last time I went to Gibson's, I was wearing a Spiderman suit...but that's a story for another time...

A Chicago insitituion that's becoming a chain.  I know a lot of people who will be upset once there's no more cigar smoking there.  Great food, fun server's.  If you're from out of town and have some money burning a hole in your pocket, go here.

When you date an almost-vegetarian, you don't go to places like this much. I did once though, and it was pretty good. It's not my crowd, but can't complain about the food and service. I've had better for the price though.

This is a good steakhouse in any other city BUT Chicago. Too many great spots to even call Gibsons a top 5 steakhouse in Chicagoland. Enjoy the people watching at the Bar, but save your money as this is more of a business dinner/tourist trap spot.
One of the best date places I've been to the steak was great! Peppercorn!
Great steak restaurant, probably the best steak in Chicago.  Great twice baked potatos too, although the sides can be a little pricey.

This is definitely a once in a while type place, unless you are loaded and a serious carnivore.  The steaks here are incredible and their twice baked potatoes are most worth it.  They have a great bar with excellent service and killer martinis too!

One of the best steakhouses I have ever been to.  I make sure to get there every time I am in Chicago.  Old school - but in that classy way.  Hands down the best martini I have ever had in my life - crisp, dry, icy cold.  My friend who doesn't like them, had a sip of mine and promptly ordered one of her own. The portions are HUGE - so be sure to take your midWest appetite.

One of the best steak houses in the city. One, take in mind I think there are 3 other ones that are just as good. Great location, great atmosphere. Be prepared to spend some money but worh every penny.

ONe of Chicago's best steakhouses - they have the best peppercorn steak around; the atmosphere is always classy but casual; the bar is great with a variety of wines.  For a side - get their twice baked potato and you have to get either their steak of lobster here - or get both!!
